                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come, 'tis only I that must disgrace thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Here they fight</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Heavens, can you suffer hell so to prevail?</div>
                     <div class="line">My breast I'll burst with straining of my courage</div>
                     <div class="line">And from my shoulders crack my arms asunder.</div>
                     <div class="line">But I will chastise this high-minded strumpet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>They fight again</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Talbot, farewell; thy hour is not yet come:</div>
                     <div class="line">I must go victual Orleans forthwith.</div>
                     <p>A short alarum; then enter the town with soldiers</p>
                     <div class="line">O'ertake me, if thou canst; I scorn thy strength.</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, go, cheer up thy hungry-starved men;</div>
                     <div class="line">Help Salisbury to make his testament:</div>
                     <div class="line">This day is ours, as many more shall be.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">My thoughts are whirled like a potter's wheel;</div>
                     <div class="line">I know not where I am, nor what I do;</div>
                     <div class="line">A witch, by fear, not force, like Hannibal,</div>
                     <div class="line">Drives back our troops and conquers as she lists:</div>
                     <div class="line">So bees with smoke and doves with noisome stench</div>
                     <div class="line">Are from their hives and houses driven away.</div>
                     <div class="line">They call'd us for our fierceness English dogs;</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, like to whelps, we crying run away.</div>
                     <p>A short alarum</p>
                     <div class="line">Hark, countrymen! either renew the fight,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or tear the lions out of England's coat;</div>
                     <div class="line">Renounce your soil, give sheep in lions' stead:</div>
                     <div class="line">Sheep run not half so treacherous from the wolf,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or horse or oxen from the leopard,</div>
                     <div class="line">As you fly from your oft-subdued slaves.</div>
                     <p>Alarum. Here another skirmish</p>
                     <div class="line">It will not be: retire into your trenches:</div>
                     <div class="line">You all consented unto Salisbury's death,</div>
                     <div class="line">For none would strike a stroke in his revenge.</div>
                     <div class="line">Pucelle is enter'd into Orleans,</div>
                     <div class="line">In spite of us or aught that we could do.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, would I were to die with Salisbury!</div>
                     <div class="line">The shame hereof will make me hide my head.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit TALBOT. Alarum; retreat; flourish</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.7">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>6. SCENE VI.  The same.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter, on the walls, JOAN LA PUCELLE, CHARLES,
REIGNIER, ALENCON, and Soldiers</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Advance our waving colours on the walls;</div>
                     <div class="line">Rescued is Orleans from the English</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus Joan la Pucelle hath perform'd her word.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Divinest creature, Astraea's daughter,</div>
                     <div class="line">How shall I honour thee for this success?</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy promises are like Adonis' gardens</div>
                     <div class="line">That one day bloom'd and fruitful were the next.</div>
                     <div class="line">France, triumph in thy glorious prophetess!</div>
                     <div class="line">Recover'd is the town of Orleans:</div>
                     <div class="line">More blessed hap did ne'er befall our state.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                     <div class="line">Why ring not out the bells aloud throughout the town?</div>
                     <div class="line">Dauphin, command the citizens make bonfires</div>
                     <div class="line">And feast and banquet in the open streets,</div>
                     <div class="line">To celebrate the joy that God hath given us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALENCON</div>
                     <div class="line">All France will be replete with mirth and joy,</div>
                     <div class="line">When they shall hear how we have play'd the men.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis Joan, not we, by whom the day is won;</div>
                     <div class="line">For which I will divide my crown with her,</div>
                     <div class="line">And all the priests and friars in my realm</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall in procession sing her endless praise.</div>
                     <div class="line">A statelier pyramis to her I'll rear</div>
                     <div class="line">Than Rhodope's or Memphis' ever was:</div>
                     <div class="line">In memory of her when she is dead,</div>
                     <div class="line">Her ashes, in an urn more precious</div>
                     <div class="line">Than the rich-jewel'd of Darius,</div>
                     <div class="line">Transported shall be at high festivals</div>
                     <div class="line">Before the kings and queens of France.</div>
                     <div class="line">No longer on Saint Denis will we cry,</div>
                     <div class="line">But Joan la Pucelle shall be France's saint.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come in, and let us banquet royally,</div>
                     <div class="line">After this golden day of victory.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Flourish. Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.4">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 2. ACT II</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. SCENE I.  Before Orleans.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE II.  Orleans. Within the town.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.4">3. SCENE III.  Auvergne. The COUNTESS's castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.5">4. SCENE IV.  London. The Temple-garden.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.6">5. SCENE V.  The Tower of London.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Before Orleans.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Sergeant of a band with two Sentinels</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Sergeant</div>
                     <div class="line">Sirs, take your places and be vigilant:</div>
                     <div class="line">If any noise or soldier you perceive</div>
                     <div class="line">Near to the walls, by some apparent sign</div>
                     <div class="line">Let us have knowledge at the court of guard.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Sentinel</div>
                     <div class="line">Sergeant, you shall.</div>
                     <p>Exit Sergeant</p>
                     <div class="line">Thus are poor servitors,</div>
                     <div class="line">When others sleep upon their quiet beds,</div>
                     <div class="line">Constrain'd to watch in darkness, rain and cold.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter TALBOT, BEDFORD, BURGUNDY, and Forces, with
scaling-ladders, their drums beating a dead march</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord Regent, and redoubted Burgundy,</div>
                     <div class="line">By whose approach the regions of Artois,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wallon and Picardy are friends to us,</div>
                     <div class="line">This happy night the Frenchmen are secure,</div>
                     <div class="line">Having all day caroused and banqueted:</div>
                     <div class="line">Embrace we then this opportunity</div>
                     <div class="line">As fitting best to quittance their deceit</div>
                     <div class="line">Contrived by art and baleful sorcery.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEDFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Coward of France! how much he wrongs his fame,</div>
                     <div class="line">Despairing of his own arm's fortitude,</div>
                     <div class="line">To join with witches and the help of hell!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                     <div class="line">Traitors have never other company.</div>
                     <div class="line">But what's that Pucelle whom they term so pure?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">A maid, they say.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEDFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">A maid! and be so martial!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray God she prove not masculine ere long,</div>
                     <div class="line">If underneath the standard of the French</div>
                     <div class="line">She carry armour as she hath begun.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, let them practise and converse with spirits:</div>
                     <div class="line">God is our fortress, in whose conquering name</div>
                     <div class="line">Let us resolve to scale their flinty bulwarks.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEDFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Ascend, brave Talbot; we will follow thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Not all together: better far, I guess,</div>
                     <div class="line">That we do make our entrance several ways;</div>
                     <div class="line">That, if it chance the one of us do fail,</div>
                     <div class="line">The other yet may rise against their force.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEDFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Agreed: I'll to yond corner.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                     <div class="line">And I to this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">And here will Talbot mount, or make his grave.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, Salisbury, for thee, and for the right</div>
                     <div class="line">Of English Henry, shall this night appear</div>
                     <div class="line">How much in duty I am bound to both.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Sentinels</div>
                     <div class="line">Arm! arm! the enemy doth make assault!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Cry: 'St. George,' 'A Talbot.'</p>
               <p>The French leap over the walls in their shirts.
Enter, several ways, the BASTARD OF ORLEANS,
ALENCON, and REIGNIER, half ready, and half unready</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALENCON</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, my lords! what, all unready so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD OF ORLEANS</div>
                     <div class="line">Unready! ay, and glad we 'scaped so well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twas time, I trow, to wake and leave our beds,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hearing alarums at our chamber-doors.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALENCON</div>
                     <div class="line">Of all exploits since first I follow'd arms,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ne'er heard I of a warlike enterprise</div>
                     <div class="line">More venturous or desperate than this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD OF ORLEANS</div>
                     <div class="line">I think this Talbot be a fiend of hell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                     <div class="line">If not of hell, the heavens, sure, favour him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALENCON</div>
                     <div class="line">Here cometh Charles: I marvel how he sped.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD OF ORLEANS</div>
                     <div class="line">Tut, holy Joan was his defensive guard.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CHARLES and JOAN LA PUCELLE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Is this thy cunning, thou deceitful dame?</div>
                     <div class="line">Didst thou at first, to flatter us withal,</div>
                     <div class="line">Make us partakers of a little gain,</div>
                     <div class="line">That now our loss might be ten times so much?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherefore is Charles impatient with his friend!</div>
                     <div class="line">At all times will you have my power alike?</div>
                     <div class="line">Sleeping or waking must I still prevail,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or will you blame and lay the fault on me?</div>
                     <div class="line">Improvident soldiers! had your watch been good,</div>
                     <div class="line">This sudden mischief never could have fall'n.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Duke of Alencon, this was your default,</div>
                     <div class="line">That, being captain of the watch to-night,</div>
                     <div class="line">Did look no better to that weighty charge.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALENCON</div>
                     <div class="line">Had all your quarters been as safely kept</div>
                     <div class="line">As that whereof I had the government,</div>
                     <div class="line">We had not been thus shamefully surprised.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD OF ORLEANS</div>
                     <div class="line">Mine was secure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                     <div class="line">And so was mine, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">And, for myself, most part of all this night,</div>
                     <div class="line">Within her quarter and mine own precinct</div>
                     <div class="line">I was employ'd in passing to and fro,</div>
                     <div class="line">About relieving of the sentinels:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then how or which way should they first break in?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Question, my lords, no further of the case,</div>
                     <div class="line">How or which way: 'tis sure they found some place</div>
                     <div class="line">But weakly guarded, where the breach was made.</div>
                     <div class="line">And now there rests no other shift but this;</div>
                     <div class="line">To gather our soldiers, scatter'd and dispersed,</div>
                     <div class="line">And lay new platforms to endamage them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Alarum. Enter an English Soldier, crying 'A
Talbot! a Talbot!' They fly, leaving their
clothes behind</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll be so bold to take what they have left.</div>
                     <div class="line">The cry of Talbot serves me for a sword;</div>
                     <div class="line">For I have loaden me with many spoils,</div>
                     <div class="line">Using no other weapon but his name.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Orleans. Within the town.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter TALBOT, BEDFORD, BURGUNDY, a Captain, and others</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEDFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">The day begins to break, and night is fled,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose pitchy mantle over-veil'd the earth.</div>
                     <div class="line">Here sound retreat, and cease our hot pursuit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Retreat sounded</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Bring forth the body of old Salisbury,</div>
                     <div class="line">And here advance it in the market-place,</div>
                     <div class="line">The middle centre of this cursed town.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now have I paid my vow unto his soul;</div>
                     <div class="line">For every drop of blood was drawn from him,</div>
                     <div class="line">There hath at least five Frenchmen died tonight.</div>
                     <div class="line">And that hereafter ages may behold</div>
                     <div class="line">What ruin happen'd in revenge of him,</div>
                     <div class="line">Within their chiefest temple I'll erect</div>
                     <div class="line">A tomb, wherein his corpse shall be interr'd:</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the which, that every one may read,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall be engraved the sack of Orleans,</div>
                     <div class="line">The treacherous manner of his mournful death</div>
                     <div class="line">And what a terror he had been to France.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, lords, in all our bloody massacre,</div>
                     <div class="line">I muse we met not with the Dauphin's grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">His new-come champion, virtuous Joan of Arc,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor any of his false confederates.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEDFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis thought, Lord Talbot, when the fight began,</div>
                     <div class="line">Roused on the sudden from their drowsy beds,</div>
                     <div class="line">They did amongst the troops of armed men</div>
                     <div class="line">Leap o'er the walls for refuge in the field.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                     <div class="line">Myself, as far as I could well discern</div>
                     <div class="line">For smoke and dusky vapours of the night,</div>
                     <div class="line">Am sure I scared the Dauphin and his trull,</div>
                     <div class="line">When arm in arm they both came swiftly running,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like to a pair of loving turtle-doves</div>
                     <div class="line">That could not live asunder day or night.</div>
                     <div class="line">After that things are set in order here,</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll follow them with all the power we have.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">All hail, my lords! which of this princely train</div>
                     <div class="line">Call ye the warlike Talbot, for his acts</div>
                     <div class="line">So much applauded through the realm of France?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Here is the Talbot: who would speak with him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">The virtuous lady, Countess of Auvergne,</div>
                     <div class="line">With modesty admiring thy renown,</div>
                     <div class="line">By me entreats, great lord, thou wouldst vouchsafe</div>
                     <div class="line">To visit her poor castle where she lies,</div>
                     <div class="line">That she may boast she hath beheld the man</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose glory fills the world with loud report.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it even so? Nay, then, I see our wars</div>
                     <div class="line">Will turn unto a peaceful comic sport,</div>
                     <div class="line">When ladies crave to be encounter'd with.</div>
                     <div class="line">You may not, my lord, despise her gentle suit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Ne'er trust me then; for when a world of men</div>
                     <div class="line">Could not prevail with all their oratory,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet hath a woman's kindness over-ruled:</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore tell her I return great thanks,</div>
                     <div class="line">And in submission will attend on her.</div>
                     <div class="line">Will not your honours bear me company?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEDFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">No, truly; it is more than manners will:</div>
                     <div class="line">And I have heard it said, unbidden guests</div>
                     <div class="line">Are often welcomest when they are gone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Well then, alone, since there's no remedy,</div>
                     <div class="line">I mean to prove this lady's courtesy.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come hither, captain.</div>
                     <p>Whispers</p>
                     <div class="line">You perceive my mind?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">I do, my lord, and mean accordingly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  Auvergne. The COUNTESS's castle.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter the COUNTESS and her Porter</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS OF AUVERGNE</div>
                     <div class="line">Porter, remember what I gave in charge;</div>
                     <div class="line">And when you have done so, bring the keys to me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Porter</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, I will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS OF AUVERGNE</div>
                     <div class="line">The plot is laid: if all things fall out right,</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall as famous be by this exploit</div>
                     <div class="line">As Scythian Tomyris by Cyrus' death.</div>
                     <div class="line">Great is the rumor of this dreadful knight,</div>
                     <div class="line">And his achievements of no less account:</div>
                     <div class="line">Fain would mine eyes be witness with mine ears,</div>
                     <div class="line">To give their censure of these rare reports.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Messenger and TALBOT</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam,</div>
                     <div class="line">According as your ladyship desired,</div>
                     <div class="line">By message craved, so is Lord Talbot come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS OF AUVERGNE</div>
                     <div class="line">And he is welcome. What! is this the man?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, it is.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS OF AUVERGNE</div>
                     <div class="line">Is this the scourge of France?</div>
                     <div class="line">Is this the Talbot, so much fear'd abroad</div>
                     <div class="line">That with his name the mothers still their babes?</div>
                     <div class="line">I see report is fabulous and false:</div>
                     <div class="line">I thought I should have seen some Hercules,</div>
                     <div class="line">A second Hector, for his grim aspect,</div>
                     <div class="line">And large proportion of his strong-knit limbs.</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, this is a child, a silly dwarf!</div>
                     <div class="line">It cannot be this weak and writhled shrimp</div>
                     <div class="line">Should strike such terror to his enemies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, I have been bold to trouble you;</div>
                     <div class="line">But since your ladyship is not at leisure,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll sort some other time to visit you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS OF AUVERGNE</div>
                     <div class="line">What means he now? Go ask him whither he goes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay, my Lord Talbot; for my lady craves</div>
                     <div class="line">To know the cause of your abrupt departure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, for that she's in a wrong belief,</div>
                     <div class="line">I go to certify her Talbot's here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter Porter with keys</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS OF AUVERGNE</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou be he, then art thou prisoner.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Prisoner! to whom?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS OF AUVERGNE</div>
                     <div class="line">To me, blood-thirsty lord;</div>
                     <div class="line">And for that cause I trained thee to my house.</div>
                     <div class="line">Long time thy shadow hath been thrall to me,</div>
                     <div class="line">For in my gallery thy picture hangs:</div>
                     <div class="line">But now the substance shall endure the like,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I will chain these legs and arms of thine,</div>
                     <div class="line">That hast by tyranny these many years</div>
                     <div class="line">Wasted our country, slain our citizens</div>
                     <div class="line">And sent our sons and husbands captivate.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha, ha, ha!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS OF AUVERGNE</div>
                     <div class="line">Laughest thou, wretch? thy mirth shall turn to moan.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">I laugh to see your ladyship so fond</div>
                     <div class="line">To think that you have aught but Talbot's shadow</div>
                     <div class="line">Whereon to practise your severity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS OF AUVERGNE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, art not thou the man?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">I am indeed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS OF AUVERGNE</div>
                     <div class="line">Then have I substance too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">No, no, I am but shadow of myself:</div>
                     <div class="line">You are deceived, my substance is not here;</div>
                     <div class="line">For what you see is but the smallest part</div>
                     <div class="line">And least proportion of humanity:</div>
                     <div class="line">I tell you, madam, were the whole frame here,</div>
                     <div class="line">It is of such a spacious lofty pitch,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your roof were not sufficient to contain't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS OF AUVERGNE</div>
                     <div class="line">This is a riddling merchant for the nonce;</div>
                     <div class="line">He will be here, and yet he is not here:</div>
                     <div class="line">How can these contrarieties agree?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">That will I show you presently.</div>
                     <p>Winds his horn. Drums strike up: a peal of
ordnance. Enter soldiers</p>
                     <div class="line">How say you, madam? are you now persuaded</div>
                     <div class="line">That Talbot is but shadow of himself?</div>
                     <div class="line">These are his substance, sinews, arms and strength,</div>
                     <div class="line">With which he yoketh your rebellious necks,</div>
                     <div class="line">Razeth your cities and subverts your towns</div>
                     <div class="line">And in a moment makes them desolate.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS OF AUVERGNE</div>
                     <div class="line">Victorious Talbot! pardon my abuse:</div>
                     <div class="line">I find thou art no less than fame hath bruited</div>
                     <div class="line">And more than may be gather'd by thy shape.</div>
                     <div class="line">Let my presumption not provoke thy wrath;</div>
                     <div class="line">For I am sorry that with reverence</div>
                     <div class="line">I did not entertain thee as thou art.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Be not dismay'd, fair lady; nor misconstrue</div>
                     <div class="line">The mind of Talbot, as you did mistake</div>
                     <div class="line">The outward composition of his body.</div>
                     <div class="line">What you have done hath not offended me;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor other satisfaction do I crave,</div>
                     <div class="line">But only, with your patience, that we may</div>
                     <div class="line">Taste of your wine and see what cates you have;</div>
                     <div class="line">For soldiers' stomachs always serve them well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS OF AUVERGNE</div>
                     <div class="line">With all my heart, and think me honoured</div>
                     <div class="line">To feast so great a warrior in my house.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  London. The Temple-garden.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter the Earls of SOMERSET, SUFFOLK, and WARWICK;
RICHARD PLANTAGENET, VERNON, and another Lawyer</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">Great lords and gentlemen, what means this silence?</div>
                     <div class="line">Dare no man answer in a case of truth?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Within the Temple-hall we were too loud;</div>
                     <div class="line">The garden here is more convenient.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">Then say at once if I maintain'd the truth;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or else was wrangling Somerset in the error?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, I have been a truant in the law,</div>
                     <div class="line">And never yet could frame my will to it;</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore frame the law unto my will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">Judge you, my Lord of Warwick, then, between us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Between two hawks, which flies the higher pitch;</div>
                     <div class="line">Between two dogs, which hath the deeper mouth;</div>
                     <div class="line">Between two blades, which bears the better temper:</div>
                     <div class="line">Between two horses, which doth bear him best;</div>
                     <div class="line">Between two girls, which hath the merriest eye;</div>
                     <div class="line">I have perhaps some shallow spirit of judgement;</div>
                     <div class="line">But in these nice sharp quillets of the law,</div>
                     <div class="line">Good faith, I am no wiser than a daw.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">Tut, tut, here is a mannerly forbearance:</div>
                     <div class="line">The truth appears so naked on my side</div>
                     <div class="line">That any purblind eye may find it out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">And on my side it is so well apparell'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">So clear, so shining and so evident</div>
                     <div class="line">That it will glimmer through a blind man's eye.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">Since you are tongue-tied and so loath to speak,</div>
                     <div class="line">In dumb significants proclaim your thoughts:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let him that is a true-born gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">And stands upon the honour of his birth,</div>
                     <div class="line">If he suppose that I have pleaded truth,</div>
                     <div class="line">From off this brier pluck a white rose with me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">Let him that is no coward nor no flatterer,</div>
                     <div class="line">But dare maintain the party of the truth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Pluck a red rose from off this thorn with me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">I love no colours, and without all colour</div>
                     <div class="line">Of base insinuating flattery</div>
                     <div class="line">I pluck this white rose with Plantagenet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">I pluck this red rose with young Somerset</div>
                     <div class="line">And say withal I think he held the right.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay, lords and gentlemen, and pluck no more,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till you conclude that he upon whose side</div>
                     <div class="line">The fewest roses are cropp'd from the tree</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall yield the other in the right opinion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">Good Master Vernon, it is well objected:</div>
                     <div class="line">If I have fewest, I subscribe in silence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">And I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                     <div class="line">Then for the truth and plainness of the case.</div>
                     <div class="line">I pluck this pale and maiden blossom here,</div>
                     <div class="line">Giving my verdict on the white rose side.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">Prick not your finger as you pluck it off,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest bleeding you do paint the white rose red</div>
                     <div class="line">And fall on my side so, against your will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                     <div class="line">If I my lord, for my opinion bleed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Opinion shall be surgeon to my hurt</div>
                     <div class="line">And keep me on the side where still I am.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, well, come on: who else?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lawyer</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless my study and my books be false,</div>
                     <div class="line">The argument you held was wrong in you:</div>
                     <p>To SOMERSET</p>
                     <div class="line">In sign whereof I pluck a white rose too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, Somerset, where is your argument?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">Here in my scabbard, meditating that</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall dye your white rose in a bloody red.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">Meantime your cheeks do counterfeit our roses;</div>
                     <div class="line">For pale they look with fear, as witnessing</div>
                     <div class="line">The truth on our side.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">No, Plantagenet,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis not for fear but anger that thy cheeks</div>
                     <div class="line">Blush for pure shame to counterfeit our roses,</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet thy tongue will not confess thy error.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath not thy rose a canker, Somerset?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath not thy rose a thorn, Plantagenet?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, sharp and piercing, to maintain his truth;</div>
                     <div class="line">Whiles thy consuming canker eats his falsehood.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, I'll find friends to wear my bleeding roses,</div>
                     <div class="line">That shall maintain what I have said is true,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where false Plantagenet dare not be seen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, by this maiden blossom in my hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">I scorn thee and thy fashion, peevish boy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Turn not thy scorns this way, Plantagenet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">Proud Pole, I will, and scorn both him and thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll turn my part thereof into thy throat.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">Away, away, good William de la Pole!</div>
                     <div class="line">We grace the yeoman by conversing with him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, by God's will, thou wrong'st him, Somerset;</div>
                     <div class="line">His grandfather was Lionel Duke of Clarence,</div>
                     <div class="line">Third son to the third Edward King of England:</div>
                     <div class="line">Spring crestless yeomen from so deep a root?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">He bears him on the place's privilege,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or durst not, for his craven heart, say thus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">By him that made me, I'll maintain my words</div>
                     <div class="line">On any plot of ground in Christendom.</div>
                     <div class="line">Was not thy father, Richard Earl of Cambridge,</div>
                     <div class="line">For treason executed in our late king's days?</div>
                     <div class="line">And, by his treason, stand'st not thou attainted,</div>
                     <div class="line">Corrupted, and exempt from ancient gentry?</div>
                     <div class="line">His trespass yet lives guilty in thy blood;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, till thou be restored, thou art a yeoman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">My father was attached, not attainted,</div>
                     <div class="line">Condemn'd to die for treason, but no traitor;</div>
                     <div class="line">And that I'll prove on better men than Somerset,</div>
                     <div class="line">Were growing time once ripen'd to my will.</div>
                     <div class="line">For your partaker Pole and you yourself,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll note you in my book of memory,</div>
                     <div class="line">To scourge you for this apprehension:</div>
                     <div class="line">Look to it well and say you are well warn'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, thou shalt find us ready for thee still;</div>
                     <div class="line">And know us by these colours for thy foes,</div>
                     <div class="line">For these my friends in spite of thee shall wear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">And, by my soul, this pale and angry rose,</div>
                     <div class="line">As cognizance of my blood-drinking hate,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will I for ever and my faction wear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Until it wither with me to my grave</div>
                     <div class="line">Or flourish to the height of my degree.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Go forward and be choked with thy ambition!</div>
                     <div class="line">And so farewell until I meet thee next.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">Have with thee, Pole. Farewell, ambitious Richard.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">How I am braved and must perforce endure it!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">This blot that they object against your house</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall be wiped out in the next parliament</div>
                     <div class="line">Call'd for the truce of Winchester and Gloucester;</div>
                     <div class="line">And if thou be not then created York,</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not live to be accounted Warwick.</div>
                     <div class="line">Meantime, in signal of my love to thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Against proud Somerset and William Pole,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will I upon thy party wear this rose:</div>
                     <div class="line">And here I prophesy: this brawl to-day,</div>
                     <div class="line">Grown to this faction in the Temple-garden,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall send between the red rose and the white</div>
                     <div class="line">A thousand souls to death and deadly night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">Good Master Vernon, I am bound to you,</div>
                     <div class="line">That you on my behalf would pluck a flower.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                     <div class="line">In your behalf still will I wear the same.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lawyer</div>
                     <div class="line">And so will I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">Thanks, gentle sir.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, let us four to dinner: I dare say</div>
                     <div class="line">This quarrel will drink blood another day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.6">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>5. SCENE V.  The Tower of London.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter MORTIMER, brought in a chair, and Gaolers</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MORTIMER</div>
                     <div class="line">Kind keepers of my weak decaying age,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let dying Mortimer here rest himself.</div>
                     <div class="line">Even like a man new haled from the rack,</div>
                     <div class="line">So fare my limbs with long imprisonment.</div>
                     <div class="line">And these grey locks, the pursuivants of death,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nestor-like aged in an age of care,</div>
                     <div class="line">Argue the end of Edmund Mortimer.</div>
                     <div class="line">These eyes, like lamps whose wasting oil is spent,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wax dim, as drawing to their exigent;</div>
                     <div class="line">Weak shoulders, overborne with burthening grief,</div>
                     <div class="line">And pithless arms, like to a wither'd vine</div>
                     <div class="line">That droops his sapless branches to the ground;</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet are these feet, whose strengthless stay is numb,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unable to support this lump of clay,</div>
                     <div class="line">Swift-winged with desire to get a grave,</div>
                     <div class="line">As witting I no other comfort have.</div>
                     <div class="line">But tell me, keeper, will my nephew come?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gaoler</div>
                     <div class="line">Richard Plantagenet, my lord, will come:</div>
                     <div class="line">We sent unto the Temple, unto his chamber;</div>
                     <div class="line">And answer was return'd that he will come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MORTIMER</div>
                     <div class="line">Enough: my soul shall then be satisfied.</div>
                     <div class="line">Poor gentleman! his wrong doth equal mine.</div>
                     <div class="line">Since Henry Monmouth first began to reign,</div>
                     <div class="line">Before whose glory I was great in arms,</div>
                     <div class="line">This loathsome sequestration have I had:</div>
                     <div class="line">And even since then hath Richard been obscured,</div>
                     <div class="line">Deprived of honour and inheritance.</div>
                     <div class="line">But now the arbitrator of despairs,</div>
                     <div class="line">Just death, kind umpire of men's miseries,</div>
                     <div class="line">With sweet enlargement doth dismiss me hence:</div>
                     <div class="line">I would his troubles likewise were expired,</div>
                     <div class="line">That so he might recover what was lost.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter RICHARD PLANTAGENET</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gaoler</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, your loving nephew now is come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MORTIMER</div>
                     <div class="line">Richard Plantagenet, my friend, is he come?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, noble uncle, thus ignobly used,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your nephew, late despised Richard, comes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MORTIMER</div>
                     <div class="line">Direct mine arms I may embrace his neck,</div>
                     <div class="line">And in his bosom spend my latter gasp:</div>
                     <div class="line">O, tell me when my lips do touch his cheeks,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I may kindly give one fainting kiss.</div>
                     <div class="line">And now declare, sweet stem from York's great stock,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why didst thou say, of late thou wert despised?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">First, lean thine aged back against mine arm;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, in that ease, I'll tell thee my disease.</div>
                     <div class="line">This day, in argument upon a case,</div>
                     <div class="line">Some words there grew 'twixt Somerset and me;</div>
                     <div class="line">Among which terms he used his lavish tongue</div>
                     <div class="line">And did upbraid me with my father's death:</div>
                     <div class="line">Which obloquy set bars before my tongue,</div>
                     <div class="line">Else with the like I had requited him.</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, good uncle, for my father's sake,</div>
                     <div class="line">In honour of a true Plantagenet</div>
                     <div class="line">And for alliance sake, declare the cause</div>
                     <div class="line">My father, Earl of Cambridge, lost his head.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MORTIMER</div>
                     <div class="line">That cause, fair nephew, that imprison'd me</div>
                     <div class="line">And hath detain'd me all my flowering youth</div>
                     <div class="line">Within a loathsome dungeon, there to pine,</div>
                     <div class="line">Was cursed instrument of his decease.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">Discover more at large what cause that was,</div>
                     <div class="line">For I am ignorant and cannot guess.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MORTIMER</div>
                     <div class="line">I will, if that my fading breath permit</div>
                     <div class="line">And death approach not ere my tale be done.</div>
                     <div class="line">Henry the Fourth, grandfather to this king,</div>
                     <div class="line">Deposed his nephew Richard, Edward's son,</div>
                     <div class="line">The first-begotten and the lawful heir,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Edward king, the third of that descent:</div>
                     <div class="line">During whose reign the Percies of the north,</div>
                     <div class="line">Finding his usurpation most unjust,</div>
                     <div class="line">Endeavor'd my advancement to the throne:</div>
                     <div class="line">The reason moved these warlike lords to this</div>
                     <div class="line">Was, for that--young King Richard thus removed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Leaving no heir begotten of his body--</div>
                     <div class="line">I was the next by birth and parentage;</div>
                     <div class="line">For by my mother I derived am</div>
                     <div class="line">From Lionel Duke of Clarence, the third son</div>
                     <div class="line">To King Edward the Third; whereas he</div>
                     <div class="line">From John of Gaunt doth bring his pedigree,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being but fourth of that heroic line.</div>
                     <div class="line">But mark: as in this haughty attempt</div>
                     <div class="line">They laboured to plant the rightful heir,</div>
                     <div class="line">I lost my liberty and they their lives.</div>
                     <div class="line">Long after this, when Henry the Fifth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Succeeding his father Bolingbroke, did reign,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy father, Earl of Cambridge, then derived</div>
                     <div class="line">From famous Edmund Langley, Duke of York,</div>
                     <div class="line">Marrying my sister that thy mother was,</div>
                     <div class="line">Again in pity of my hard distress</div>
                     <div class="line">Levied an army, weening to redeem</div>
                     <div class="line">And have install'd me in the diadem:</div>
                     <div class="line">But, as the rest, so fell that noble earl</div>
                     <div class="line">And was beheaded. Thus the Mortimers,</div>
                     <div class="line">In whom the tide rested, were suppress'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">Of which, my lord, your honour is the last.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MORTIMER</div>
                     <div class="line">True; and thou seest that I no issue have</div>
                     <div class="line">And that my fainting words do warrant death;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art my heir; the rest I wish thee gather:</div>
                     <div class="line">But yet be wary in thy studious care.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy grave admonishments prevail with me:</div>
                     <div class="line">But yet, methinks, my father's execution</div>
                     <div class="line">Was nothing less than bloody tyranny.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MORTIMER</div>
                     <div class="line">With silence, nephew, be thou politic:</div>
                     <div class="line">Strong-fixed is the house of Lancaster,</div>
                     <div class="line">And like a mountain, not to be removed.</div>
                     <div class="line">But now thy uncle is removing hence:</div>
                     <div class="line">As princes do their courts, when they are cloy'd</div>
                     <div class="line">With long continuance in a settled place.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">O, uncle, would some part of my young years</div>
                     <div class="line">Might but redeem the passage of your age!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MORTIMER</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou dost then wrong me, as that slaughterer doth</div>
                     <div class="line">Which giveth many wounds when one will kill.</div>
                     <div class="line">Mourn not, except thou sorrow for my good;</div>
                     <div class="line">Only give order for my funeral:</div>
                     <div class="line">And so farewell, and fair be all thy hopes</div>
                     <div class="line">And prosperous be thy life in peace and war!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Dies</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">And peace, no war, befall thy parting soul!</div>
                     <div class="line">In prison hast thou spent a pilgrimage</div>
                     <div class="line">And like a hermit overpass'd thy days.</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, I will lock his counsel in my breast;</div>
                     <div class="line">And what I do imagine let that rest.</div>
                     <div class="line">Keepers, convey him hence, and I myself</div>
                     <div class="line">Will see his burial better than his life.</div>
                     <p>Exeunt Gaolers, bearing out the body of MORTIMER</p>
                     <div class="line">Here dies the dusky torch of Mortimer,</div>
                     <div class="line">Choked with ambition of the meaner sort:</div>
                     <div class="line">And for those wrongs, those bitter injuries,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which Somerset hath offer'd to my house:</div>
                     <div class="line">I doubt not but with honour to redress;</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore haste I to the parliament,</div>
                     <div class="line">Either to be restored to my blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or make my ill the advantage of my good.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
         </article>
