         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.5">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 3. ACT III</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.2">1. SCENE I.  London. The Parliament-house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.3">2. SCENE II.  France. Before Rouen.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.4">3. SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.5">4. SCENE IV.  Paris. The palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  London. The Parliament-house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Flourish. Enter KING HENRY VI, EXETER, GLOUCESTER,
WARWICK, SOMERSET, and SUFFOLK; the BISHOP OF
WINCHESTER, RICHARD PLANTAGENET, and others.
GLOUCESTER offers to put up a bill; BISHOP OF
WINCHESTER snatches it, and tears it</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF WINCHESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Comest thou with deep premeditated lines,</div>
                     <div class="line">With written pamphlets studiously devised,</div>
                     <div class="line">Humphrey of Gloucester? If thou canst accuse,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or aught intend'st to lay unto my charge,</div>
                     <div class="line">Do it without invention, suddenly;</div>
                     <div class="line">As I with sudden and extemporal speech</div>
                     <div class="line">Purpose to answer what thou canst object.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Presumptuous priest! this place commands my patience,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or thou shouldst find thou hast dishonour'd me.</div>
                     <div class="line">Think not, although in writing I preferr'd</div>
                     <div class="line">The manner of thy vile outrageous crimes,</div>
                     <div class="line">That therefore I have forged, or am not able</div>
                     <div class="line">Verbatim to rehearse the method of my pen:</div>
                     <div class="line">No, prelate; such is thy audacious wickedness,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy lewd, pestiferous and dissentious pranks,</div>
                     <div class="line">As very infants prattle of thy pride.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art a most pernicious usurer,</div>
                     <div class="line">Forward by nature, enemy to peace;</div>
                     <div class="line">Lascivious, wanton, more than well beseems</div>
                     <div class="line">A man of thy profession and degree;</div>
                     <div class="line">And for thy treachery, what's more manifest?</div>
                     <div class="line">In that thou laid'st a trap to take my life,</div>
                     <div class="line">As well at London bridge as at the Tower.</div>
                     <div class="line">Beside, I fear me, if thy thoughts were sifted,</div>
                     <div class="line">The king, thy sovereign, is not quite exempt</div>
                     <div class="line">From envious malice of thy swelling heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF WINCHESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Gloucester, I do defy thee. Lords, vouchsafe</div>
                     <div class="line">To give me hearing what I shall reply.</div>
                     <div class="line">If I were covetous, ambitious or perverse,</div>
                     <div class="line">As he will have me, how am I so poor?</div>
                     <div class="line">Or how haps it I seek not to advance</div>
                     <div class="line">Or raise myself, but keep my wonted calling?</div>
                     <div class="line">And for dissension, who preferreth peace</div>
                     <div class="line">More than I do?--except I be provoked.</div>
                     <div class="line">No, my good lords, it is not that offends;</div>
                     <div class="line">It is not that that hath incensed the duke:</div>
                     <div class="line">It is, because no one should sway but he;</div>
                     <div class="line">No one but he should be about the king;</div>
                     <div class="line">And that engenders thunder in his breast</div>
                     <div class="line">And makes him roar these accusations forth.</div>
                     <div class="line">But he shall know I am as good--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">As good!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou bastard of my grandfather!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF WINCHESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, lordly sir; for what are you, I pray,</div>
                     <div class="line">But one imperious in another's throne?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Am I not protector, saucy priest?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF WINCHESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">And am not I a prelate of the church?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, as an outlaw in a castle keeps</div>
                     <div class="line">And useth it to patronage his theft.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF WINCHESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Unreverent Gloster!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art reverent</div>
                     <div class="line">Touching thy spiritual function, not thy life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF WINCHESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Rome shall remedy this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Roam thither, then.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, it were your duty to forbear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, see the bishop be not overborne.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">Methinks my lord should be religious</div>
                     <div class="line">And know the office that belongs to such.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Methinks his lordship should be humbler;</div>
                     <div class="line">it fitteth not a prelate so to plead.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, when his holy state is touch'd so near.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">State holy or unhallow'd, what of that?</div>
                     <div class="line">Is not his grace protector to the king?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  Plantagenet, I see, must hold his tongue,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest it be said 'Speak, sirrah, when you should;</div>
                     <div class="line">Must your bold verdict enter talk with lords?'</div>
                     <div class="line">Else would I have a fling at Winchester.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Uncles of Gloucester and of Winchester,</div>
                     <div class="line">The special watchmen of our English weal,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would prevail, if prayers might prevail,</div>
                     <div class="line">To join your hearts in love and amity.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, what a scandal is it to our crown,</div>
                     <div class="line">That two such noble peers as ye should jar!</div>
                     <div class="line">Believe me, lords, my tender years can tell</div>
                     <div class="line">Civil dissension is a viperous worm</div>
                     <div class="line">That gnaws the bowels of the commonwealth.</div>
                     <p>A noise within, 'Down with the tawny-coats!'</p>
                     <div class="line">What tumult's this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">An uproar, I dare warrant,</div>
                     <div class="line">Begun through malice of the bishop's men.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>A noise again, 'Stones! stones!' Enter Mayor</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Mayor</div>
                     <div class="line">O, my good lords, and virtuous Henry,</div>
                     <div class="line">Pity the city of London, pity us!</div>
                     <div class="line">The bishop and the Duke of Gloucester's men,</div>
                     <div class="line">Forbidden late to carry any weapon,</div>
                     <div class="line">Have fill'd their pockets full of pebble stones</div>
                     <div class="line">And banding themselves in contrary parts</div>
                     <div class="line">Do pelt so fast at one another's pate</div>
                     <div class="line">That many have their giddy brains knock'd out:</div>
                     <div class="line">Our windows are broke down in every street</div>
                     <div class="line">And we for fear compell'd to shut our shops.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Serving-men, in skirmish, with bloody pates</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">We charge you, on allegiance to ourself,</div>
                     <div class="line">To hold your slaughtering hands and keep the peace.</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray, uncle Gloucester, mitigate this strife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Serving-man</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, if we be forbidden stones,</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll fall to it with our teeth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Serving-man</div>
                     <div class="line">Do what ye dare, we are as resolute.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Skirmish again</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">You of my household, leave this peevish broil</div>
                     <div class="line">And set this unaccustom'd fight aside.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Serving-man</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, we know your grace to be a man</div>
                     <div class="line">Just and upright; and, for your royal birth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Inferior to none but to his majesty:</div>
                     <div class="line">And ere that we will suffer such a prince,</div>
                     <div class="line">So kind a father of the commonweal,</div>
                     <div class="line">To be disgraced by an inkhorn mate,</div>
                     <div class="line">We and our wives and children all will fight</div>
                     <div class="line">And have our bodies slaughtered by thy foes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Serving-man</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, and the very parings of our nails</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall pitch a field when we are dead.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Begin again</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay, stay, I say!</div>
                     <div class="line">And if you love me, as you say you do,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me persuade you to forbear awhile.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">O, how this discord doth afflict my soul!</div>
                     <div class="line">Can you, my Lord of Winchester, behold</div>
                     <div class="line">My sighs and tears and will not once relent?</div>
                     <div class="line">Who should be pitiful, if you be not?</div>
                     <div class="line">Or who should study to prefer a peace.</div>
                     <div class="line">If holy churchmen take delight in broils?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Yield, my lord protector; yield, Winchester;</div>
                     <div class="line">Except you mean with obstinate repulse</div>
                     <div class="line">To slay your sovereign and destroy the realm.</div>
                     <div class="line">You see what mischief and what murder too</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath been enacted through your enmity;</div>
                     <div class="line">Then be at peace except ye thirst for blood.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF WINCHESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">He shall submit, or I will never yield.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Compassion on the king commands me stoop;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or I would see his heart out, ere the priest</div>
                     <div class="line">Should ever get that privilege of me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Behold, my Lord of Winchester, the duke</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath banish'd moody discontented fury,</div>
                     <div class="line">As by his smoothed brows it doth appear:</div>
                     <div class="line">Why look you still so stern and tragical?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, Winchester, I offer thee my hand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie, uncle Beaufort! I have heard you preach</div>
                     <div class="line">That malice was a great and grievous sin;</div>
                     <div class="line">And will not you maintain the thing you teach,</div>
                     <div class="line">But prove a chief offender in the same?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet king! the bishop hath a kindly gird.</div>
                     <div class="line">For shame, my lord of Winchester, relent!</div>
                     <div class="line">What, shall a child instruct you what to do?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF WINCHESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, Duke of Gloucester, I will yield to thee;</div>
                     <div class="line">Love for thy love and hand for hand I give.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  Ay, but, I fear me, with a hollow heart.--</div>
                     <div class="line">See here, my friends and loving countrymen,</div>
                     <div class="line">This token serveth for a flag of truce</div>
                     <div class="line">Betwixt ourselves and all our followers:</div>
                     <div class="line">So help me God, as I dissemble not!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF WINCHESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  So help me God, as I intend it not!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">O, loving uncle, kind Duke of Gloucester,</div>
                     <div class="line">How joyful am I made by this contract!</div>
                     <div class="line">Away, my masters! trouble us no more;</div>
                     <div class="line">But join in friendship, as your lords have done.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Serving-man</div>
                     <div class="line">Content: I'll to the surgeon's.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Serving-man</div>
                     <div class="line">And so will I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Serving-man</div>
                     <div class="line">And I will see what physic the tavern affords.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt Serving-men, Mayor, &c</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Accept this scroll, most gracious sovereign,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which in the right of Richard Plantagenet</div>
                     <div class="line">We do exhibit to your majesty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Well urged, my Lord of Warwick: or sweet prince,</div>
                     <div class="line">And if your grace mark every circumstance,</div>
                     <div class="line">You have great reason to do Richard right;</div>
                     <div class="line">Especially for those occasions</div>
                     <div class="line">At Eltham Place I told your majesty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">And those occasions, uncle, were of force:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, my loving lords, our pleasure is</div>
                     <div class="line">That Richard be restored to his blood.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Let Richard be restored to his blood;</div>
                     <div class="line">So shall his father's wrongs be recompensed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF WINCHESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">As will the rest, so willeth Winchester.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">If Richard will be true, not that alone</div>
                     <div class="line">But all the whole inheritance I give</div>
                     <div class="line">That doth belong unto the house of York,</div>
                     <div class="line">From whence you spring by lineal descent.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy humble servant vows obedience</div>
                     <div class="line">And humble service till the point of death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Stoop then and set your knee against my foot;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, in reguerdon of that duty done,</div>
                     <div class="line">I gird thee with the valiant sword of York:</div>
                     <div class="line">Rise Richard, like a true Plantagenet,</div>
                     <div class="line">And rise created princely Duke of York.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RICHARD PLANTAGENET</div>
                     <div class="line">And so thrive Richard as thy foes may fall!</div>
                     <div class="line">And as my duty springs, so perish they</div>
                     <div class="line">That grudge one thought against your majesty!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                     <div class="line">Welcome, high prince, the mighty Duke of York!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  Perish, base prince, ignoble Duke of York!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Now will it best avail your majesty</div>
                     <div class="line">To cross the seas and to be crown'd in France:</div>
                     <div class="line">The presence of a king engenders love</div>
                     <div class="line">Amongst his subjects and his loyal friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">As it disanimates his enemies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">When Gloucester says the word, King Henry goes;</div>
                     <div class="line">For friendly counsel cuts off many foes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Your ships already are in readiness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Sennet. Flourish. Exeunt all but EXETER</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, we may march in England or in France,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not seeing what is likely to ensue.</div>
                     <div class="line">This late dissension grown betwixt the peers</div>
                     <div class="line">Burns under feigned ashes of forged love</div>
                     <div class="line">And will at last break out into a flame:</div>
                     <div class="line">As fester'd members rot but by degree,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till bones and flesh and sinews fall away,</div>
                     <div class="line">So will this base and envious discord breed.</div>
                     <div class="line">And now I fear that fatal prophecy</div>
                     <div class="line">Which in the time of Henry named the Fifth</div>
                     <div class="line">Was in the mouth of every sucking babe;</div>
                     <div class="line">That Henry born at Monmouth should win all</div>
                     <div class="line">And Henry born at Windsor lose all:</div>
                     <div class="line">Which is so plain that Exeter doth wish</div>
                     <div class="line">His days may finish ere that hapless time.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  France. Before Rouen.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter JOAN LA PUCELLE disguised, with four Soldiers
with sacks upon their backs</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">These are the city gates, the gates of Rouen,</div>
                     <div class="line">Through which our policy must make a breach:</div>
                     <div class="line">Take heed, be wary how you place your words;</div>
                     <div class="line">Talk like the vulgar sort of market men</div>
                     <div class="line">That come to gather money for their corn.</div>
                     <div class="line">If we have entrance, as I hope we shall,</div>
                     <div class="line">And that we find the slothful watch but weak,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll by a sign give notice to our friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">That Charles the Dauphin may encounter them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">Our sacks shall be a mean to sack the city,</div>
                     <div class="line">And we be lords and rulers over Rouen;</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore we'll knock.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Knocks</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Watch</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  Qui est la?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Paysans, pauvres gens de France;</div>
                     <div class="line">Poor market folks that come to sell their corn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Watch</div>
                     <div class="line">Enter, go in; the market bell is rung.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, Rouen, I'll shake thy bulwarks to the ground.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
               <p>Enter CHARLES, the BASTARD OF ORLEANS, ALENCON,
REIGNIER, and forces</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Saint Denis bless this happy stratagem!</div>
                     <div class="line">And once again we'll sleep secure in Rouen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD OF ORLEANS</div>
                     <div class="line">Here enter'd Pucelle and her practisants;</div>
                     <div class="line">Now she is there, how will she specify</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is the best and safest passage in?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                     <div class="line">By thrusting out a torch from yonder tower;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, once discern'd, shows that her meaning is,</div>
                     <div class="line">No way to that, for weakness, which she enter'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter JOAN LA PUCELLE on the top, thrusting out a
torch burning</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Behold, this is the happy wedding torch</div>
                     <div class="line">That joineth Rouen unto her countrymen,</div>
                     <div class="line">But burning fatal to the Talbotites!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD OF ORLEANS</div>
                     <div class="line">See, noble Charles, the beacon of our friend;</div>
                     <div class="line">The burning torch in yonder turret stands.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Now shine it like a comet of revenge,</div>
                     <div class="line">A prophet to the fall of all our foes!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                     <div class="line">Defer no time, delays have dangerous ends;</div>
                     <div class="line">Enter, and cry 'The Dauphin!' presently,</div>
                     <div class="line">And then do execution on the watch.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Alarum. Exeunt</p>
               <p>An alarum. Enter TALBOT in an excursion</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">France, thou shalt rue this treason with thy tears,</div>
                     <div class="line">If Talbot but survive thy treachery.</div>
                     <div class="line">Pucelle, that witch, that damned sorceress,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath wrought this hellish mischief unawares,</div>
                     <div class="line">That hardly we escaped the pride of France.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>An alarum: excursions. BEDFORD, brought in sick
in a chair. Enter TALBOT and BURGUNDY without:
within JOAN LA PUCELLE, CHARLES, BASTARD OF ORLEANS,
ALENCON, and REIGNIER, on the walls</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Good morrow, gallants! want ye corn for bread?</div>
                     <div class="line">I think the Duke of Burgundy will fast</div>
                     <div class="line">Before he'll buy again at such a rate:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twas full of darnel; do you like the taste?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                     <div class="line">Scoff on, vile fiend and shameless courtezan!</div>
                     <div class="line">I trust ere long to choke thee with thine own</div>
                     <div class="line">And make thee curse the harvest of that corn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Your grace may starve perhaps before that time.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEDFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">O, let no words, but deeds, revenge this treason!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">What will you do, good grey-beard? break a lance,</div>
                     <div class="line">And run a tilt at death within a chair?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Foul fiend of France, and hag of all despite,</div>
                     <div class="line">Encompass'd with thy lustful paramours!</div>
                     <div class="line">Becomes it thee to taunt his valiant age</div>
                     <div class="line">And twit with cowardice a man half dead?</div>
                     <div class="line">Damsel, I'll have a bout with you again,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or else let Talbot perish with this shame.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Are ye so hot, sir? yet, Pucelle, hold thy peace;</div>
                     <div class="line">If Talbot do but thunder, rain will follow.</div>
                     <p>The English whisper together in council</p>
                     <div class="line">God speed the parliament! who shall be the speaker?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Dare ye come forth and meet us in the field?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Belike your lordship takes us then for fools,</div>
                     <div class="line">To try if that our own be ours or no.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">I speak not to that railing Hecate,</div>
                     <div class="line">But unto thee, Alencon, and the rest;</div>
                     <div class="line">Will ye, like soldiers, come and fight it out?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALENCON</div>
                     <div class="line">Signior, no.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Signior, hang! base muleters of France!</div>
                     <div class="line">Like peasant foot-boys do they keep the walls</div>
                     <div class="line">And dare not take up arms like gentlemen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Away, captains! let's get us from the walls;</div>
                     <div class="line">For Talbot means no goodness by his looks.</div>
                     <div class="line">God be wi' you, my lord! we came but to tell you</div>
                     <div class="line">That we are here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt from the walls</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">And there will we be too, ere it be long,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or else reproach be Talbot's greatest fame!</div>
                     <div class="line">Vow, Burgundy, by honour of thy house,</div>
                     <div class="line">Prick'd on by public wrongs sustain'd in France,</div>
                     <div class="line">Either to get the town again or die:</div>
                     <div class="line">And I, as sure as English Henry lives</div>
                     <div class="line">And as his father here was conqueror,</div>
                     <div class="line">As sure as in this late-betrayed town</div>
                     <div class="line">Great Coeur-de-lion's heart was buried,</div>
                     <div class="line">So sure I swear to get the town or die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                     <div class="line">My vows are equal partners with thy vows.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">But, ere we go, regard this dying prince,</div>
                     <div class="line">The valiant Duke of Bedford. Come, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">We will bestow you in some better place,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fitter for sickness and for crazy age.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEDFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord Talbot, do not so dishonour me:</div>
                     <div class="line">Here will I sit before the walls of Rouen</div>
                     <div class="line">And will be partner of your weal or woe.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                     <div class="line">Courageous Bedford, let us now persuade you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEDFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Not to be gone from hence; for once I read</div>
                     <div class="line">That stout Pendragon in his litter sick</div>
                     <div class="line">Came to the field and vanquished his foes:</div>
                     <div class="line">Methinks I should revive the soldiers' hearts,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because I ever found them as myself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Undaunted spirit in a dying breast!</div>
                     <div class="line">Then be it so: heavens keep old Bedford safe!</div>
                     <div class="line">And now no more ado, brave Burgundy,</div>
                     <div class="line">But gather we our forces out of hand</div>
                     <div class="line">And set upon our boasting enemy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt all but BEDFORD and Attendants</p>
               <p>An alarum: excursions. Enter FASTOLFE and
a Captain</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">Whither away, Sir John Fastolfe, in such haste?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FASTOLFE</div>
                     <div class="line">Whither away! to save myself by flight:</div>
                     <div class="line">We are like to have the overthrow again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">What! will you fly, and leave Lord Talbot?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FASTOLFE</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay,</div>
                     <div class="line">All the Talbots in the world, to save my life!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">Cowardly knight! ill fortune follow thee!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Retreat: excursions. JOAN LA PUCELLE, ALENCON,
and CHARLES fly</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BEDFORD</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, quiet soul, depart when heaven please,</div>
                     <div class="line">For I have seen our enemies' overthrow.</div>
                     <div class="line">What is the trust or strength of foolish man?</div>
                     <div class="line">They that of late were daring with their scoffs</div>
                     <div class="line">Are glad and fain by flight to save themselves.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>BEDFORD dies, and is carried in by two in his chair</p>
               <p>An alarum. Re-enter TALBOT, BURGUNDY, and the rest</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Lost, and recover'd in a day again!</div>
                     <div class="line">This is a double honour, Burgundy:</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet heavens have glory for this victory!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                     <div class="line">Warlike and martial Talbot, Burgundy</div>
                     <div class="line">Enshrines thee in his heart and there erects</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy noble deeds as valour's monuments.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Thanks, gentle duke. But where is Pucelle now?</div>
                     <div class="line">I think her old familiar is asleep:</div>
                     <div class="line">Now where's the Bastard's braves, and Charles his gleeks?</div>
                     <div class="line">What, all amort? Rouen hangs her head for grief</div>
                     <div class="line">That such a valiant company are fled.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now will we take some order in the town,</div>
                     <div class="line">Placing therein some expert officers,</div>
                     <div class="line">And then depart to Paris to the king,</div>
                     <div class="line">For there young Henry with his nobles lie.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                     <div class="line">What wills Lord Talbot pleaseth Burgundy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">But yet, before we go, let's not forget</div>
                     <div class="line">The noble Duke of Bedford late deceased,</div>
                     <div class="line">But see his exequies fulfill'd in Rouen:</div>
                     <div class="line">A braver soldier never couched lance,</div>
                     <div class="line">A gentler heart did never sway in court;</div>
                     <div class="line">But kings and mightiest potentates must die,</div>
                     <div class="line">For that's the end of human misery.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CHARLES, the BASTARD OF ORLEANS, ALENCON, JOAN
LA PUCELLE, and forces</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Dismay not, princes, at this accident,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor grieve that Rouen is so recovered:</div>
                     <div class="line">Care is no cure, but rather corrosive,</div>
                     <div class="line">For things that are not to be remedied.</div>
                     <div class="line">Let frantic Talbot triumph for a while</div>
                     <div class="line">And like a peacock sweep along his tail;</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll pull his plumes and take away his train,</div>
                     <div class="line">If Dauphin and the rest will be but ruled.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">We have been guided by thee hitherto,</div>
                     <div class="line">And of thy cunning had no diffidence:</div>
                     <div class="line">One sudden foil shall never breed distrust.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD OF ORLEANS</div>
                     <div class="line">Search out thy wit for secret policies,</div>
                     <div class="line">And we will make thee famous through the world.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALENCON</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll set thy statue in some holy place,</div>
                     <div class="line">And have thee reverenced like a blessed saint:</div>
                     <div class="line">Employ thee then, sweet virgin, for our good.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Then thus it must be; this doth Joan devise:</div>
                     <div class="line">By fair persuasions mix'd with sugar'd words</div>
                     <div class="line">We will entice the Duke of Burgundy</div>
                     <div class="line">To leave the Talbot and to follow us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, marry, sweeting, if we could do that,</div>
                     <div class="line">France were no place for Henry's warriors;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor should that nation boast it so with us,</div>
                     <div class="line">But be extirped from our provinces.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALENCON</div>
                     <div class="line">For ever should they be expulsed from France</div>
                     <div class="line">And not have title of an earldom here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Your honours shall perceive how I will work</div>
                     <div class="line">To bring this matter to the wished end.</div>
                     <p>Drum sounds afar off</p>
                     <div class="line">Hark! by the sound of drum you may perceive</div>
                     <div class="line">Their powers are marching unto Paris-ward.</div>
                     <p>Here sound an English march. Enter, and pass over
at a distance, TALBOT and his forces</p>
                     <div class="line">There goes the Talbot, with his colours spread,</div>
                     <div class="line">And all the troops of English after him.</div>
                     <p>French march. Enter BURGUNDY and forces</p>
                     <div class="line">Now in the rearward comes the duke and his:</div>
                     <div class="line">Fortune in favour makes him lag behind.</div>
                     <div class="line">Summon a parley; we will talk with him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Trumpets sound a parley</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">A parley with the Duke of Burgundy!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                     <div class="line">Who craves a parley with the Burgundy?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">The princely Charles of France, thy countryman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                     <div class="line">What say'st thou, Charles? for I am marching hence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak, Pucelle, and enchant him with thy words.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Brave Burgundy, undoubted hope of France!</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay, let thy humble handmaid speak to thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak on; but be not over-tedious.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Look on thy country, look on fertile France,</div>
                     <div class="line">And see the cities and the towns defaced</div>
                     <div class="line">By wasting ruin of the cruel foe.</div>
                     <div class="line">As looks the mother on her lowly babe</div>
                     <div class="line">When death doth close his tender dying eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">See, see the pining malady of France;</div>
                     <div class="line">Behold the wounds, the most unnatural wounds,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which thou thyself hast given her woful breast.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, turn thy edged sword another way;</div>
                     <div class="line">Strike those that hurt, and hurt not those that help.</div>
                     <div class="line">One drop of blood drawn from thy country's bosom</div>
                     <div class="line">Should grieve thee more than streams of foreign gore:</div>
                     <div class="line">Return thee therefore with a flood of tears,</div>
                     <div class="line">And wash away thy country's stained spots.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                     <div class="line">Either she hath bewitch'd me with her words,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or nature makes me suddenly relent.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Besides, all French and France exclaims on thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Doubting thy birth and lawful progeny.</div>
                     <div class="line">Who joint'st thou with but with a lordly nation</div>
                     <div class="line">That will not trust thee but for profit's sake?</div>
                     <div class="line">When Talbot hath set footing once in France</div>
                     <div class="line">And fashion'd thee that instrument of ill,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who then but English Henry will be lord</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou be thrust out like a fugitive?</div>
                     <div class="line">Call we to mind, and mark but this for proof,</div>
                     <div class="line">Was not the Duke of Orleans thy foe?</div>
                     <div class="line">And was he not in England prisoner?</div>
                     <div class="line">But when they heard he was thine enemy,</div>
                     <div class="line">They set him free without his ransom paid,</div>
                     <div class="line">In spite of Burgundy and all his friends.</div>
                     <div class="line">See, then, thou fight'st against thy countrymen</div>
                     <div class="line">And joint'st with them will be thy slaughtermen.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come, return; return, thou wandering lord:</div>
                     <div class="line">Charles and the rest will take thee in their arms.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                     <div class="line">I am vanquished; these haughty words of hers</div>
                     <div class="line">Have batter'd me like roaring cannon-shot,</div>
                     <div class="line">And made me almost yield upon my knees.</div>
                     <div class="line">Forgive me, country, and sweet countrymen,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, lords, accept this hearty kind embrace:</div>
                     <div class="line">My forces and my power of men are yours:</div>
                     <div class="line">So farewell, Talbot; I'll no longer trust thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  Done like a Frenchman: turn, and turn again!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Welcome, brave duke! thy friendship makes us fresh.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD OF ORLEANS</div>
                     <div class="line">And doth beget new courage in our breasts.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALENCON</div>
                     <div class="line">Pucelle hath bravely play'd her part in this,</div>
                     <div class="line">And doth deserve a coronet of gold.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Now let us on, my lords, and join our powers,</div>
                     <div class="line">And seek how we may prejudice the foe.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  Paris. The palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KING HENRY VI, GLOUCESTER, BISHOP OF
WINCHESTER, YORK, SUFFOLK, SOMERSET, WARWICK,
EXETER, VERNON BASSET, and others. To them
with his Soldiers, TALBOT</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">My gracious prince, and honourable peers,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hearing of your arrival in this realm,</div>
                     <div class="line">I have awhile given truce unto my wars,</div>
                     <div class="line">To do my duty to my sovereign:</div>
                     <div class="line">In sign, whereof, this arm, that hath reclaim'd</div>
                     <div class="line">To your obedience fifty fortresses,</div>
                     <div class="line">Twelve cities and seven walled towns of strength,</div>
                     <div class="line">Beside five hundred prisoners of esteem,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lets fall his sword before your highness' feet,</div>
                     <div class="line">And with submissive loyalty of heart</div>
                     <div class="line">Ascribes the glory of his conquest got</div>
                     <div class="line">First to my God and next unto your grace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Kneels</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Is this the Lord Talbot, uncle Gloucester,</div>
                     <div class="line">That hath so long been resident in France?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, if it please your majesty, my liege.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Welcome, brave captain and victorious lord!</div>
                     <div class="line">When I was young, as yet I am not old,</div>
                     <div class="line">I do remember how my father said</div>
                     <div class="line">A stouter champion never handled sword.</div>
                     <div class="line">Long since we were resolved of your truth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your faithful service and your toil in war;</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet never have you tasted our reward,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or been reguerdon'd with so much as thanks,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because till now we never saw your face:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, stand up; and, for these good deserts,</div>
                     <div class="line">We here create you Earl of Shrewsbury;</div>
                     <div class="line">And in our coronation take your place.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Sennet. Flourish. Exeunt all but VERNON and BASSET</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, sir, to you, that were so hot at sea,</div>
                     <div class="line">Disgracing of these colours that I wear</div>
                     <div class="line">In honour of my noble Lord of York:</div>
                     <div class="line">Darest thou maintain the former words thou spakest?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSET</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, sir; as well as you dare patronage</div>
                     <div class="line">The envious barking of your saucy tongue</div>
                     <div class="line">Against my lord the Duke of Somerset.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                     <div class="line">Sirrah, thy lord I honour as he is.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSET</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, what is he? as good a man as York.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                     <div class="line">Hark ye; not so: in witness, take ye that.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Strikes him</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSET</div>
                     <div class="line">Villain, thou know'st the law of arms is such</div>
                     <div class="line">That whoso draws a sword, 'tis present death,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or else this blow should broach thy dearest blood.</div>
                     <div class="line">But I'll unto his majesty, and crave</div>
                     <div class="line">I may have liberty to venge this wrong;</div>
                     <div class="line">When thou shalt see I'll meet thee to thy cost.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, miscreant, I'll be there as soon as you;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, after, meet you sooner than you would.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.6">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 4. ACT IV</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.2">1. SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.3">2. SCENE II.  Before Bourdeaux.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.4">3. SCENE III.  Plains in Gascony.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.5">4. SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.6">5. SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.7">6. SCENE VI.  A field of battle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.8">7. SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KING HENRY VI, GLOUCESTER, BISHOP OF
WINCHESTER, YORK, SUFFOLK, SOMERSET, WARWICK,
TALBOT, EXETER, the Governor, of Paris, and others</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord bishop, set the crown upon his head.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF WINCHESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">God save King Henry, of that name the sixth!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, governor of Paris, take your oath,</div>
                     <div class="line">That you elect no other king but him;</div>
                     <div class="line">Esteem none friends but such as are his friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">And none your foes but such as shall pretend</div>
                     <div class="line">Malicious practises against his state:</div>
                     <div class="line">This shall ye do, so help you righteous God!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter FASTOLFE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FASTOLFE</div>
                     <div class="line">My gracious sovereign, as I rode from Calais,</div>
                     <div class="line">To haste unto your coronation,</div>
                     <div class="line">A letter was deliver'd to my hands,</div>
                     <div class="line">Writ to your grace from the Duke of Burgundy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Shame to the Duke of Burgundy and thee!</div>
                     <div class="line">I vow'd, base knight, when I did meet thee next,</div>
                     <div class="line">To tear the garter from thy craven's leg,</div>
                     <p>Plucking it off</p>
                     <div class="line">Which I have done, because unworthily</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou wast installed in that high degree.</div>
                     <div class="line">Pardon me, princely Henry, and the rest</div>
                     <div class="line">This dastard, at the battle of Patay,</div>
                     <div class="line">When but in all I was six thousand strong</div>
                     <div class="line">And that the French were almost ten to one,</div>
                     <div class="line">Before we met or that a stroke was given,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like to a trusty squire did run away:</div>
                     <div class="line">In which assault we lost twelve hundred men;</div>
                     <div class="line">Myself and divers gentlemen beside</div>
                     <div class="line">Were there surprised and taken prisoners.</div>
                     <div class="line">Then judge, great lords, if I have done amiss;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or whether that such cowards ought to wear</div>
                     <div class="line">This ornament of knighthood, yea or no.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">To say the truth, this fact was infamous</div>
                     <div class="line">And ill beseeming any common man,</div>
                     <div class="line">Much more a knight, a captain and a leader.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">When first this order was ordain'd, my lords,</div>
                     <div class="line">Knights of the garter were of noble birth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Valiant and virtuous, full of haughty courage,</div>
                     <div class="line">Such as were grown to credit by the wars;</div>
                     <div class="line">Not fearing death, nor shrinking for distress,</div>
                     <div class="line">But always resolute in most extremes.</div>
                     <div class="line">He then that is not furnish'd in this sort</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth but usurp the sacred name of knight,</div>
                     <div class="line">Profaning this most honourable order,</div>
                     <div class="line">And should, if I were worthy to be judge,</div>
                     <div class="line">Be quite degraded, like a hedge-born swain</div>
                     <div class="line">That doth presume to boast of gentle blood.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
