                     <div class="line">Stain to thy countrymen, thou hear'st thy doom!</div>
                     <div class="line">Be packing, therefore, thou that wast a knight:</div>
                     <div class="line">Henceforth we banish thee, on pain of death.</div>
                     <p>Exit FASTOLFE</p>
                     <div class="line">And now, my lord protector, view the letter</div>
                     <div class="line">Sent from our uncle Duke of Burgundy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">What means his grace, that he hath changed his style?</div>
                     <div class="line">No more but, plain and bluntly, 'To the king!'</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath he forgot he is his sovereign?</div>
                     <div class="line">Or doth this churlish superscription</div>
                     <div class="line">Pretend some alteration in good will?</div>
                     <div class="line">What's here?</div>
                     <p>Reads</p>
                     <div class="line">'I have, upon especial cause,</div>
                     <div class="line">Moved with compassion of my country's wreck,</div>
                     <div class="line">Together with the pitiful complaints</div>
                     <div class="line">Of such as your oppression feeds upon,</div>
                     <div class="line">Forsaken your pernicious faction</div>
                     <div class="line">And join'd with Charles, the rightful King of France.'</div>
                     <div class="line">O monstrous treachery! can this be so,</div>
                     <div class="line">That in alliance, amity and oaths,</div>
                     <div class="line">There should be found such false dissembling guile?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">What! doth my uncle Burgundy revolt?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">He doth, my lord, and is become your foe.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Is that the worst this letter doth contain?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">It is the worst, and all, my lord, he writes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then, Lord Talbot there shall talk with him</div>
                     <div class="line">And give him chastisement for this abuse.</div>
                     <div class="line">How say you, my lord? are you not content?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Content, my liege! yes, but that I am prevented,</div>
                     <div class="line">I should have begg'd I might have been employ'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Then gather strength and march unto him straight:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let him perceive how ill we brook his treason</div>
                     <div class="line">And what offence it is to flout his friends.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">I go, my lord, in heart desiring still</div>
                     <div class="line">You may behold confusion of your foes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Enter VERNON and BASSET</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                     <div class="line">Grant me the combat, gracious sovereign.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSET</div>
                     <div class="line">And me, my lord, grant me the combat too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">This is my servant: hear him, noble prince.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">And this is mine: sweet Henry, favour him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Be patient, lords; and give them leave to speak.</div>
                     <div class="line">Say, gentlemen, what makes you thus exclaim?</div>
                     <div class="line">And wherefore crave you combat? or with whom?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                     <div class="line">With him, my lord; for he hath done me wrong.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSET</div>
                     <div class="line">And I with him; for he hath done me wrong.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">What is that wrong whereof you both complain?</div>
                     <div class="line">First let me know, and then I'll answer you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSET</div>
                     <div class="line">Crossing the sea from England into France,</div>
                     <div class="line">This fellow here, with envious carping tongue,</div>
                     <div class="line">Upbraided me about the rose I wear;</div>
                     <div class="line">Saying, the sanguine colour of the leaves</div>
                     <div class="line">Did represent my master's blushing cheeks,</div>
                     <div class="line">When stubbornly he did repugn the truth</div>
                     <div class="line">About a certain question in the law</div>
                     <div class="line">Argued betwixt the Duke of York and him;</div>
                     <div class="line">With other vile and ignominious terms:</div>
                     <div class="line">In confutation of which rude reproach</div>
                     <div class="line">And in defence of my lord's worthiness,</div>
                     <div class="line">I crave the benefit of law of arms.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                     <div class="line">And that is my petition, noble lord:</div>
                     <div class="line">For though he seem with forged quaint conceit</div>
                     <div class="line">To set a gloss upon his bold intent,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet know, my lord, I was provoked by him;</div>
                     <div class="line">And he first took exceptions at this badge,</div>
                     <div class="line">Pronouncing that the paleness of this flower</div>
                     <div class="line">Bewray'd the faintness of my master's heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Will not this malice, Somerset, be left?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">Your private grudge, my Lord of York, will out,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though ne'er so cunningly you smother it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Good Lord, what madness rules in brainsick men,</div>
                     <div class="line">When for so slight and frivolous a cause</div>
                     <div class="line">Such factious emulations shall arise!</div>
                     <div class="line">Good cousins both, of York and Somerset,</div>
                     <div class="line">Quiet yourselves, I pray, and be at peace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Let this dissension first be tried by fight,</div>
                     <div class="line">And then your highness shall command a peace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">The quarrel toucheth none but us alone;</div>
                     <div class="line">Betwixt ourselves let us decide it then.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">There is my pledge; accept it, Somerset.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, let it rest where it began at first.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSET</div>
                     <div class="line">Confirm it so, mine honourable lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Confirm it so! Confounded be your strife!</div>
                     <div class="line">And perish ye, with your audacious prate!</div>
                     <div class="line">Presumptuous vassals, are you not ashamed</div>
                     <div class="line">With this immodest clamorous outrage</div>
                     <div class="line">To trouble and disturb the king and us?</div>
                     <div class="line">And you, my lords, methinks you do not well</div>
                     <div class="line">To bear with their perverse objections;</div>
                     <div class="line">Much less to take occasion from their mouths</div>
                     <div class="line">To raise a mutiny betwixt yourselves:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me persuade you take a better course.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                     <div class="line">It grieves his highness: good my lords, be friends.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Come hither, you that would be combatants:</div>
                     <div class="line">Henceforth I charge you, as you love our favour,</div>
                     <div class="line">Quite to forget this quarrel and the cause.</div>
                     <div class="line">And you, my lords, remember where we are,</div>
                     <div class="line">In France, amongst a fickle wavering nation:</div>
                     <div class="line">If they perceive dissension in our looks</div>
                     <div class="line">And that within ourselves we disagree,</div>
                     <div class="line">How will their grudging stomachs be provoked</div>
                     <div class="line">To wilful disobedience, and rebel!</div>
                     <div class="line">Beside, what infamy will there arise,</div>
                     <div class="line">When foreign princes shall be certified</div>
                     <div class="line">That for a toy, a thing of no regard,</div>
                     <div class="line">King Henry's peers and chief nobility</div>
                     <div class="line">Destroy'd themselves, and lost the realm of France!</div>
                     <div class="line">O, think upon the conquest of my father,</div>
                     <div class="line">My tender years, and let us not forego</div>
                     <div class="line">That for a trifle that was bought with blood</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me be umpire in this doubtful strife.</div>
                     <div class="line">I see no reason, if I wear this rose,</div>
                     <p>Putting on a red rose</p>
                     <div class="line">That any one should therefore be suspicious</div>
                     <div class="line">I more incline to Somerset than York:</div>
                     <div class="line">Both are my kinsmen, and I love them both:</div>
                     <div class="line">As well they may upbraid me with my crown,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because, forsooth, the king of Scots is crown'd.</div>
                     <div class="line">But your discretions better can persuade</div>
                     <div class="line">Than I am able to instruct or teach:</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore, as we hither came in peace,</div>
                     <div class="line">So let us still continue peace and love.</div>
                     <div class="line">Cousin of York, we institute your grace</div>
                     <div class="line">To be our regent in these parts of France:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, good my Lord of Somerset, unite</div>
                     <div class="line">Your troops of horsemen with his bands of foot;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, like true subjects, sons of your progenitors,</div>
                     <div class="line">Go cheerfully together and digest.</div>
                     <div class="line">Your angry choler on your enemies.</div>
                     <div class="line">Ourself, my lord protector and the rest</div>
                     <div class="line">After some respite will return to Calais;</div>
                     <div class="line">From thence to England; where I hope ere long</div>
                     <div class="line">To be presented, by your victories,</div>
                     <div class="line">With Charles, Alencon and that traitorous rout.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Flourish. Exeunt all but YORK, WARWICK, EXETER
and VERNON</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">My Lord of York, I promise you, the king</div>
                     <div class="line">Prettily, methought, did play the orator.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">And so he did; but yet I like it not,</div>
                     <div class="line">In that he wears the badge of Somerset.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Tush, that was but his fancy, blame him not;</div>
                     <div class="line">I dare presume, sweet prince, he thought no harm.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">An if I wist he did,--but let it rest;</div>
                     <div class="line">Other affairs must now be managed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt all but EXETER</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                     <div class="line">Well didst thou, Richard, to suppress thy voice;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, had the passions of thy heart burst out,</div>
                     <div class="line">I fear we should have seen decipher'd there</div>
                     <div class="line">More rancorous spite, more furious raging broils,</div>
                     <div class="line">Than yet can be imagined or supposed.</div>
                     <div class="line">But howsoe'er, no simple man that sees</div>
                     <div class="line">This jarring discord of nobility,</div>
                     <div class="line">This shouldering of each other in the court,</div>
                     <div class="line">This factious bandying of their favourites,</div>
                     <div class="line">But that it doth presage some ill event.</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis much when sceptres are in children's hands;</div>
                     <div class="line">But more when envy breeds unkind division;</div>
                     <div class="line">There comes the rain, there begins confusion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Before Bourdeaux.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter TALBOT, with trump and drum</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to the gates of Bourdeaux, trumpeter:</div>
                     <div class="line">Summon their general unto the wall.</div>
                     <p>Trumpet sounds. Enter General and others, aloft</p>
                     <div class="line">English John Talbot, captains, calls you forth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Servant in arms to Harry King of England;</div>
                     <div class="line">And thus he would: Open your city gates;</div>
                     <div class="line">Be humble to us; call my sovereign yours,</div>
                     <div class="line">And do him homage as obedient subjects;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I'll withdraw me and my bloody power:</div>
                     <div class="line">But, if you frown upon this proffer'd peace,</div>
                     <div class="line">You tempt the fury of my three attendants,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lean famine, quartering steel, and climbing fire;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who in a moment even with the earth</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall lay your stately and air-braving towers,</div>
                     <div class="line">If you forsake the offer of their love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">General</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou ominous and fearful owl of death,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our nation's terror and their bloody scourge!</div>
                     <div class="line">The period of thy tyranny approacheth.</div>
                     <div class="line">On us thou canst not enter but by death;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, I protest, we are well fortified</div>
                     <div class="line">And strong enough to issue out and fight:</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou retire, the Dauphin, well appointed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Stands with the snares of war to tangle thee:</div>
                     <div class="line">On either hand thee there are squadrons pitch'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">To wall thee from the liberty of flight;</div>
                     <div class="line">And no way canst thou turn thee for redress,</div>
                     <div class="line">But death doth front thee with apparent spoil</div>
                     <div class="line">And pale destruction meets thee in the face.</div>
                     <div class="line">Ten thousand French have ta'en the sacrament</div>
                     <div class="line">To rive their dangerous artillery</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon no Christian soul but English Talbot.</div>
                     <div class="line">Lo, there thou stand'st, a breathing valiant man,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of an invincible unconquer'd spirit!</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the latest glory of thy praise</div>
                     <div class="line">That I, thy enemy, due thee withal;</div>
                     <div class="line">For ere the glass, that now begins to run,</div>
                     <div class="line">Finish the process of his sandy hour,</div>
                     <div class="line">These eyes, that see thee now well coloured,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall see thee wither'd, bloody, pale and dead.</div>
                     <p>Drum afar off</p>
                     <div class="line">Hark! hark! the Dauphin's drum, a warning bell,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sings heavy music to thy timorous soul;</div>
                     <div class="line">And mine shall ring thy dire departure out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt General, &c</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">He fables not; I hear the enemy:</div>
                     <div class="line">Out, some light horsemen, and peruse their wings.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, negligent and heedless discipline!</div>
                     <div class="line">How are we park'd and bounded in a pale,</div>
                     <div class="line">A little herd of England's timorous deer,</div>
                     <div class="line">Mazed with a yelping kennel of French curs!</div>
                     <div class="line">If we be English deer, be then in blood;</div>
                     <div class="line">Not rascal-like, to fall down with a pinch,</div>
                     <div class="line">But rather, moody-mad and desperate stags,</div>
                     <div class="line">Turn on the bloody hounds with heads of steel</div>
                     <div class="line">And make the cowards stand aloof at bay:</div>
                     <div class="line">Sell every man his life as dear as mine,</div>
                     <div class="line">And they shall find dear deer of us, my friends.</div>
                     <div class="line">God and Saint George, Talbot and England's right,</div>
                     <div class="line">Prosper our colours in this dangerous fight!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  Plains in Gascony.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Messenger that meets YORK. Enter YORK
with trumpet and many Soldiers</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Are not the speedy scouts return'd again,</div>
                     <div class="line">That dogg'd the mighty army of the Dauphin?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">They are return'd, my lord, and give it out</div>
                     <div class="line">That he is march'd to Bourdeaux with his power,</div>
                     <div class="line">To fight with Talbot: as he march'd along,</div>
                     <div class="line">By your espials were discovered</div>
                     <div class="line">Two mightier troops than that the Dauphin led,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which join'd with him and made their march for Bourdeaux.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">A plague upon that villain Somerset,</div>
                     <div class="line">That thus delays my promised supply</div>
                     <div class="line">Of horsemen, that were levied for this siege!</div>
                     <div class="line">Renowned Talbot doth expect my aid,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I am lowted by a traitor villain</div>
                     <div class="line">And cannot help the noble chevalier:</div>
                     <div class="line">God comfort him in this necessity!</div>
                     <div class="line">If he miscarry, farewell wars in France.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Sir William LUCY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou princely leader of our English strength,</div>
                     <div class="line">Never so needful on the earth of France,</div>
                     <div class="line">Spur to the rescue of the noble Talbot,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who now is girdled with a waist of iron</div>
                     <div class="line">And hemm'd about with grim destruction:</div>
                     <div class="line">To Bourdeaux, warlike duke! to Bourdeaux, York!</div>
                     <div class="line">Else, farewell Talbot, France, and England's honour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">O God, that Somerset, who in proud heart</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth stop my cornets, were in Talbot's place!</div>
                     <div class="line">So should we save a valiant gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">By forfeiting a traitor and a coward.</div>
                     <div class="line">Mad ire and wrathful fury makes me weep,</div>
                     <div class="line">That thus we die, while remiss traitors sleep.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                     <div class="line">O, send some succor to the distress'd lord!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">He dies, we lose; I break my warlike word;</div>
                     <div class="line">We mourn, France smiles; we lose, they daily get;</div>
                     <div class="line">All 'long of this vile traitor Somerset.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                     <div class="line">Then God take mercy on brave Talbot's soul;</div>
                     <div class="line">And on his son young John, who two hours since</div>
                     <div class="line">I met in travel toward his warlike father!</div>
                     <div class="line">This seven years did not Talbot see his son;</div>
                     <div class="line">And now they meet where both their lives are done.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, what joy shall noble Talbot have</div>
                     <div class="line">To bid his young son welcome to his grave?</div>
                     <div class="line">Away! vexation almost stops my breath,</div>
                     <div class="line">That sunder'd friends greet in the hour of death.</div>
                     <div class="line">Lucy, farewell; no more my fortune can,</div>
                     <div class="line">But curse the cause I cannot aid the man.</div>
                     <div class="line">Maine, Blois, Poictiers, and Tours, are won away,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Long all of Somerset and his delay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit, with his soldiers</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus, while the vulture of sedition</div>
                     <div class="line">Feeds in the bosom of such great commanders,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sleeping neglection doth betray to loss</div>
                     <div class="line">The conquest of our scarce cold conqueror,</div>
                     <div class="line">That ever living man of memory,</div>
                     <div class="line">Henry the Fifth: whiles they each other cross,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lives, honours, lands and all hurry to loss.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SOMERSET, with his army; a Captain of
TALBOT's with him</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">It is too late; I cannot send them now:</div>
                     <div class="line">This expedition was by York and Talbot</div>
                     <div class="line">Too rashly plotted: all our general force</div>
                     <div class="line">Might with a sally of the very town</div>
                     <div class="line">Be buckled with: the over-daring Talbot</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath sullied all his gloss of former honour</div>
                     <div class="line">By this unheedful, desperate, wild adventure:</div>
                     <div class="line">York set him on to fight and die in shame,</div>
                     <div class="line">That, Talbot dead, great York might bear the name.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                     <div class="line">Here is Sir William Lucy, who with me</div>
                     <div class="line">Set from our o'ermatch'd forces forth for aid.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Sir William LUCY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, Sir William! whither were you sent?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                     <div class="line">Whither, my lord? from bought and sold Lord Talbot;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, ring'd about with bold adversity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Cries out for noble York and Somerset,</div>
                     <div class="line">To beat assailing death from his weak legions:</div>
                     <div class="line">And whiles the honourable captain there</div>
                     <div class="line">Drops bloody sweat from his war-wearied limbs,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, in advantage lingering, looks for rescue,</div>
                     <div class="line">You, his false hopes, the trust of England's honour,</div>
                     <div class="line">Keep off aloof with worthless emulation.</div>
                     <div class="line">Let not your private discord keep away</div>
                     <div class="line">The levied succors that should lend him aid,</div>
                     <div class="line">While he, renowned noble gentleman,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yields up his life unto a world of odds:</div>
                     <div class="line">Orleans the Bastard, Charles, Burgundy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Alencon, Reignier, compass him about,</div>
                     <div class="line">And Talbot perisheth by your default.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">York set him on; York should have sent him aid.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                     <div class="line">And York as fast upon your grace exclaims;</div>
                     <div class="line">Swearing that you withhold his levied host,</div>
                     <div class="line">Collected for this expedition.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">York lies; he might have sent and had the horse;</div>
                     <div class="line">I owe him little duty, and less love;</div>
                     <div class="line">And take foul scorn to fawn on him by sending.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                     <div class="line">The fraud of England, not the force of France,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath now entrapp'd the noble-minded Talbot:</div>
                     <div class="line">Never to England shall he bear his life;</div>
                     <div class="line">But dies, betray'd to fortune by your strife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, go; I will dispatch the horsemen straight:</div>
                     <div class="line">Within six hours they will be at his aid.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                     <div class="line">Too late comes rescue: he is ta'en or slain;</div>
                     <div class="line">For fly he could not, if he would have fled;</div>
                     <div class="line">And fly would Talbot never, though he might.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                     <div class="line">If he be dead, brave Talbot, then adieu!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                     <div class="line">His fame lives in the world, his shame in you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.6">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>5. SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter TALBOT and JOHN his son</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">O young John Talbot! I did send for thee</div>
                     <div class="line">To tutor thee in stratagems of war,</div>
                     <div class="line">That Talbot's name might be in thee revived</div>
                     <div class="line">When sapless age and weak unable limbs</div>
                     <div class="line">Should bring thy father to his drooping chair.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, O malignant and ill-boding stars!</div>
                     <div class="line">Now thou art come unto a feast of death,</div>
                     <div class="line">A terrible and unavoided danger:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, dear boy, mount on my swiftest horse;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I'll direct thee how thou shalt escape</div>
                     <div class="line">By sudden flight: come, dally not, be gone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOHN TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Is my name Talbot? and am I your son?</div>
                     <div class="line">And shall I fly? O if you love my mother,</div>
                     <div class="line">Dishonour not her honourable name,</div>
                     <div class="line">To make a bastard and a slave of me!</div>
                     <div class="line">The world will say, he is not Talbot's blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">That basely fled when noble Talbot stood.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Fly, to revenge my death, if I be slain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOHN TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">He that flies so will ne'er return again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">If we both stay, we both are sure to die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOHN TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Then let me stay; and, father, do you fly:</div>
                     <div class="line">Your loss is great, so your regard should be;</div>
                     <div class="line">My worth unknown, no loss is known in me.</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon my death the French can little boast;</div>
                     <div class="line">In yours they will, in you all hopes are lost.</div>
                     <div class="line">Flight cannot stain the honour you have won;</div>
                     <div class="line">But mine it will, that no exploit have done:</div>
                     <div class="line">You fled for vantage, everyone will swear;</div>
                     <div class="line">But, if I bow, they'll say it was for fear.</div>
                     <div class="line">There is no hope that ever I will stay,</div>
                     <div class="line">If the first hour I shrink and run away.</div>
                     <div class="line">Here on my knee I beg mortality,</div>
                     <div class="line">Rather than life preserved with infamy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall all thy mother's hopes lie in one tomb?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOHN TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, rather than I'll shame my mother's womb.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon my blessing, I command thee go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOHN TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">To fight I will, but not to fly the foe.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Part of thy father may be saved in thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOHN TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">No part of him but will be shame in me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou never hadst renown, nor canst not lose it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOHN TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, your renowned name: shall flight abuse it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy father's charge shall clear thee from that stain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOHN TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">You cannot witness for me, being slain.</div>
                     <div class="line">If death be so apparent, then both fly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">And leave my followers here to fight and die?</div>
                     <div class="line">My age was never tainted with such shame.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOHN TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">And shall my youth be guilty of such blame?</div>
                     <div class="line">No more can I be sever'd from your side,</div>
                     <div class="line">Than can yourself yourself in twain divide:</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay, go, do what you will, the like do I;</div>
                     <div class="line">For live I will not, if my father die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Then here I take my leave of thee, fair son,</div>
                     <div class="line">Born to eclipse thy life this afternoon.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, side by side together live and die.</div>
                     <div class="line">And soul with soul from France to heaven fly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.7">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>6. SCENE VI.  A field of battle.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Alarum: excursions, wherein JOHN TALBOT is
hemmed about, and TALBOT rescues him</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Saint George and victory! fight, soldiers, fight.</div>
                     <div class="line">The regent hath with Talbot broke his word</div>
                     <div class="line">And left us to the rage of France his sword.</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is John Talbot? Pause, and take thy breath;</div>
                     <div class="line">I gave thee life and rescued thee from death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOHN TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">O, twice my father, twice am I thy son!</div>
                     <div class="line">The life thou gavest me first was lost and done,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till with thy warlike sword, despite of late,</div>
                     <div class="line">To my determined time thou gavest new date.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">When from the Dauphin's crest thy sword struck fire,</div>
                     <div class="line">It warm'd thy father's heart with proud desire</div>
                     <div class="line">Of bold-faced victory. Then leaden age,</div>
                     <div class="line">Quicken'd with youthful spleen and warlike rage,</div>
                     <div class="line">Beat down Alencon, Orleans, Burgundy,</div>
                     <div class="line">And from the pride of Gallia rescued thee.</div>
                     <div class="line">The ireful bastard Orleans, that drew blood</div>
                     <div class="line">From thee, my boy, and had the maidenhood</div>
                     <div class="line">Of thy first fight, I soon encountered,</div>
                     <div class="line">And interchanging blows I quickly shed</div>
                     <div class="line">Some of his bastard blood; and in disgrace</div>
                     <div class="line">Bespoke him thus; 'Contaminated, base</div>
                     <div class="line">And misbegotten blood I spill of thine,</div>
                     <div class="line">Mean and right poor, for that pure blood of mine</div>
                     <div class="line">Which thou didst force from Talbot, my brave boy:'</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, purposing the Bastard to destroy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Came in strong rescue. Speak, thy father's care,</div>
                     <div class="line">Art thou not weary, John? how dost thou fare?</div>
                     <div class="line">Wilt thou yet leave the battle, boy, and fly,</div>
                     <div class="line">Now thou art seal'd the son of chivalry?</div>
                     <div class="line">Fly, to revenge my death when I am dead:</div>
                     <div class="line">The help of one stands me in little stead.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, too much folly is it, well I wot,</div>
                     <div class="line">To hazard all our lives in one small boat!</div>
                     <div class="line">If I to-day die not with Frenchmen's rage,</div>
                     <div class="line">To-morrow I shall die with mickle age:</div>
                     <div class="line">By me they nothing gain an if I stay;</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis but the shortening of my life one day:</div>
                     <div class="line">In thee thy mother dies, our household's name,</div>
                     <div class="line">My death's revenge, thy youth, and England's fame:</div>
                     <div class="line">All these and more we hazard by thy stay;</div>
                     <div class="line">All these are saved if thou wilt fly away.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOHN TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">The sword of Orleans hath not made me smart;</div>
                     <div class="line">These words of yours draw life-blood from my heart:</div>
                     <div class="line">On that advantage, bought with such a shame,</div>
                     <div class="line">To save a paltry life and slay bright fame,</div>
                     <div class="line">Before young Talbot from old Talbot fly,</div>
                     <div class="line">The coward horse that bears me fail and die!</div>
                     <div class="line">And like me to the peasant boys of France,</div>
                     <div class="line">To be shame's scorn and subject of mischance!</div>
                     <div class="line">Surely, by all the glory you have won,</div>
                     <div class="line">An if I fly, I am not Talbot's son:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then talk no more of flight, it is no boot;</div>
                     <div class="line">If son to Talbot, die at Talbot's foot.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Then follow thou thy desperate sire of Crete,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou Icarus; thy life to me is sweet:</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou wilt fight, fight by thy father's side;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, commendable proved, let's die in pride.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.8">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>7. SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Alarum: excursions. Enter TALBOT led by a Servant</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is my other life? mine own is gone;</div>
                     <div class="line">O, where's young Talbot? where is valiant John?</div>
                     <div class="line">Triumphant death, smear'd with captivity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Young Talbot's valour makes me smile at thee:</div>
                     <div class="line">When he perceived me shrink and on my knee,</div>
                     <div class="line">His bloody sword he brandish'd over me,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, like a hungry lion, did commence</div>
                     <div class="line">Rough deeds of rage and stern impatience;</div>
                     <div class="line">But when my angry guardant stood alone,</div>
                     <div class="line">Tendering my ruin and assail'd of none,</div>
                     <div class="line">Dizzy-eyed fury and great rage of heart</div>
                     <div class="line">Suddenly made him from my side to start</div>
                     <div class="line">Into the clustering battle of the French;</div>
                     <div class="line">And in that sea of blood my boy did drench</div>
                     <div class="line">His over-mounting spirit, and there died,</div>
                     <div class="line">My Icarus, my blossom, in his pride.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">O, my dear lord, lo, where your son is borne!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Soldiers, with the body of JOHN TALBOT</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou antic death, which laugh'st us here to scorn,</div>
                     <div class="line">Anon, from thy insulting tyranny,</div>
                     <div class="line">Coupled in bonds of perpetuity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Two Talbots, winged through the lither sky,</div>
                     <div class="line">In thy despite shall 'scape mortality.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, thou, whose wounds become hard-favour'd death,</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak to thy father ere thou yield thy breath!</div>
                     <div class="line">Brave death by speaking, whether he will or no;</div>
                     <div class="line">Imagine him a Frenchman and thy foe.</div>
                     <div class="line">Poor boy! he smiles, methinks, as who should say,</div>
                     <div class="line">Had death been French, then death had died to-day.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come and lay him in his father's arms:</div>
                     <div class="line">My spirit can no longer bear these harms.</div>
                     <div class="line">Soldiers, adieu! I have what I would have,</div>
                     <div class="line">Now my old arms are young John Talbot's grave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Dies</p>
               <p>Enter CHARLES, ALENCON, BURGUNDY, BASTARD OF
ORLEANS, JOAN LA PUCELLE, and forces</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Had York and Somerset brought rescue in,</div>
                     <div class="line">We should have found a bloody day of this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD OF ORLEANS</div>
                     <div class="line">How the young whelp of Talbot's, raging-wood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Did flesh his puny sword in Frenchmen's blood!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Once I encounter'd him, and thus I said:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Thou maiden youth, be vanquish'd by a maid:'</div>
                     <div class="line">But, with a proud majestical high scorn,</div>
                     <div class="line">He answer'd thus: 'Young Talbot was not born</div>
                     <div class="line">To be the pillage of a giglot wench:'</div>
                     <div class="line">So, rushing in the bowels of the French,</div>
                     <div class="line">He left me proudly, as unworthy fight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                     <div class="line">Doubtless he would have made a noble knight;</div>
                     <div class="line">See, where he lies inhearsed in the arms</div>
                     <div class="line">Of the most bloody nurser of his harms!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD OF ORLEANS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hew them to pieces, hack their bones asunder</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose life was England's glory, Gallia's wonder.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">O, no, forbear! for that which we have fled</div>
                     <div class="line">During the life, let us not wrong it dead.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Sir William LUCY, attended; Herald of the
French preceding</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                     <div class="line">Herald, conduct me to the Dauphin's tent,</div>
                     <div class="line">To know who hath obtained the glory of the day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">On what submissive message art thou sent?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                     <div class="line">Submission, Dauphin! 'tis a mere French word;</div>
                     <div class="line">We English warriors wot not what it means.</div>
                     <div class="line">I come to know what prisoners thou hast ta'en</div>
                     <div class="line">And to survey the bodies of the dead.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">For prisoners ask'st thou? hell our prison is.</div>
                     <div class="line">But tell me whom thou seek'st.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                     <div class="line">But where's the great Alcides of the field,</div>
                     <div class="line">Valiant Lord Talbot, Earl of Shrewsbury,</div>
                     <div class="line">Created, for his rare success in arms,</div>
                     <div class="line">Great Earl of Washford, Waterford and Valence;</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord Talbot of Goodrig and Urchinfield,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord Strange of Blackmere, Lord Verdun of Alton,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord Cromwell of Wingfield, Lord Furnival of Sheffield,</div>
                     <div class="line">The thrice-victorious Lord of Falconbridge;</div>
                     <div class="line">Knight of the noble order of Saint George,</div>
                     <div class="line">Worthy Saint Michael and the Golden Fleece;</div>
                     <div class="line">Great marshal to Henry the Sixth</div>
                     <div class="line">Of all his wars within the realm of France?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Here is a silly stately style indeed!</div>
                     <div class="line">The Turk, that two and fifty kingdoms hath,</div>
                     <div class="line">Writes not so tedious a style as this.</div>
                     <div class="line">Him that thou magnifiest with all these titles</div>
                     <div class="line">Stinking and fly-blown lies here at our feet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                     <div class="line">Is Talbot slain, the Frenchmen's only scourge,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your kingdom's terror and black Nemesis?</div>
                     <div class="line">O, were mine eyeballs into bullets turn'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I in rage might shoot them at your faces!</div>
                     <div class="line">O, that I could but call these dead to life!</div>
                     <div class="line">It were enough to fright the realm of France:</div>
                     <div class="line">Were but his picture left amongst you here,</div>
                     <div class="line">It would amaze the proudest of you all.</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me their bodies, that I may bear them hence</div>
                     <div class="line">And give them burial as beseems their worth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">I think this upstart is old Talbot's ghost,</div>
                     <div class="line">He speaks with such a proud commanding spirit.</div>
                     <div class="line">For God's sake let him have 'em; to keep them here,</div>
                     <div class="line">They would but stink, and putrefy the air.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, take their bodies hence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll bear them hence; but from their ashes shall be rear'd</div>
                     <div class="line">A phoenix that shall make all France afeard.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">So we be rid of them, do with 'em what thou wilt.</div>
                     <div class="line">And now to Paris, in this conquering vein:</div>
                     <div class="line">All will be ours, now bloody Talbot's slain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.7">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 5. ACT V</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  London. The palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  France. Plains in Anjou.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III.  Before Angiers.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.5">4. SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.6">5. SCENE V.  London. The palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  London. The palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Sennet. Enter KING HENRY VI, GLOUCESTER, and EXETER</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Have you perused the letters from the pope,</div>
                     <div class="line">The emperor and the Earl of Armagnac?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">I have, my lord: and their intent is this:</div>
                     <div class="line">They humbly sue unto your excellence</div>
                     <div class="line">To have a godly peace concluded of</div>
                     <div class="line">Between the realms of England and of France.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">How doth your grace affect their motion?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, my good lord; and as the only means</div>
                     <div class="line">To stop effusion of our Christian blood</div>
                     <div class="line">And 'stablish quietness on every side.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, marry, uncle; for I always thought</div>
                     <div class="line">It was both impious and unnatural</div>
                     <div class="line">That such immanity and bloody strife</div>
                     <div class="line">Should reign among professors of one faith.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Beside, my lord, the sooner to effect</div>
                     <div class="line">And surer bind this knot of amity,</div>
                     <div class="line">The Earl of Armagnac, near knit to Charles,</div>
                     <div class="line">A man of great authority in France,</div>
                     <div class="line">Proffers his only daughter to your grace</div>
                     <div class="line">In marriage, with a large and sumptuous dowry.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Marriage, uncle! alas, my years are young!</div>
                     <div class="line">And fitter is my study and my books</div>
                     <div class="line">Than wanton dalliance with a paramour.</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet call the ambassador; and, as you please,</div>
                     <div class="line">So let them have their answers every one:</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall be well content with any choice</div>
                     <div class="line">Tends to God's glory and my country's weal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER in Cardinal's habit,
a Legate and two Ambassadors</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                     <div class="line">What! is my Lord of Winchester install'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">And call'd unto a cardinal's degree?</div>
                     <div class="line">Then I perceive that will be verified</div>
                     <div class="line">Henry the Fifth did sometime prophesy,</div>
                     <div class="line">'If once he come to be a cardinal,</div>
                     <div class="line">He'll make his cap co-equal with the crown.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">My lords ambassadors, your several suits</div>
                     <div class="line">Have been consider'd and debated on.</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore are we certainly resolved</div>
                     <div class="line">To draw conditions of a friendly peace;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which by my Lord of Winchester we mean</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall be transported presently to France.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">And for the proffer of my lord your master,</div>
                     <div class="line">I have inform'd his highness so at large</div>
                     <div class="line">As liking of the lady's virtuous gifts,</div>
                     <div class="line">Her beauty and the value of her dower,</div>
                     <div class="line">He doth intend she shall be England's queen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">In argument and proof of which contract,</div>
                     <div class="line">Bear her this jewel, pledge of my affection.</div>
                     <div class="line">And so, my lord protector, see them guarded</div>
                     <div class="line">And safely brought to Dover; where inshipp'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Commit them to the fortune of the sea.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt all but CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER and Legate</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay, my lord legate: you shall first receive</div>
                     <div class="line">The sum of money which I promised</div>
                     <div class="line">Should be deliver'd to his holiness</div>
                     <div class="line">For clothing me in these grave ornaments.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Legate</div>
                     <div class="line">I will attend upon your lordship's leisure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  Now Winchester will not submit, I trow,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or be inferior to the proudest peer.</div>
                     <div class="line">Humphrey of Gloucester, thou shalt well perceive</div>
                     <div class="line">That, neither in birth or for authority,</div>
                     <div class="line">The bishop will be overborne by thee:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll either make thee stoop and bend thy knee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or sack this country with a mutiny.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  France. Plains in Anjou.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CHARLES, BURGUNDY, ALENCON, BASTARD OF
ORLEANS, REIGNIER, JOAN LA PUCELLE, and forces</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">These news, my lord, may cheer our drooping spirits:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis said the stout Parisians do revolt</div>
                     <div class="line">And turn again unto the warlike French.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALENCON</div>
                     <div class="line">Then march to Paris, royal Charles of France,</div>
                     <div class="line">And keep not back your powers in dalliance.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace be amongst them, if they turn to us;</div>
                     <div class="line">Else, ruin combat with their palaces!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Scout</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Scout</div>
                     <div class="line">Success unto our valiant general,</div>
                     <div class="line">And happiness to his accomplices!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">What tidings send our scouts? I prithee, speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Scout</div>
                     <div class="line">The English army, that divided was</div>
                     <div class="line">Into two parties, is now conjoined in one,</div>
                     <div class="line">And means to give you battle presently.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Somewhat too sudden, sirs, the warning is;</div>
                     <div class="line">But we will presently provide for them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
