                     <div class="line">I trust the ghost of Talbot is not there:</div>
                     <div class="line">Now he is gone, my lord, you need not fear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Of all base passions, fear is most accursed.</div>
                     <div class="line">Command the conquest, Charles, it shall be thine,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let Henry fret and all the world repine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Then on, my lords; and France be fortunate!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  Before Angiers.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Alarum. Excursions. Enter JOAN LA PUCELLE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">The regent conquers, and the Frenchmen fly.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now help, ye charming spells and periapts;</div>
                     <div class="line">And ye choice spirits that admonish me</div>
                     <div class="line">And give me signs of future accidents.</div>
                     <p>Thunder</p>
                     <div class="line">You speedy helpers, that are substitutes</div>
                     <div class="line">Under the lordly monarch of the north,</div>
                     <div class="line">Appear and aid me in this enterprise.</div>
                     <p>Enter Fiends</p>
                     <div class="line">This speedy and quick appearance argues proof</div>
                     <div class="line">Of your accustom'd diligence to me.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, ye familiar spirits, that are cull'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of the powerful regions under earth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Help me this once, that France may get the field.</div>
                     <p>They walk, and speak not</p>
                     <div class="line">O, hold me not with silence over-long!</div>
                     <div class="line">Where I was wont to feed you with my blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll lop a member off and give it you</div>
                     <div class="line">In earnest of further benefit,</div>
                     <div class="line">So you do condescend to help me now.</div>
                     <p>They hang their heads</p>
                     <div class="line">No hope to have redress? My body shall</div>
                     <div class="line">Pay recompense, if you will grant my suit.</div>
                     <p>They shake their heads</p>
                     <div class="line">Cannot my body nor blood-sacrifice</div>
                     <div class="line">Entreat you to your wonted furtherance?</div>
                     <div class="line">Then take my soul, my body, soul and all,</div>
                     <div class="line">Before that England give the French the foil.</div>
                     <p>They depart</p>
                     <div class="line">See, they forsake me! Now the time is come</div>
                     <div class="line">That France must vail her lofty-plumed crest</div>
                     <div class="line">And let her head fall into England's lap.</div>
                     <div class="line">My ancient incantations are too weak,</div>
                     <div class="line">And hell too strong for me to buckle with:</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, France, thy glory droopeth to the dust.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Excursions. Re-enter JOAN LA PUCELLE fighting hand
to hand with YORK JOAN LA PUCELLE is taken. The
French fly</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Damsel of France, I think I have you fast:</div>
                     <div class="line">Unchain your spirits now with spelling charms</div>
                     <div class="line">And try if they can gain your liberty.</div>
                     <div class="line">A goodly prize, fit for the devil's grace!</div>
                     <div class="line">See, how the ugly wench doth bend her brows,</div>
                     <div class="line">As if with Circe she would change my shape!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Changed to a worser shape thou canst not be.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">O, Charles the Dauphin is a proper man;</div>
                     <div class="line">No shape but his can please your dainty eye.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">A plaguing mischief light on Charles and thee!</div>
                     <div class="line">And may ye both be suddenly surprised</div>
                     <div class="line">By bloody hands, in sleeping on your beds!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Fell banning hag, enchantress, hold thy tongue!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">I prithee, give me leave to curse awhile.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Curse, miscreant, when thou comest to the stake.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
               <p>Alarum. Enter SUFFOLK with MARGARET in his hand</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Be what thou wilt, thou art my prisoner.</div>
                     <p>Gazes on her</p>
                     <div class="line">O fairest beauty, do not fear nor fly!</div>
                     <div class="line">For I will touch thee but with reverent hands;</div>
                     <div class="line">I kiss these fingers for eternal peace,</div>
                     <div class="line">And lay them gently on thy tender side.</div>
                     <div class="line">Who art thou? say, that I may honour thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Margaret my name, and daughter to a king,</div>
                     <div class="line">The King of Naples, whosoe'er thou art.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">An earl I am, and Suffolk am I call'd.</div>
                     <div class="line">Be not offended, nature's miracle,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art allotted to be ta'en by me:</div>
                     <div class="line">So doth the swan her downy cygnets save,</div>
                     <div class="line">Keeping them prisoner underneath her wings.</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet, if this servile usage once offend.</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, and be free again, as Suffolk's friend.</div>
                     <p>She is going</p>
                     <div class="line">O, stay! I have no power to let her pass;</div>
                     <div class="line">My hand would free her, but my heart says no</div>
                     <div class="line">As plays the sun upon the glassy streams,</div>
                     <div class="line">Twinkling another counterfeited beam,</div>
                     <div class="line">So seems this gorgeous beauty to mine eyes.</div>
                     <div class="line">Fain would I woo her, yet I dare not speak:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll call for pen and ink, and write my mind.</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie, de la Pole! disable not thyself;</div>
                     <div class="line">Hast not a tongue? is she not here?</div>
                     <div class="line">Wilt thou be daunted at a woman's sight?</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, beauty's princely majesty is such,</div>
                     <div class="line">Confounds the tongue and makes the senses rough.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Say, Earl of Suffolk--if thy name be so--</div>
                     <div class="line">What ransom must I pay before I pass?</div>
                     <div class="line">For I perceive I am thy prisoner.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">How canst thou tell she will deny thy suit,</div>
                     <div class="line">Before thou make a trial of her love?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Why speak'st thou not? what ransom must I pay?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">She's beautiful, and therefore to be woo'd;</div>
                     <div class="line">She is a woman, therefore to be won.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Wilt thou accept of ransom? yea, or no.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Fond man, remember that thou hast a wife;</div>
                     <div class="line">Then how can Margaret be thy paramour?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">I were best to leave him, for he will not hear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">There all is marr'd; there lies a cooling card.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">He talks at random; sure, the man is mad.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet a dispensation may be had.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet I would that you would answer me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll win this Lady Margaret. For whom?</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, for my king: tush, that's a wooden thing!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">He talks of wood: it is some carpenter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet so my fancy may be satisfied,</div>
                     <div class="line">And peace established between these realms</div>
                     <div class="line">But there remains a scruple in that too;</div>
                     <div class="line">For though her father be the King of Naples,</div>
                     <div class="line">Duke of Anjou and Maine, yet is he poor,</div>
                     <div class="line">And our nobility will scorn the match.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Hear ye, captain, are you not at leisure?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">It shall be so, disdain they ne'er so much.</div>
                     <div class="line">Henry is youthful and will quickly yield.</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, I have a secret to reveal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">What though I be enthrall'd? he seems a knight,</div>
                     <div class="line">And will not any way dishonour me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Lady, vouchsafe to listen what I say.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Perhaps I shall be rescued by the French;</div>
                     <div class="line">And then I need not crave his courtesy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet madam, give me a hearing in a cause--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Tush, women have been captivate ere now.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Lady, wherefore talk you so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">I cry you mercy, 'tis but Quid for Quo.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Say, gentle princess, would you not suppose</div>
                     <div class="line">Your bondage happy, to be made a queen?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">To be a queen in bondage is more vile</div>
                     <div class="line">Than is a slave in base servility;</div>
                     <div class="line">For princes should be free.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">And so shall you,</div>
                     <div class="line">If happy England's royal king be free.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, what concerns his freedom unto me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll undertake to make thee Henry's queen,</div>
                     <div class="line">To put a golden sceptre in thy hand</div>
                     <div class="line">And set a precious crown upon thy head,</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou wilt condescend to be my--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">What?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">His love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">I am unworthy to be Henry's wife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">No, gentle madam; I unworthy am</div>
                     <div class="line">To woo so fair a dame to be his wife,</div>
                     <div class="line">And have no portion in the choice myself.</div>
                     <div class="line">How say you, madam, are ye so content?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">An if my father please, I am content.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Then call our captains and our colours forth.</div>
                     <div class="line">And, madam, at your father's castle walls</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll crave a parley, to confer with him.</div>
                     <p>A parley sounded. Enter REIGNIER on the walls</p>
                     <div class="line">See, Reignier, see, thy daughter prisoner!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                     <div class="line">To whom?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">To me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                     <div class="line">Suffolk, what remedy?</div>
                     <div class="line">I am a soldier, and unapt to weep,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or to exclaim on fortune's fickleness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, there is remedy enough, my lord:</div>
                     <div class="line">Consent, and for thy honour give consent,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy daughter shall be wedded to my king;</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom I with pain have woo'd and won thereto;</div>
                     <div class="line">And this her easy-held imprisonment</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath gained thy daughter princely liberty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                     <div class="line">Speaks Suffolk as he thinks?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Fair Margaret knows</div>
                     <div class="line">That Suffolk doth not flatter, face, or feign.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon thy princely warrant, I descend</div>
                     <div class="line">To give thee answer of thy just demand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit from the walls</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">And here I will expect thy coming.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Trumpets sound. Enter REIGNIER, below</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                     <div class="line">Welcome, brave earl, into our territories:</div>
                     <div class="line">Command in Anjou what your honour pleases.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Thanks, Reignier, happy for so sweet a child,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fit to be made companion with a king:</div>
                     <div class="line">What answer makes your grace unto my suit?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                     <div class="line">Since thou dost deign to woo her little worth</div>
                     <div class="line">To be the princely bride of such a lord;</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon condition I may quietly</div>
                     <div class="line">Enjoy mine own, the country Maine and Anjou,</div>
                     <div class="line">Free from oppression or the stroke of war,</div>
                     <div class="line">My daughter shall be Henry's, if he please.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">That is her ransom; I deliver her;</div>
                     <div class="line">And those two counties I will undertake</div>
                     <div class="line">Your grace shall well and quietly enjoy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                     <div class="line">And I again, in Henry's royal name,</div>
                     <div class="line">As deputy unto that gracious king,</div>
                     <div class="line">Give thee her hand, for sign of plighted faith.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Reignier of France, I give thee kingly thanks,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because this is in traffic of a king.</div>
                     <p>Aside</p>
                     <div class="line">And yet, methinks, I could be well content</div>
                     <div class="line">To be mine own attorney in this case.</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll over then to England with this news,</div>
                     <div class="line">And make this marriage to be solemnized.</div>
                     <div class="line">So farewell, Reignier: set this diamond safe</div>
                     <div class="line">In golden palaces, as it becomes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                     <div class="line">I do embrace thee, as I would embrace</div>
                     <div class="line">The Christian prince, King Henry, were he here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, my lord: good wishes, praise and prayers</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall Suffolk ever have of Margaret.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Going</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, sweet madam: but hark you, Margaret;</div>
                     <div class="line">No princely commendations to my king?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Such commendations as becomes a maid,</div>
                     <div class="line">A virgin and his servant, say to him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Words sweetly placed and modestly directed.</div>
                     <div class="line">But madam, I must trouble you again;</div>
                     <div class="line">No loving token to his majesty?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, my good lord, a pure unspotted heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">Never yet taint with love, I send the king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">And this withal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Kisses her</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                     <div class="line">That for thyself: I will not so presume</div>
                     <div class="line">To send such peevish tokens to a king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt REIGNIER and MARGARET</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">O, wert thou for myself! But, Suffolk, stay;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou mayst not wander in that labyrinth;</div>
                     <div class="line">There Minotaurs and ugly treasons lurk.</div>
                     <div class="line">Solicit Henry with her wondrous praise:</div>
                     <div class="line">Bethink thee on her virtues that surmount,</div>
                     <div class="line">And natural graces that extinguish art;</div>
                     <div class="line">Repeat their semblance often on the seas,</div>
                     <div class="line">That, when thou comest to kneel at Henry's feet,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou mayst bereave him of his wits with wonder.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter YORK, WARWICK, and others</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Bring forth that sorceress condemn'd to burn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter JOAN LA PUCELLE, guarded, and a Shepherd</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Shepherd</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, Joan, this kills thy father's heart outright!</div>
                     <div class="line">Have I sought every country far and near,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, now it is my chance to find thee out,</div>
                     <div class="line">Must I behold thy timeless cruel death?</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, Joan, sweet daughter Joan, I'll die with thee!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Decrepit miser! base ignoble wretch!</div>
                     <div class="line">I am descended of a gentler blood:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art no father nor no friend of mine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Shepherd</div>
                     <div class="line">Out, out! My lords, an please you, 'tis not so;</div>
                     <div class="line">I did beget her, all the parish knows:</div>
                     <div class="line">Her mother liveth yet, can testify</div>
                     <div class="line">She was the first fruit of my bachelorship.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Graceless! wilt thou deny thy parentage?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">This argues what her kind of life hath been,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wicked and vile; and so her death concludes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Shepherd</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie, Joan, that thou wilt be so obstacle!</div>
                     <div class="line">God knows thou art a collop of my flesh;</div>
                     <div class="line">And for thy sake have I shed many a tear:</div>
                     <div class="line">Deny me not, I prithee, gentle Joan.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Peasant, avaunt! You have suborn'd this man,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of purpose to obscure my noble birth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Shepherd</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis true, I gave a noble to the priest</div>
                     <div class="line">The morn that I was wedded to her mother.</div>
                     <div class="line">Kneel down and take my blessing, good my girl.</div>
                     <div class="line">Wilt thou not stoop? Now cursed be the time</div>
                     <div class="line">Of thy nativity! I would the milk</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy mother gave thee when thou suck'dst her breast,</div>
                     <div class="line">Had been a little ratsbane for thy sake!</div>
                     <div class="line">Or else, when thou didst keep my lambs a-field,</div>
                     <div class="line">I wish some ravenous wolf had eaten thee!</div>
                     <div class="line">Dost thou deny thy father, cursed drab?</div>
                     <div class="line">O, burn her, burn her! hanging is too good.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Take her away; for she hath lived too long,</div>
                     <div class="line">To fill the world with vicious qualities.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">First, let me tell you whom you have condemn'd:</div>
                     <div class="line">Not me begotten of a shepherd swain,</div>
                     <div class="line">But issued from the progeny of kings;</div>
                     <div class="line">Virtuous and holy; chosen from above,</div>
                     <div class="line">By inspiration of celestial grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">To work exceeding miracles on earth.</div>
                     <div class="line">I never had to do with wicked spirits:</div>
                     <div class="line">But you, that are polluted with your lusts,</div>
                     <div class="line">Stain'd with the guiltless blood of innocents,</div>
                     <div class="line">Corrupt and tainted with a thousand vices,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because you want the grace that others have,</div>
                     <div class="line">You judge it straight a thing impossible</div>
                     <div class="line">To compass wonders but by help of devils.</div>
                     <div class="line">No, misconceived! Joan of Arc hath been</div>
                     <div class="line">A virgin from her tender infancy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Chaste and immaculate in very thought;</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose maiden blood, thus rigorously effused,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will cry for vengeance at the gates of heaven.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, ay: away with her to execution!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">And hark ye, sirs; because she is a maid,</div>
                     <div class="line">Spare for no faggots, let there be enow:</div>
                     <div class="line">Place barrels of pitch upon the fatal stake,</div>
                     <div class="line">That so her torture may be shortened.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Will nothing turn your unrelenting hearts?</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, Joan, discover thine infirmity,</div>
                     <div class="line">That warranteth by law to be thy privilege.</div>
                     <div class="line">I am with child, ye bloody homicides:</div>
                     <div class="line">Murder not then the fruit within my womb,</div>
                     <div class="line">Although ye hale me to a violent death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Now heaven forfend! the holy maid with child!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">The greatest miracle that e'er ye wrought:</div>
                     <div class="line">Is all your strict preciseness come to this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">She and the Dauphin have been juggling:</div>
                     <div class="line">I did imagine what would be her refuge.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, go to; we'll have no bastards live;</div>
                     <div class="line">Especially since Charles must father it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">You are deceived; my child is none of his:</div>
                     <div class="line">It was Alencon that enjoy'd my love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Alencon! that notorious Machiavel!</div>
                     <div class="line">It dies, an if it had a thousand lives.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">O, give me leave, I have deluded you:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twas neither Charles nor yet the duke I named,</div>
                     <div class="line">But Reignier, king of Naples, that prevail'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">A married man! that's most intolerable.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, here's a girl! I think she knows not well,</div>
                     <div class="line">There were so many, whom she may accuse.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">It's sign she hath been liberal and free.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet, forsooth, she is a virgin pure.</div>
                     <div class="line">Strumpet, thy words condemn thy brat and thee:</div>
                     <div class="line">Use no entreaty, for it is in vain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Then lead me hence; with whom I leave my curse:</div>
                     <div class="line">May never glorious sun reflex his beams</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the country where you make abode;</div>
                     <div class="line">But darkness and the gloomy shade of death</div>
                     <div class="line">Environ you, till mischief and despair</div>
                     <div class="line">Drive you to break your necks or hang yourselves!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit, guarded</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Break thou in pieces and consume to ashes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou foul accursed minister of hell!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER, attended</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord regent, I do greet your excellence</div>
                     <div class="line">With letters of commission from the king.</div>
                     <div class="line">For know, my lords, the states of Christendom,</div>
                     <div class="line">Moved with remorse of these outrageous broils,</div>
                     <div class="line">Have earnestly implored a general peace</div>
                     <div class="line">Betwixt our nation and the aspiring French;</div>
                     <div class="line">And here at hand the Dauphin and his train</div>
                     <div class="line">Approacheth, to confer about some matter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Is all our travail turn'd to this effect?</div>
                     <div class="line">After the slaughter of so many peers,</div>
                     <div class="line">So many captains, gentlemen and soldiers,</div>
                     <div class="line">That in this quarrel have been overthrown</div>
                     <div class="line">And sold their bodies for their country's benefit,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall we at last conclude effeminate peace?</div>
                     <div class="line">Have we not lost most part of all the towns,</div>
                     <div class="line">By treason, falsehood and by treachery,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our great progenitors had conquered?</div>
                     <div class="line">O Warwick, Warwick! I foresee with grief</div>
                     <div class="line">The utter loss of all the realm of France.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Be patient, York: if we conclude a peace,</div>
                     <div class="line">It shall be with such strict and severe covenants</div>
                     <div class="line">As little shall the Frenchmen gain thereby.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CHARLES, ALENCON, BASTARD OF ORLEANS,
REIGNIER, and others</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Since, lords of England, it is thus agreed</div>
                     <div class="line">That peaceful truce shall be proclaim'd in France,</div>
                     <div class="line">We come to be informed by yourselves</div>
                     <div class="line">What the conditions of that league must be.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak, Winchester; for boiling choler chokes</div>
                     <div class="line">The hollow passage of my poison'd voice,</div>
                     <div class="line">By sight of these our baleful enemies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Charles, and the rest, it is enacted thus:</div>
                     <div class="line">That, in regard King Henry gives consent,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of mere compassion and of lenity,</div>
                     <div class="line">To ease your country of distressful war,</div>
                     <div class="line">And suffer you to breathe in fruitful peace,</div>
                     <div class="line">You shall become true liegemen to his crown:</div>
                     <div class="line">And Charles, upon condition thou wilt swear</div>
                     <div class="line">To pay him tribute, submit thyself,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shalt be placed as viceroy under him,</div>
                     <div class="line">And still enjoy thy regal dignity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALENCON</div>
                     <div class="line">Must he be then as shadow of himself?</div>
                     <div class="line">Adorn his temples with a coronet,</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet, in substance and authority,</div>
                     <div class="line">Retain but privilege of a private man?</div>
                     <div class="line">This proffer is absurd and reasonless.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis known already that I am possess'd</div>
                     <div class="line">With more than half the Gallian territories,</div>
                     <div class="line">And therein reverenced for their lawful king:</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall I, for lucre of the rest unvanquish'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Detract so much from that prerogative,</div>
                     <div class="line">As to be call'd but viceroy of the whole?</div>
                     <div class="line">No, lord ambassador, I'll rather keep</div>
                     <div class="line">That which I have than, coveting for more,</div>
                     <div class="line">Be cast from possibility of all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Insulting Charles! hast thou by secret means</div>
                     <div class="line">Used intercession to obtain a league,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, now the matter grows to compromise,</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand'st thou aloof upon comparison?</div>
                     <div class="line">Either accept the title thou usurp'st,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of benefit proceeding from our king</div>
                     <div class="line">And not of any challenge of desert,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or we will plague thee with incessant wars.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, you do not well in obstinacy</div>
                     <div class="line">To cavil in the course of this contract:</div>
                     <div class="line">If once it be neglected, ten to one</div>
                     <div class="line">We shall not find like opportunity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALENCON</div>
                     <div class="line">To say the truth, it is your policy</div>
                     <div class="line">To save your subjects from such massacre</div>
                     <div class="line">And ruthless slaughters as are daily seen</div>
                     <div class="line">By our proceeding in hostility;</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore take this compact of a truce,</div>
                     <div class="line">Although you break it when your pleasure serves.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">How say'st thou, Charles? shall our condition stand?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                     <div class="line">It shall;</div>
                     <div class="line">Only reserved, you claim no interest</div>
                     <div class="line">In any of our towns of garrison.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Then swear allegiance to his majesty,</div>
                     <div class="line">As thou art knight, never to disobey</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor be rebellious to the crown of England,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou, nor thy nobles, to the crown of England.</div>
                     <div class="line">So, now dismiss your army when ye please:</div>
                     <div class="line">Hang up your ensign, let your drums be still,</div>
                     <div class="line">For here we entertain a solemn peace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.6">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>5. SCENE V.  London. The palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SUFFOLK in conference with KING HENRY VI,
GLOUCESTER and EXETER</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Your wondrous rare description, noble earl,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of beauteous Margaret hath astonish'd me:</div>
                     <div class="line">Her virtues graced with external gifts</div>
                     <div class="line">Do breed love's settled passions in my heart:</div>
                     <div class="line">And like as rigor of tempestuous gusts</div>
                     <div class="line">Provokes the mightiest hulk against the tide,</div>
                     <div class="line">So am I driven by breath of her renown</div>
                     <div class="line">Either to suffer shipwreck or arrive</div>
                     <div class="line">Where I may have fruition of her love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Tush, my good lord, this superficial tale</div>
                     <div class="line">Is but a preface of her worthy praise;</div>
                     <div class="line">The chief perfections of that lovely dame</div>
                     <div class="line">Had I sufficient skill to utter them,</div>
                     <div class="line">Would make a volume of enticing lines,</div>
                     <div class="line">Able to ravish any dull conceit:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, which is more, she is not so divine,</div>
                     <div class="line">So full-replete with choice of all delights,</div>
                     <div class="line">But with as humble lowliness of mind</div>
                     <div class="line">She is content to be at your command;</div>
                     <div class="line">Command, I mean, of virtuous chaste intents,</div>
                     <div class="line">To love and honour Henry as her lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">And otherwise will Henry ne'er presume.</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, my lord protector, give consent</div>
                     <div class="line">That Margaret may be England's royal queen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">So should I give consent to flatter sin.</div>
                     <div class="line">You know, my lord, your highness is betroth'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto another lady of esteem:</div>
                     <div class="line">How shall we then dispense with that contract,</div>
                     <div class="line">And not deface your honour with reproach?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">As doth a ruler with unlawful oaths;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or one that, at a triumph having vow'd</div>
                     <div class="line">To try his strength, forsaketh yet the lists</div>
                     <div class="line">By reason of his adversary's odds:</div>
                     <div class="line">A poor earl's daughter is unequal odds,</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore may be broke without offence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, what, I pray, is Margaret more than that?</div>
                     <div class="line">Her father is no better than an earl,</div>
                     <div class="line">Although in glorious titles he excel.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, lord, her father is a king,</div>
                     <div class="line">The King of Naples and Jerusalem;</div>
                     <div class="line">And of such great authority in France</div>
                     <div class="line">As his alliance will confirm our peace</div>
                     <div class="line">And keep the Frenchmen in allegiance.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">And so the Earl of Armagnac may do,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because he is near kinsman unto Charles.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                     <div class="line">Beside, his wealth doth warrant a liberal dower,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where Reignier sooner will receive than give.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">A dower, my lords! disgrace not so your king,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he should be so abject, base and poor,</div>
                     <div class="line">To choose for wealth and not for perfect love.</div>
                     <div class="line">Henry is able to enrich his queen</div>
                     <div class="line">And not seek a queen to make him rich:</div>
                     <div class="line">So worthless peasants bargain for their wives,</div>
                     <div class="line">As market-men for oxen, sheep, or horse.</div>
                     <div class="line">Marriage is a matter of more worth</div>
                     <div class="line">Than to be dealt in by attorneyship;</div>
                     <div class="line">Not whom we will, but whom his grace affects,</div>
                     <div class="line">Must be companion of his nuptial bed:</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore, lords, since he affects her most,</div>
                     <div class="line">It most of all these reasons bindeth us,</div>
                     <div class="line">In our opinions she should be preferr'd.</div>
                     <div class="line">For what is wedlock forced but a hell,</div>
                     <div class="line">An age of discord and continual strife?</div>
                     <div class="line">Whereas the contrary bringeth bliss,</div>
                     <div class="line">And is a pattern of celestial peace.</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom should we match with Henry, being a king,</div>
                     <div class="line">But Margaret, that is daughter to a king?</div>
                     <div class="line">Her peerless feature, joined with her birth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Approves her fit for none but for a king:</div>
                     <div class="line">Her valiant courage and undaunted spirit,</div>
                     <div class="line">More than in women commonly is seen,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will answer our hope in issue of a king;</div>
                     <div class="line">For Henry, son unto a conqueror,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is likely to beget more conquerors,</div>
                     <div class="line">If with a lady of so high resolve</div>
                     <div class="line">As is fair Margaret he be link'd in love.</div>
                     <div class="line">Then yield, my lords; and here conclude with me</div>
                     <div class="line">That Margaret shall be queen, and none but she.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                     <div class="line">Whether it be through force of your report,</div>
                     <div class="line">My noble Lord of Suffolk, or for that</div>
                     <div class="line">My tender youth was never yet attaint</div>
                     <div class="line">With any passion of inflaming love,</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot tell; but this I am assured,</div>
                     <div class="line">I feel such sharp dissension in my breast,</div>
                     <div class="line">Such fierce alarums both of hope and fear,</div>
                     <div class="line">As I am sick with working of my thoughts.</div>
                     <div class="line">Take, therefore, shipping; post, my lord, to France;</div>
                     <div class="line">Agree to any covenants, and procure</div>
                     <div class="line">That Lady Margaret do vouchsafe to come</div>
                     <div class="line">To cross the seas to England and be crown'd</div>
                     <div class="line">King Henry's faithful and anointed queen:</div>
                     <div class="line">For your expenses and sufficient charge,</div>
                     <div class="line">Among the people gather up a tenth.</div>
                     <div class="line">Be gone, I say; for, till you do return,</div>
                     <div class="line">I rest perplexed with a thousand cares.</div>
                     <div class="line">And you, good uncle, banish all offence:</div>
                     <div class="line">If you do censure me by what you were,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not what you are, I know it will excuse</div>
                     <div class="line">This sudden execution of my will.</div>
                     <div class="line">And so, conduct me where, from company,</div>
                     <div class="line">I may revolve and ruminate my grief.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, grief, I fear me, both at first and last.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt GLOUCESTER and EXETER</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus Suffolk hath prevail'd; and thus he goes,</div>
                     <div class="line">As did the youthful Paris once to Greece,</div>
                     <div class="line">With hope to find the like event in love,</div>
                     <div class="line">But prosper better than the Trojan did.</div>
                     <div class="line">Margaret shall now be queen, and rule the king;</div>
                     <div class="line">But I will rule both her, the king and realm.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
         </article>
      </article>
      <script src="../../resources/js/prism.js"/>
   </body>
</html>

      <link href="../../resources/css/publishers.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <meta charset="utf-8"/>
      <meta content="DocBook XSL 2.0 Stylesheets Vxxx" name="generator"/>
      <script src="../../resources/js/dbmodnizr.js" type="text/javascript"/>
      <title>The First Part of Henry the Sixth</title>
   </head>
   <body>
      <article class="book" id="R.1">
         <header class="book-titlepage">
            <h1>The First Part of Henry the Sixth</h1>
         </header>
         <div class="lists-of-titles">
            <div class="toc">

                  <li>
                     <span>

                     </span>

                           </span>

                     </span>

                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE II.  Orleans. Within the town.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.4">3. SCENE III.  Auvergne. The COUNTESS's castle.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.5">4. SCENE IV.  London. The Temple-garden.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.6">5. SCENE V.  The Tower of London.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.5">3. ACT III</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.2">1. SCENE I.  London. The Parliament-house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.3">2. SCENE II.  France. Before Rouen.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.4">3. SCENE III.  The plains near Rouen.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.5">4. SCENE IV.  Paris. The palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.6">4. ACT IV</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.2">1. SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.3">2. SCENE II.  Before Bourdeaux.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.4">3. SCENE III.  Plains in Gascony.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.5">4. SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.6">5. SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.7">6. SCENE VI.  A field of battle.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.8">7. SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.7">5. ACT V</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  London. The palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  France. Plains in Anjou.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III.  Before Angiers.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.5">4. SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.6">5. SCENE V.  London. The palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
               </ul>
            </div>
         </div>
         <div class="content">
            <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
               <header class="preface-titlepage">
                  <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="content">
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">KING HENRY THE SIXTH</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">DUKE OF GLOUCESTER, uncle to the King, and Protector. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">DUKE OF BEDFORD, uncle to the King, and Regent of France. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">THOMAS BEAUFORT, Duke of Exeter, great-uncle to the King. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">HENRY BEAUFORT, great-uncle to the King, Bishop of Winchester, and afterwards Cardinal. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">JOHN BEAUFORT, Earl, afterwards Duke, of Somerset. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">RICHARD PLANTAGENET, son of Richard late Earl of Cambridge, afterwards Duke of York.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">EARL OF WARWICK</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">EARL OF SALISBURY</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">EARL OF SUFFOLK</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">LORD TALBOT, afterwards Earl of Shrewsbury. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">JOHN TALBOT, Lord Talbot's son.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">EDMUND MORTIMER, Earl of March. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">SIR JOHN FASTOLFE</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">SIR WILLIAM LUCY</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">SIR WILLIAM GLANSDALE</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">SIR THOMAS GARGRAVE</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Mayor of London</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">WOODVILE, Lieutenant of the Tower.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">VERNON, of the White-Rose or York faction.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">BASSET, of the Red-Rose or Lancaster faction.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">A Lawyer. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Mortimer's Keepers. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">CHARLES, Dauphin, and afterwards King, of France.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">REIGNIER, Duke of Anjou, and titular King of Naples.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">DUKE OF BURGUNDY</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">DUKE OF ALENCON</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">BASTARD OF ORLEANS</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Governor of Paris.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Master-Gunner of Orleans, and his Son. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">General of the French forces in Bourdeaux. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">A French Sergeant. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">A Porter.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">An old Shepherd, father to Joan la Pucelle. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">MARGARET, daughter to Reignier, afterwards married to King Henry.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">COUNTESS OF AUVERGNE</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">JOAN LA PUCELLE, commonly called Joan of Arc.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Lords, Warders of the Tower, Heralds, Officers, Soldiers, Messengers, and Attendants.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Fiends appearing to La Pucelle.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>SCENE  Partly in England, and partly in France.</p>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  Westminster Abbey.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II.  France. Before Orleans.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.4">3. SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.5">4. SCENE IV.  Orleans.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
