                              <a href="#R.1.3.6">5. SCENE V.  The same.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.7">6. SCENE VI.  The same.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  Westminster Abbey.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Dead March. Enter the Funeral of KING HENRY the
Fifth, attended on by Dukes of BEDFORD, Regent of
France; GLOUCESTER, Protector; and EXETER, Earl of
WARWICK, the BISHOP OF WINCHESTER, Heralds, &c</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEDFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Hung be the heavens with black, yield day to night!</div>
                              <div class="line">Comets, importing change of times and states,</div>
                              <div class="line">Brandish your crystal tresses in the sky,</div>
                              <div class="line">And with them scourge the bad revolting stars</div>
                              <div class="line">That have consented unto Henry's death!</div>
                              <div class="line">King Henry the Fifth, too famous to live long!</div>
                              <div class="line">England ne'er lost a king of so much worth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">England ne'er had a king until his time.</div>
                              <div class="line">Virtue he had, deserving to command:</div>
                              <div class="line">His brandish'd sword did blind men with his beams:</div>
                              <div class="line">His arms spread wider than a dragon's wings;</div>
                              <div class="line">His sparking eyes, replete with wrathful fire,</div>
                              <div class="line">More dazzled and drove back his enemies</div>
                              <div class="line">Than mid-day sun fierce bent against their faces.</div>
                              <div class="line">What should I say? his deeds exceed all speech:</div>
                              <div class="line">He ne'er lift up his hand but conquered.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                              <div class="line">We mourn in black: why mourn we not in blood?</div>
                              <div class="line">Henry is dead and never shall revive:</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon a wooden coffin we attend,</div>
                              <div class="line">And death's dishonourable victory</div>
                              <div class="line">We with our stately presence glorify,</div>
                              <div class="line">Like captives bound to a triumphant car.</div>
                              <div class="line">What! shall we curse the planets of mishap</div>
                              <div class="line">That plotted thus our glory's overthrow?</div>
                              <div class="line">Or shall we think the subtle-witted French</div>
                              <div class="line">Conjurers and sorcerers, that afraid of him</div>
                              <div class="line">By magic verses have contrived his end?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF WINCHESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">He was a king bless'd of the King of kings.</div>
                              <div class="line">Unto the French the dreadful judgement-day</div>
                              <div class="line">So dreadful will not be as was his sight.</div>
                              <div class="line">The battles of the Lord of hosts he fought:</div>
                              <div class="line">The church's prayers made him so prosperous.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">The church! where is it? Had not churchmen pray'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">His thread of life had not so soon decay'd:</div>
                              <div class="line">None do you like but an effeminate prince,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whom, like a school-boy, you may over-awe.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF WINCHESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Gloucester, whate'er we like, thou art protector</div>
                              <div class="line">And lookest to command the prince and realm.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy wife is proud; she holdeth thee in awe,</div>
                              <div class="line">More than God or religious churchmen may.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Name not religion, for thou lovest the flesh,</div>
                              <div class="line">And ne'er throughout the year to church thou go'st</div>
                              <div class="line">Except it be to pray against thy foes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEDFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Cease, cease these jars and rest your minds in peace:</div>
                              <div class="line">Let's to the altar: heralds, wait on us:</div>
                              <div class="line">Instead of gold, we'll offer up our arms:</div>
                              <div class="line">Since arms avail not now that Henry's dead.</div>
                              <div class="line">Posterity, await for wretched years,</div>
                              <div class="line">When at their mothers' moist eyes babes shall suck,</div>
                              <div class="line">Our isle be made a nourish of salt tears,</div>
                              <div class="line">And none but women left to wail the dead.</div>
                              <div class="line">Henry the Fifth, thy ghost I invocate:</div>
                              <div class="line">Prosper this realm, keep it from civil broils,</div>
                              <div class="line">Combat with adverse planets in the heavens!</div>
                              <div class="line">A far more glorious star thy soul will make</div>
                              <div class="line">Than Julius Caesar or bright--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">My honourable lords, health to you all!</div>
                              <div class="line">Sad tidings bring I to you out of France,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of loss, of slaughter and discomfiture:</div>
                              <div class="line">Guienne, Champagne, Rheims, Orleans,</div>
                              <div class="line">Paris, Guysors, Poictiers, are all quite lost.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEDFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">What say'st thou, man, before dead Henry's corse?</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak softly, or the loss of those great towns</div>
                              <div class="line">Will make him burst his lead and rise from death.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Is Paris lost? is Rouen yielded up?</div>
                              <div class="line">If Henry were recall'd to life again,</div>
                              <div class="line">These news would cause him once more yield the ghost.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                              <div class="line">How were they lost? what treachery was used?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">No treachery; but want of men and money.</div>
                              <div class="line">Amongst the soldiers this is muttered,</div>
                              <div class="line">That here you maintain several factions,</div>
                              <div class="line">And whilst a field should be dispatch'd and fought,</div>
                              <div class="line">You are disputing of your generals:</div>
                              <div class="line">One would have lingering wars with little cost;</div>
                              <div class="line">Another would fly swift, but wanteth wings;</div>
                              <div class="line">A third thinks, without expense at all,</div>
                              <div class="line">By guileful fair words peace may be obtain'd.</div>
                              <div class="line">Awake, awake, English nobility!</div>
                              <div class="line">Let not sloth dim your horrors new-begot:</div>
                              <div class="line">Cropp'd are the flower-de-luces in your arms;</div>
                              <div class="line">Of England's coat one half is cut away.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                              <div class="line">Were our tears wanting to this funeral,</div>
                              <div class="line">These tidings would call forth their flowing tides.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEDFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Me they concern; Regent I am of France.</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me my steeled coat. I'll fight for France.</div>
                              <div class="line">Away with these disgraceful wailing robes!</div>
                              <div class="line">Wounds will I lend the French instead of eyes,</div>
                              <div class="line">To weep their intermissive miseries.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter to them another Messenger</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">Lords, view these letters full of bad mischance.</div>
                              <div class="line">France is revolted from the English quite,</div>
                              <div class="line">Except some petty towns of no import:</div>
                              <div class="line">The Dauphin Charles is crowned king of Rheims;</div>
                              <div class="line">The Bastard of Orleans with him is join'd;</div>
                              <div class="line">Reignier, Duke of Anjou, doth take his part;</div>
                              <div class="line">The Duke of Alencon flieth to his side.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                              <div class="line">The Dauphin crowned king! all fly to him!</div>
                              <div class="line">O, whither shall we fly from this reproach?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">We will not fly, but to our enemies' throats.</div>
                              <div class="line">Bedford, if thou be slack, I'll fight it out.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEDFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Gloucester, why doubt'st thou of my forwardness?</div>
                              <div class="line">An army have I muster'd in my thoughts,</div>
                              <div class="line">Wherewith already France is overrun.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter another Messenger</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">My gracious lords, to add to your laments,</div>
                              <div class="line">Wherewith you now bedew King Henry's hearse,</div>
                              <div class="line">I must inform you of a dismal fight</div>
                              <div class="line">Betwixt the stout Lord Talbot and the French.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF WINCHESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">What! wherein Talbot overcame? is't so?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">O, no; wherein Lord Talbot was o'erthrown:</div>
                              <div class="line">The circumstance I'll tell you more at large.</div>
                              <div class="line">The tenth of August last this dreadful lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">Retiring from the siege of Orleans,</div>
                              <div class="line">Having full scarce six thousand in his troop.</div>
                              <div class="line">By three and twenty thousand of the French</div>
                              <div class="line">Was round encompassed and set upon.</div>
                              <div class="line">No leisure had he to enrank his men;</div>
                              <div class="line">He wanted pikes to set before his archers;</div>
                              <div class="line">Instead whereof sharp stakes pluck'd out of hedges</div>
                              <div class="line">They pitched in the ground confusedly,</div>
                              <div class="line">To keep the horsemen off from breaking in.</div>
                              <div class="line">More than three hours the fight continued;</div>
                              <div class="line">Where valiant Talbot above human thought</div>
                              <div class="line">Enacted wonders with his sword and lance:</div>
                              <div class="line">Hundreds he sent to hell, and none durst stand him;</div>
                              <div class="line">Here, there, and every where, enraged he flew:</div>
                              <div class="line">The French exclaim'd, the devil was in arms;</div>
                              <div class="line">All the whole army stood agazed on him:</div>
                              <div class="line">His soldiers spying his undaunted spirit</div>
                              <div class="line">A Talbot! a Talbot! cried out amain</div>
                              <div class="line">And rush'd into the bowels of the battle.</div>
                              <div class="line">Here had the conquest fully been seal'd up,</div>
                              <div class="line">If Sir John Fastolfe had not play'd the coward:</div>
                              <div class="line">He, being in the vaward, placed behind</div>
                              <div class="line">With purpose to relieve and follow them,</div>
                              <div class="line">Cowardly fled, not having struck one stroke.</div>
                              <div class="line">Hence grew the general wreck and massacre;</div>
                              <div class="line">Enclosed were they with their enemies:</div>
                              <div class="line">A base Walloon, to win the Dauphin's grace,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thrust Talbot with a spear into the back,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whom all France with their chief assembled strength</div>
                              <div class="line">Durst not presume to look once in the face.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEDFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Is Talbot slain? then I will slay myself,</div>
                              <div class="line">For living idly here in pomp and ease,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whilst such a worthy leader, wanting aid,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unto his dastard foemen is betray'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">O no, he lives; but is took prisoner,</div>
                              <div class="line">And Lord Scales with him and Lord Hungerford:</div>
                              <div class="line">Most of the rest slaughter'd or took likewise.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEDFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">His ransom there is none but I shall pay:</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll hale the Dauphin headlong from his throne:</div>
                              <div class="line">His crown shall be the ransom of my friend;</div>
                              <div class="line">Four of their lords I'll change for one of ours.</div>
                              <div class="line">Farewell, my masters; to my task will I;</div>
                              <div class="line">Bonfires in France forthwith I am to make,</div>
                              <div class="line">To keep our great Saint George's feast withal:</div>
                              <div class="line">Ten thousand soldiers with me I will take,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose bloody deeds shall make all Europe quake.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">So you had need; for Orleans is besieged;</div>
                              <div class="line">The English army is grown weak and faint:</div>
                              <div class="line">The Earl of Salisbury craveth supply,</div>
                              <div class="line">And hardly keeps his men from mutiny,</div>
                              <div class="line">Since they, so few, watch such a multitude.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                              <div class="line">Remember, lords, your oaths to Henry sworn,</div>
                              <div class="line">Either to quell the Dauphin utterly,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or bring him in obedience to your yoke.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BEDFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">I do remember it; and here take my leave,</div>
                              <div class="line">To go about my preparation.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll to the Tower with all the haste I can,</div>
                              <div class="line">To view the artillery and munition;</div>
                              <div class="line">And then I will proclaim young Henry king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                              <div class="line">To Eltham will I, where the young king is,</div>
                              <div class="line">Being ordain'd his special governor,</div>
                              <div class="line">And for his safety there I'll best devise.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF WINCHESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Each hath his place and function to attend:</div>
                              <div class="line">I am left out; for me nothing remains.</div>
                              <div class="line">But long I will not be Jack out of office:</div>
                              <div class="line">The king from Eltham I intend to steal</div>
                              <div class="line">And sit at chiefest stern of public weal.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  France. Before Orleans.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Sound a flourish. Enter CHARLES, ALENCON, and
REIGNIER, marching with drum and Soldiers</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Mars his true moving, even as in the heavens</div>
                              <div class="line">So in the earth, to this day is not known:</div>
                              <div class="line">Late did he shine upon the English side;</div>
                              <div class="line">Now we are victors; upon us he smiles.</div>
                              <div class="line">What towns of any moment but we have?</div>
                              <div class="line">At pleasure here we lie near Orleans;</div>
                              <div class="line">Otherwhiles the famish'd English, like pale ghosts,</div>
                              <div class="line">Faintly besiege us one hour in a month.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALENCON</div>
                              <div class="line">They want their porridge and their fat bull-beeves:</div>
                              <div class="line">Either they must be dieted like mules</div>
                              <div class="line">And have their provender tied to their mouths</div>
                              <div class="line">Or piteous they will look, like drowned mice.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                              <div class="line">Let's raise the siege: why live we idly here?</div>
                              <div class="line">Talbot is taken, whom we wont to fear:</div>
                              <div class="line">Remaineth none but mad-brain'd Salisbury;</div>
                              <div class="line">And he may well in fretting spend his gall,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor men nor money hath he to make war.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Sound, sound alarum! we will rush on them.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now for the honour of the forlorn French!</div>
                              <div class="line">Him I forgive my death that killeth me</div>
                              <div class="line">When he sees me go back one foot or fly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                        <p>Here alarum; they are beaten back by the English
with great loss. Re-enter CHARLES, ALENCON, and REIGNIER</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Who ever saw the like? what men have I!</div>
                              <div class="line">Dogs! cowards! dastards! I would ne'er have fled,</div>
                              <div class="line">But that they left me 'midst my enemies.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                              <div class="line">Salisbury is a desperate homicide;</div>
                              <div class="line">He fighteth as one weary of his life.</div>
                              <div class="line">The other lords, like lions wanting food,</div>
                              <div class="line">Do rush upon us as their hungry prey.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALENCON</div>
                              <div class="line">Froissart, a countryman of ours, records,</div>
                              <div class="line">England all Olivers and Rowlands bred,</div>
                              <div class="line">During the time Edward the Third did reign.</div>
                              <div class="line">More truly now may this be verified;</div>
                              <div class="line">For none but Samsons and Goliases</div>
                              <div class="line">It sendeth forth to skirmish. One to ten!</div>
                              <div class="line">Lean, raw-boned rascals! who would e'er suppose</div>
                              <div class="line">They had such courage and audacity?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Let's leave this town; for they are hare-brain'd slaves,</div>
                              <div class="line">And hunger will enforce them to be more eager:</div>
                              <div class="line">Of old I know them; rather with their teeth</div>
                              <div class="line">The walls they'll tear down than forsake the siege.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                              <div class="line">I think, by some odd gimmors or device</div>
                              <div class="line">Their arms are set like clocks, stiff to strike on;</div>
                              <div class="line">Else ne'er could they hold out so as they do.</div>
                              <div class="line">By my consent, we'll even let them alone.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALENCON</div>
                              <div class="line">Be it so.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter the BASTARD OF ORLEANS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD OF ORLEANS</div>
                              <div class="line">Where's the Prince Dauphin? I have news for him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Bastard of Orleans, thrice welcome to us.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD OF ORLEANS</div>
                              <div class="line">Methinks your looks are sad, your cheer appall'd:</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath the late overthrow wrought this offence?</div>
                              <div class="line">Be not dismay'd, for succor is at hand:</div>
                              <div class="line">A holy maid hither with me I bring,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which by a vision sent to her from heaven</div>
                              <div class="line">Ordained is to raise this tedious siege</div>
                              <div class="line">And drive the English forth the bounds of France.</div>
                              <div class="line">The spirit of deep prophecy she hath,</div>
                              <div class="line">Exceeding the nine sibyls of old Rome:</div>
                              <div class="line">What's past and what's to come she can descry.</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak, shall I call her in? Believe my words,</div>
                              <div class="line">For they are certain and unfallible.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, call her in.</div>
                              <p>Exit BASTARD OF ORLEANS</p>
                              <div class="line">But first, to try her skill,</div>
                              <div class="line">Reignier, stand thou as Dauphin in my place:</div>
                              <div class="line">Question her proudly; let thy looks be stern:</div>
                              <div class="line">By this means shall we sound what skill she hath.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter the BASTARD OF ORLEANS, with JOAN LA PUCELLE</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                              <div class="line">Fair maid, is't thou wilt do these wondrous feats?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                              <div class="line">Reignier, is't thou that thinkest to beguile me?</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is the Dauphin? Come, come from behind;</div>
                              <div class="line">I know thee well, though never seen before.</div>
                              <div class="line">Be not amazed, there's nothing hid from me:</div>
                              <div class="line">In private will I talk with thee apart.</div>
                              <div class="line">Stand back, you lords, and give us leave awhile.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                              <div class="line">She takes upon her bravely at first dash.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                              <div class="line">Dauphin, I am by birth a shepherd's daughter,</div>
                              <div class="line">My wit untrain'd in any kind of art.</div>
                              <div class="line">Heaven and our Lady gracious hath it pleased</div>
                              <div class="line">To shine on my contemptible estate:</div>
                              <div class="line">Lo, whilst I waited on my tender lambs,</div>
                              <div class="line">And to sun's parching heat display'd my cheeks,</div>
                              <div class="line">God's mother deigned to appear to me</div>
                              <div class="line">And in a vision full of majesty</div>
                              <div class="line">Will'd me to leave my base vocation</div>
                              <div class="line">And free my country from calamity:</div>
                              <div class="line">Her aid she promised and assured success:</div>
                              <div class="line">In complete glory she reveal'd herself;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, whereas I was black and swart before,</div>
                              <div class="line">With those clear rays which she infused on me</div>
                              <div class="line">That beauty am I bless'd with which you see.</div>
                              <div class="line">Ask me what question thou canst possible,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I will answer unpremeditated:</div>
                              <div class="line">My courage try by combat, if thou darest,</div>
                              <div class="line">And thou shalt find that I exceed my sex.</div>
                              <div class="line">Resolve on this, thou shalt be fortunate,</div>
                              <div class="line">If thou receive me for thy warlike mate.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou hast astonish'd me with thy high terms:</div>
                              <div class="line">Only this proof I'll of thy valour make,</div>
                              <div class="line">In single combat thou shalt buckle with me,</div>
                              <div class="line">And if thou vanquishest, thy words are true;</div>
                              <div class="line">Otherwise I renounce all confidence.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                              <div class="line">I am prepared: here is my keen-edged sword,</div>
                              <div class="line">Deck'd with five flower-de-luces on each side;</div>
                              <div class="line">The which at Touraine, in Saint Katharine's</div>
                              <div class="line">churchyard,</div>
                              <div class="line">Out of a great deal of old iron I chose forth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Then come, o' God's name; I fear no woman.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                              <div class="line">And while I live, I'll ne'er fly from a man.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Here they fight, and JOAN LA PUCELLE overcomes</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Stay, stay thy hands! thou art an Amazon</div>
                              <div class="line">And fightest with the sword of Deborah.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                              <div class="line">Christ's mother helps me, else I were too weak.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Whoe'er helps thee, 'tis thou that must help me:</div>
                              <div class="line">Impatiently I burn with thy desire;</div>
                              <div class="line">My heart and hands thou hast at once subdued.</div>
                              <div class="line">Excellent Pucelle, if thy name be so,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me thy servant and not sovereign be:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis the French Dauphin sueth to thee thus.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                              <div class="line">I must not yield to any rites of love,</div>
                              <div class="line">For my profession's sacred from above:</div>
                              <div class="line">When I have chased all thy foes from hence,</div>
                              <div class="line">Then will I think upon a recompense.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Meantime look gracious on thy prostrate thrall.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, methinks, is very long in talk.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALENCON</div>
                              <div class="line">Doubtless he shrives this woman to her smock;</div>
                              <div class="line">Else ne'er could he so long protract his speech.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall we disturb him, since he keeps no mean?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALENCON</div>
                              <div class="line">He may mean more than we poor men do know:</div>
                              <div class="line">These women are shrewd tempters with their tongues.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, where are you? what devise you on?</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall we give over Orleans, or no?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, no, I say, distrustful recreants!</div>
                              <div class="line">Fight till the last gasp; I will be your guard.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">What she says I'll confirm: we'll fight it out.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                              <div class="line">Assign'd am I to be the English scourge.</div>
                              <div class="line">This night the siege assuredly I'll raise:</div>
                              <div class="line">Expect Saint Martin's summer, halcyon days,</div>
                              <div class="line">Since I have entered into these wars.</div>
                              <div class="line">Glory is like a circle in the water,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which never ceaseth to enlarge itself</div>
                              <div class="line">Till by broad spreading it disperse to nought.</div>
                              <div class="line">With Henry's death the English circle ends;</div>
                              <div class="line">Dispersed are the glories it included.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now am I like that proud insulting ship</div>
                              <div class="line">Which Caesar and his fortune bare at once.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Was Mahomet inspired with a dove?</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou with an eagle art inspired then.</div>
                              <div class="line">Helen, the mother of great Constantine,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor yet Saint Philip's daughters, were like thee.</div>
                              <div class="line">Bright star of Venus, fall'n down on the earth,</div>
                              <div class="line">How may I reverently worship thee enough?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALENCON</div>
                              <div class="line">Leave off delays, and let us raise the siege.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                              <div class="line">Woman, do what thou canst to save our honours;</div>
                              <div class="line">Drive them from Orleans and be immortalized.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Presently we'll try: come, let's away about it:</div>
                              <div class="line">No prophet will I trust, if she prove false.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III.  London. Before the Tower.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter GLOUCESTER, with his Serving-men in blue coats</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I am come to survey the Tower this day:</div>
                              <div class="line">Since Henry's death, I fear, there is conveyance.</div>
                              <div class="line">Where be these warders, that they wait not here?</div>
                              <div class="line">Open the gates; 'tis Gloucester that calls.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Warder</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Within</span>  Who's there that knocks so imperiously?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Serving-Man</div>
                              <div class="line">It is the noble Duke of Gloucester.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Warder</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Within</span>  Whoe'er he be, you may not be let in.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Serving-Man</div>
                              <div class="line">Villains, answer you so the lord protector?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Warder</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Within</span>  The Lord protect him! so we answer him:</div>
                              <div class="line">We do no otherwise than we are will'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Who willed you? or whose will stands but mine?</div>
                              <div class="line">There's none protector of the realm but I.</div>
                              <div class="line">Break up the gates, I'll be your warrantize.</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall I be flouted thus by dunghill grooms?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Gloucester's men rush at the Tower Gates, and
WOODVILE the Lieutenant speaks within</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WOODVILE</div>
                              <div class="line">What noise is this? what traitors have we here?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Lieutenant, is it you whose voice I hear?</div>
                              <div class="line">Open the gates; here's Gloucester that would enter.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WOODVILE</div>
                              <div class="line">Have patience, noble duke; I may not open;</div>
                              <div class="line">The Cardinal of Winchester forbids:</div>
                              <div class="line">From him I have express commandment</div>
                              <div class="line">That thou nor none of thine shall be let in.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Faint-hearted Woodvile, prizest him 'fore me?</div>
                              <div class="line">Arrogant Winchester, that haughty prelate,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whom Henry, our late sovereign, ne'er could brook?</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou art no friend to God or to the king:</div>
                              <div class="line">Open the gates, or I'll shut thee out shortly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Serving-Men</div>
                              <div class="line">Open the gates unto the lord protector,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or we'll burst them open, if that you come not quickly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter to the Protector at the Tower Gates BISHOP
OF WINCHESTER and his men in tawny coats</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF WINCHESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">How now, ambitious Humphry! what means this?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Peel'd priest, dost thou command me to be shut out?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF WINCHESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I do, thou most usurping proditor,</div>
                              <div class="line">And not protector, of the king or realm.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Stand back, thou manifest conspirator,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou that contrivedst to murder our dead lord;</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou that givest whores indulgences to sin:</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll canvass thee in thy broad cardinal's hat,</div>
                              <div class="line">If thou proceed in this thy insolence.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF WINCHESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, stand thou back, I will not budge a foot:</div>
                              <div class="line">This be Damascus, be thou cursed Cain,</div>
                              <div class="line">To slay thy brother Abel, if thou wilt.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I will not slay thee, but I'll drive thee back:</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy scarlet robes as a child's bearing-cloth</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll use to carry thee out of this place.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF WINCHESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Do what thou darest; I beard thee to thy face.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">What! am I dared and bearded to my face?</div>
                              <div class="line">Draw, men, for all this privileged place;</div>
                              <div class="line">Blue coats to tawny coats. Priest, beware your beard,</div>
                              <div class="line">I mean to tug it and to cuff you soundly:</div>
                              <div class="line">Under my feet I stamp thy cardinal's hat:</div>
                              <div class="line">In spite of pope or dignities of church,</div>
                              <div class="line">Here by the cheeks I'll drag thee up and down.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF WINCHESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Gloucester, thou wilt answer this before the pope.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Winchester goose, I cry, a rope! a rope!</div>
                              <div class="line">Now beat them hence; why do you let them stay?</div>
                              <div class="line">Thee I'll chase hence, thou wolf in sheep's array.</div>
                              <div class="line">Out, tawny coats! out, scarlet hypocrite!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Here GLOUCESTER's men beat out BISHOP OF
WINCHESTER's men, and enter in the hurly-
burly the Mayor of London and his Officers</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Mayor</div>
                              <div class="line">Fie, lords! that you, being supreme magistrates,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thus contumeliously should break the peace!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace, mayor! thou know'st little of my wrongs:</div>
                              <div class="line">Here's Beaufort, that regards nor God nor king,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath here distrain'd the Tower to his use.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF WINCHESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Here's Gloucester, a foe to citizens,</div>
                              <div class="line">One that still motions war and never peace,</div>
                              <div class="line">O'ercharging your free purses with large fines,</div>
                              <div class="line">That seeks to overthrow religion,</div>
                              <div class="line">Because he is protector of the realm,</div>
                              <div class="line">And would have armour here out of the Tower,</div>
                              <div class="line">To crown himself king and suppress the prince.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I will not answer thee with words, but blows.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Here they skirmish again</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Mayor</div>
                              <div class="line">Naught rests for me in this tumultuous strife</div>
                              <div class="line">But to make open proclamation:</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, officer; as loud as e'er thou canst,</div>
                              <div class="line">Cry.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Officer</div>
                              <div class="line">All manner of men assembled here in arms this day</div>
                              <div class="line">against God's peace and the king's, we charge and</div>
                              <div class="line">command you, in his highness' name, to repair to</div>
                              <div class="line">your several dwelling-places; and not to wear,</div>
                              <div class="line">handle, or use any sword, weapon, or dagger,</div>
                              <div class="line">henceforward, upon pain of death.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Cardinal, I'll be no breaker of the law:</div>
                              <div class="line">But we shall meet, and break our minds at large.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF WINCHESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Gloucester, we will meet; to thy cost, be sure:</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy heart-blood I will have for this day's work.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Mayor</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll call for clubs, if you will not away.</div>
                              <div class="line">This cardinal's more haughty than the devil.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Mayor, farewell: thou dost but what thou mayst.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF WINCHESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Abominable Gloucester, guard thy head;</div>
                              <div class="line">For I intend to have it ere long.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt, severally, GLOUCESTER and BISHOP OF
WINCHESTER with their Serving-men</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Mayor</div>
                              <div class="line">See the coast clear'd, and then we will depart.</div>
                              <div class="line">Good God, these nobles should such stomachs bear!</div>
                              <div class="line">I myself fight not once in forty year.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.5">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>4. SCENE IV.  Orleans.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter, on the walls, a Master Gunner and his Boy</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Master-Gunner</div>
                              <div class="line">Sirrah, thou know'st how Orleans is besieged,</div>
                              <div class="line">And how the English have the suburbs won.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Boy</div>
                              <div class="line">Father, I know; and oft have shot at them,</div>
                              <div class="line">Howe'er unfortunate I miss'd my aim.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Master-Gunner</div>
                              <div class="line">But now thou shalt not. Be thou ruled by me:</div>
                              <div class="line">Chief master-gunner am I of this town;</div>
                              <div class="line">Something I must do to procure me grace.</div>
                              <div class="line">The prince's espials have informed me</div>
                              <div class="line">How the English, in the suburbs close intrench'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">Wont, through a secret grate of iron bars</div>
                              <div class="line">In yonder tower, to overpeer the city,</div>
                              <div class="line">And thence discover how with most advantage</div>
                              <div class="line">They may vex us with shot, or with assault.</div>
                              <div class="line">To intercept this inconvenience,</div>
                              <div class="line">A piece of ordnance 'gainst it I have placed;</div>
                              <div class="line">And even these three days have I watch'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">If I could see them.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now do thou watch, for I can stay no longer.</div>
                              <div class="line">If thou spy'st any, run and bring me word;</div>
                              <div class="line">And thou shalt find me at the governor's.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Boy</div>
                              <div class="line">Father, I warrant you; take you no care;</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll never trouble you, if I may spy them.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <p>Enter, on the turrets, SALISBURY and TALBOT,
GLANSDALE, GARGRAVE, and others</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">Talbot, my life, my joy, again return'd!</div>
                              <div class="line">How wert thou handled being prisoner?</div>
                              <div class="line">Or by what means got'st thou to be released?</div>
                              <div class="line">Discourse, I prithee, on this turret's top.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">The Duke of Bedford had a prisoner</div>
                              <div class="line">Call'd the brave Lord Ponton de Santrailles;</div>
                              <div class="line">For him was I exchanged and ransomed.</div>
                              <div class="line">But with a baser man of arms by far</div>
                              <div class="line">Once in contempt they would have barter'd me:</div>
                              <div class="line">Which I, disdaining, scorn'd; and craved death,</div>
                              <div class="line">Rather than I would be so vile esteem'd.</div>
                              <div class="line">In fine, redeem'd I was as I desired.</div>
                              <div class="line">But, O! the treacherous Fastolfe wounds my heart,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whom with my bare fists I would execute,</div>
                              <div class="line">If I now had him brought into my power.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet tell'st thou not how thou wert entertain'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">With scoffs and scorns and contumelious taunts.</div>
                              <div class="line">In open market-place produced they me,</div>
                              <div class="line">To be a public spectacle to all:</div>
                              <div class="line">Here, said they, is the terror of the French,</div>
                              <div class="line">The scarecrow that affrights our children so.</div>
                              <div class="line">Then broke I from the officers that led me,</div>
                              <div class="line">And with my nails digg'd stones out of the ground,</div>
                              <div class="line">To hurl at the beholders of my shame:</div>
                              <div class="line">My grisly countenance made others fly;</div>
                              <div class="line">None durst come near for fear of sudden death.</div>
                              <div class="line">In iron walls they deem'd me not secure;</div>
                              <div class="line">So great fear of my name 'mongst them was spread,</div>
                              <div class="line">That they supposed I could rend bars of steel,</div>
                              <div class="line">And spurn in pieces posts of adamant:</div>
                              <div class="line">Wherefore a guard of chosen shot I had,</div>
                              <div class="line">That walked about me every minute-while;</div>
                              <div class="line">And if I did but stir out of my bed,</div>
                              <div class="line">Ready they were to shoot me to the heart.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter the Boy with a linstock</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">I grieve to hear what torments you endured,</div>
                              <div class="line">But we will be revenged sufficiently</div>
                              <div class="line">Now it is supper-time in Orleans:</div>
                              <div class="line">Here, through this grate, I count each one</div>
                              <div class="line">and view the Frenchmen how they fortify:</div>
                              <div class="line">Let us look in; the sight will much delight thee.</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir Thomas Gargrave, and Sir William Glansdale,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me have your express opinions</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is best place to make our battery next.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GARGRAVE</div>
                              <div class="line">I think, at the north gate; for there stand lords.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLANSDALE</div>
                              <div class="line">And I, here, at the bulwark of the bridge.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">For aught I see, this city must be famish'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or with light skirmishes enfeebled.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Here they shoot. SALISBURY and GARGRAVE fall</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">O Lord, have mercy on us, wretched sinners!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GARGRAVE</div>
                              <div class="line">O Lord, have mercy on me, woful man!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">What chance is this that suddenly hath cross'd us?</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak, Salisbury; at least, if thou canst speak:</div>
                              <div class="line">How farest thou, mirror of all martial men?</div>
                              <div class="line">One of thy eyes and thy cheek's side struck off!</div>
                              <div class="line">Accursed tower! accursed fatal hand</div>
                              <div class="line">That hath contrived this woful tragedy!</div>
                              <div class="line">In thirteen battles Salisbury o'ercame;</div>
                              <div class="line">Henry the Fifth he first train'd to the wars;</div>
                              <div class="line">Whilst any trump did sound, or drum struck up,</div>
                              <div class="line">His sword did ne'er leave striking in the field.</div>
