                              <div class="line">And like a peacock sweep along his tail;</div>
                              <div class="line">We'll pull his plumes and take away his train,</div>
                              <div class="line">If Dauphin and the rest will be but ruled.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">We have been guided by thee hitherto,</div>
                              <div class="line">And of thy cunning had no diffidence:</div>
                              <div class="line">One sudden foil shall never breed distrust.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD OF ORLEANS</div>
                              <div class="line">Search out thy wit for secret policies,</div>
                              <div class="line">And we will make thee famous through the world.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALENCON</div>
                              <div class="line">We'll set thy statue in some holy place,</div>
                              <div class="line">And have thee reverenced like a blessed saint:</div>
                              <div class="line">Employ thee then, sweet virgin, for our good.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                              <div class="line">Then thus it must be; this doth Joan devise:</div>
                              <div class="line">By fair persuasions mix'd with sugar'd words</div>
                              <div class="line">We will entice the Duke of Burgundy</div>
                              <div class="line">To leave the Talbot and to follow us.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, marry, sweeting, if we could do that,</div>
                              <div class="line">France were no place for Henry's warriors;</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor should that nation boast it so with us,</div>
                              <div class="line">But be extirped from our provinces.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALENCON</div>
                              <div class="line">For ever should they be expulsed from France</div>
                              <div class="line">And not have title of an earldom here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                              <div class="line">Your honours shall perceive how I will work</div>
                              <div class="line">To bring this matter to the wished end.</div>
                              <p>Drum sounds afar off</p>
                              <div class="line">Hark! by the sound of drum you may perceive</div>
                              <div class="line">Their powers are marching unto Paris-ward.</div>
                              <p>Here sound an English march. Enter, and pass over
at a distance, TALBOT and his forces</p>
                              <div class="line">There goes the Talbot, with his colours spread,</div>
                              <div class="line">And all the troops of English after him.</div>
                              <p>French march. Enter BURGUNDY and forces</p>
                              <div class="line">Now in the rearward comes the duke and his:</div>
                              <div class="line">Fortune in favour makes him lag behind.</div>
                              <div class="line">Summon a parley; we will talk with him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Trumpets sound a parley</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">A parley with the Duke of Burgundy!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                              <div class="line">Who craves a parley with the Burgundy?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                              <div class="line">The princely Charles of France, thy countryman.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                              <div class="line">What say'st thou, Charles? for I am marching hence.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak, Pucelle, and enchant him with thy words.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                              <div class="line">Brave Burgundy, undoubted hope of France!</div>
                              <div class="line">Stay, let thy humble handmaid speak to thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak on; but be not over-tedious.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                              <div class="line">Look on thy country, look on fertile France,</div>
                              <div class="line">And see the cities and the towns defaced</div>
                              <div class="line">By wasting ruin of the cruel foe.</div>
                              <div class="line">As looks the mother on her lowly babe</div>
                              <div class="line">When death doth close his tender dying eyes,</div>
                              <div class="line">See, see the pining malady of France;</div>
                              <div class="line">Behold the wounds, the most unnatural wounds,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which thou thyself hast given her woful breast.</div>
                              <div class="line">O, turn thy edged sword another way;</div>
                              <div class="line">Strike those that hurt, and hurt not those that help.</div>
                              <div class="line">One drop of blood drawn from thy country's bosom</div>
                              <div class="line">Should grieve thee more than streams of foreign gore:</div>
                              <div class="line">Return thee therefore with a flood of tears,</div>
                              <div class="line">And wash away thy country's stained spots.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                              <div class="line">Either she hath bewitch'd me with her words,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or nature makes me suddenly relent.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                              <div class="line">Besides, all French and France exclaims on thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">Doubting thy birth and lawful progeny.</div>
                              <div class="line">Who joint'st thou with but with a lordly nation</div>
                              <div class="line">That will not trust thee but for profit's sake?</div>
                              <div class="line">When Talbot hath set footing once in France</div>
                              <div class="line">And fashion'd thee that instrument of ill,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who then but English Henry will be lord</div>
                              <div class="line">And thou be thrust out like a fugitive?</div>
                              <div class="line">Call we to mind, and mark but this for proof,</div>
                              <div class="line">Was not the Duke of Orleans thy foe?</div>
                              <div class="line">And was he not in England prisoner?</div>
                              <div class="line">But when they heard he was thine enemy,</div>
                              <div class="line">They set him free without his ransom paid,</div>
                              <div class="line">In spite of Burgundy and all his friends.</div>
                              <div class="line">See, then, thou fight'st against thy countrymen</div>
                              <div class="line">And joint'st with them will be thy slaughtermen.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, come, return; return, thou wandering lord:</div>
                              <div class="line">Charles and the rest will take thee in their arms.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                              <div class="line">I am vanquished; these haughty words of hers</div>
                              <div class="line">Have batter'd me like roaring cannon-shot,</div>
                              <div class="line">And made me almost yield upon my knees.</div>
                              <div class="line">Forgive me, country, and sweet countrymen,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, lords, accept this hearty kind embrace:</div>
                              <div class="line">My forces and my power of men are yours:</div>
                              <div class="line">So farewell, Talbot; I'll no longer trust thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  Done like a Frenchman: turn, and turn again!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Welcome, brave duke! thy friendship makes us fresh.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD OF ORLEANS</div>
                              <div class="line">And doth beget new courage in our breasts.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALENCON</div>
                              <div class="line">Pucelle hath bravely play'd her part in this,</div>
                              <div class="line">And doth deserve a coronet of gold.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Now let us on, my lords, and join our powers,</div>
                              <div class="line">And seek how we may prejudice the foe.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.5">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>4. SCENE IV.  Paris. The palace.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter KING HENRY VI, GLOUCESTER, BISHOP OF
WINCHESTER, YORK, SUFFOLK, SOMERSET, WARWICK,
EXETER, VERNON BASSET, and others. To them
with his Soldiers, TALBOT</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">My gracious prince, and honourable peers,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hearing of your arrival in this realm,</div>
                              <div class="line">I have awhile given truce unto my wars,</div>
                              <div class="line">To do my duty to my sovereign:</div>
                              <div class="line">In sign, whereof, this arm, that hath reclaim'd</div>
                              <div class="line">To your obedience fifty fortresses,</div>
                              <div class="line">Twelve cities and seven walled towns of strength,</div>
                              <div class="line">Beside five hundred prisoners of esteem,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lets fall his sword before your highness' feet,</div>
                              <div class="line">And with submissive loyalty of heart</div>
                              <div class="line">Ascribes the glory of his conquest got</div>
                              <div class="line">First to my God and next unto your grace.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Kneels</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Is this the Lord Talbot, uncle Gloucester,</div>
                              <div class="line">That hath so long been resident in France?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, if it please your majesty, my liege.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Welcome, brave captain and victorious lord!</div>
                              <div class="line">When I was young, as yet I am not old,</div>
                              <div class="line">I do remember how my father said</div>
                              <div class="line">A stouter champion never handled sword.</div>
                              <div class="line">Long since we were resolved of your truth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your faithful service and your toil in war;</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet never have you tasted our reward,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or been reguerdon'd with so much as thanks,</div>
                              <div class="line">Because till now we never saw your face:</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore, stand up; and, for these good deserts,</div>
                              <div class="line">We here create you Earl of Shrewsbury;</div>
                              <div class="line">And in our coronation take your place.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Sennet. Flourish. Exeunt all but VERNON and BASSET</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, sir, to you, that were so hot at sea,</div>
                              <div class="line">Disgracing of these colours that I wear</div>
                              <div class="line">In honour of my noble Lord of York:</div>
                              <div class="line">Darest thou maintain the former words thou spakest?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSET</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, sir; as well as you dare patronage</div>
                              <div class="line">The envious barking of your saucy tongue</div>
                              <div class="line">Against my lord the Duke of Somerset.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                              <div class="line">Sirrah, thy lord I honour as he is.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSET</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, what is he? as good a man as York.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                              <div class="line">Hark ye; not so: in witness, take ye that.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Strikes him</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSET</div>
                              <div class="line">Villain, thou know'st the law of arms is such</div>
                              <div class="line">That whoso draws a sword, 'tis present death,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or else this blow should broach thy dearest blood.</div>
                              <div class="line">But I'll unto his majesty, and crave</div>
                              <div class="line">I may have liberty to venge this wrong;</div>
                              <div class="line">When thou shalt see I'll meet thee to thy cost.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, miscreant, I'll be there as soon as you;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, after, meet you sooner than you would.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.6">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 4. ACT IV</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.2">1. SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.3">2. SCENE II.  Before Bourdeaux.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.4">3. SCENE III.  Plains in Gascony.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.5">4. SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.6">5. SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.7">6. SCENE VI.  A field of battle.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.8">7. SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  Paris. A hall of state.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter KING HENRY VI, GLOUCESTER, BISHOP OF
WINCHESTER, YORK, SUFFOLK, SOMERSET, WARWICK,
TALBOT, EXETER, the Governor, of Paris, and others</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Lord bishop, set the crown upon his head.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF WINCHESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">God save King Henry, of that name the sixth!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, governor of Paris, take your oath,</div>
                              <div class="line">That you elect no other king but him;</div>
                              <div class="line">Esteem none friends but such as are his friends,</div>
                              <div class="line">And none your foes but such as shall pretend</div>
                              <div class="line">Malicious practises against his state:</div>
                              <div class="line">This shall ye do, so help you righteous God!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter FASTOLFE</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FASTOLFE</div>
                              <div class="line">My gracious sovereign, as I rode from Calais,</div>
                              <div class="line">To haste unto your coronation,</div>
                              <div class="line">A letter was deliver'd to my hands,</div>
                              <div class="line">Writ to your grace from the Duke of Burgundy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Shame to the Duke of Burgundy and thee!</div>
                              <div class="line">I vow'd, base knight, when I did meet thee next,</div>
                              <div class="line">To tear the garter from thy craven's leg,</div>
                              <p>Plucking it off</p>
                              <div class="line">Which I have done, because unworthily</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou wast installed in that high degree.</div>
                              <div class="line">Pardon me, princely Henry, and the rest</div>
                              <div class="line">This dastard, at the battle of Patay,</div>
                              <div class="line">When but in all I was six thousand strong</div>
                              <div class="line">And that the French were almost ten to one,</div>
                              <div class="line">Before we met or that a stroke was given,</div>
                              <div class="line">Like to a trusty squire did run away:</div>
                              <div class="line">In which assault we lost twelve hundred men;</div>
                              <div class="line">Myself and divers gentlemen beside</div>
                              <div class="line">Were there surprised and taken prisoners.</div>
                              <div class="line">Then judge, great lords, if I have done amiss;</div>
                              <div class="line">Or whether that such cowards ought to wear</div>
                              <div class="line">This ornament of knighthood, yea or no.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">To say the truth, this fact was infamous</div>
                              <div class="line">And ill beseeming any common man,</div>
                              <div class="line">Much more a knight, a captain and a leader.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">When first this order was ordain'd, my lords,</div>
                              <div class="line">Knights of the garter were of noble birth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Valiant and virtuous, full of haughty courage,</div>
                              <div class="line">Such as were grown to credit by the wars;</div>
                              <div class="line">Not fearing death, nor shrinking for distress,</div>
                              <div class="line">But always resolute in most extremes.</div>
                              <div class="line">He then that is not furnish'd in this sort</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth but usurp the sacred name of knight,</div>
                              <div class="line">Profaning this most honourable order,</div>
                              <div class="line">And should, if I were worthy to be judge,</div>
                              <div class="line">Be quite degraded, like a hedge-born swain</div>
                              <div class="line">That doth presume to boast of gentle blood.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Stain to thy countrymen, thou hear'st thy doom!</div>
                              <div class="line">Be packing, therefore, thou that wast a knight:</div>
                              <div class="line">Henceforth we banish thee, on pain of death.</div>
                              <p>Exit FASTOLFE</p>
                              <div class="line">And now, my lord protector, view the letter</div>
                              <div class="line">Sent from our uncle Duke of Burgundy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">What means his grace, that he hath changed his style?</div>
                              <div class="line">No more but, plain and bluntly, 'To the king!'</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath he forgot he is his sovereign?</div>
                              <div class="line">Or doth this churlish superscription</div>
                              <div class="line">Pretend some alteration in good will?</div>
                              <div class="line">What's here?</div>
                              <p>Reads</p>
                              <div class="line">'I have, upon especial cause,</div>
                              <div class="line">Moved with compassion of my country's wreck,</div>
                              <div class="line">Together with the pitiful complaints</div>
                              <div class="line">Of such as your oppression feeds upon,</div>
                              <div class="line">Forsaken your pernicious faction</div>
                              <div class="line">And join'd with Charles, the rightful King of France.'</div>
                              <div class="line">O monstrous treachery! can this be so,</div>
                              <div class="line">That in alliance, amity and oaths,</div>
                              <div class="line">There should be found such false dissembling guile?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">What! doth my uncle Burgundy revolt?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">He doth, my lord, and is become your foe.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Is that the worst this letter doth contain?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">It is the worst, and all, my lord, he writes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, then, Lord Talbot there shall talk with him</div>
                              <div class="line">And give him chastisement for this abuse.</div>
                              <div class="line">How say you, my lord? are you not content?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Content, my liege! yes, but that I am prevented,</div>
                              <div class="line">I should have begg'd I might have been employ'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Then gather strength and march unto him straight:</div>
                              <div class="line">Let him perceive how ill we brook his treason</div>
                              <div class="line">And what offence it is to flout his friends.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">I go, my lord, in heart desiring still</div>
                              <div class="line">You may behold confusion of your foes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <p>Enter VERNON and BASSET</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                              <div class="line">Grant me the combat, gracious sovereign.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSET</div>
                              <div class="line">And me, my lord, grant me the combat too.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">This is my servant: hear him, noble prince.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">And this is mine: sweet Henry, favour him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Be patient, lords; and give them leave to speak.</div>
                              <div class="line">Say, gentlemen, what makes you thus exclaim?</div>
                              <div class="line">And wherefore crave you combat? or with whom?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                              <div class="line">With him, my lord; for he hath done me wrong.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSET</div>
                              <div class="line">And I with him; for he hath done me wrong.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">What is that wrong whereof you both complain?</div>
                              <div class="line">First let me know, and then I'll answer you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSET</div>
                              <div class="line">Crossing the sea from England into France,</div>
                              <div class="line">This fellow here, with envious carping tongue,</div>
                              <div class="line">Upbraided me about the rose I wear;</div>
                              <div class="line">Saying, the sanguine colour of the leaves</div>
                              <div class="line">Did represent my master's blushing cheeks,</div>
                              <div class="line">When stubbornly he did repugn the truth</div>
                              <div class="line">About a certain question in the law</div>
                              <div class="line">Argued betwixt the Duke of York and him;</div>
                              <div class="line">With other vile and ignominious terms:</div>
                              <div class="line">In confutation of which rude reproach</div>
                              <div class="line">And in defence of my lord's worthiness,</div>
                              <div class="line">I crave the benefit of law of arms.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                              <div class="line">And that is my petition, noble lord:</div>
                              <div class="line">For though he seem with forged quaint conceit</div>
                              <div class="line">To set a gloss upon his bold intent,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet know, my lord, I was provoked by him;</div>
                              <div class="line">And he first took exceptions at this badge,</div>
                              <div class="line">Pronouncing that the paleness of this flower</div>
                              <div class="line">Bewray'd the faintness of my master's heart.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Will not this malice, Somerset, be left?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">Your private grudge, my Lord of York, will out,</div>
                              <div class="line">Though ne'er so cunningly you smother it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Good Lord, what madness rules in brainsick men,</div>
                              <div class="line">When for so slight and frivolous a cause</div>
                              <div class="line">Such factious emulations shall arise!</div>
                              <div class="line">Good cousins both, of York and Somerset,</div>
                              <div class="line">Quiet yourselves, I pray, and be at peace.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Let this dissension first be tried by fight,</div>
                              <div class="line">And then your highness shall command a peace.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">The quarrel toucheth none but us alone;</div>
                              <div class="line">Betwixt ourselves let us decide it then.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">There is my pledge; accept it, Somerset.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VERNON</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, let it rest where it began at first.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSET</div>
                              <div class="line">Confirm it so, mine honourable lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Confirm it so! Confounded be your strife!</div>
                              <div class="line">And perish ye, with your audacious prate!</div>
                              <div class="line">Presumptuous vassals, are you not ashamed</div>
                              <div class="line">With this immodest clamorous outrage</div>
                              <div class="line">To trouble and disturb the king and us?</div>
                              <div class="line">And you, my lords, methinks you do not well</div>
                              <div class="line">To bear with their perverse objections;</div>
                              <div class="line">Much less to take occasion from their mouths</div>
                              <div class="line">To raise a mutiny betwixt yourselves:</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me persuade you take a better course.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                              <div class="line">It grieves his highness: good my lords, be friends.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Come hither, you that would be combatants:</div>
                              <div class="line">Henceforth I charge you, as you love our favour,</div>
                              <div class="line">Quite to forget this quarrel and the cause.</div>
                              <div class="line">And you, my lords, remember where we are,</div>
                              <div class="line">In France, amongst a fickle wavering nation:</div>
                              <div class="line">If they perceive dissension in our looks</div>
                              <div class="line">And that within ourselves we disagree,</div>
                              <div class="line">How will their grudging stomachs be provoked</div>
                              <div class="line">To wilful disobedience, and rebel!</div>
                              <div class="line">Beside, what infamy will there arise,</div>
                              <div class="line">When foreign princes shall be certified</div>
                              <div class="line">That for a toy, a thing of no regard,</div>
                              <div class="line">King Henry's peers and chief nobility</div>
                              <div class="line">Destroy'd themselves, and lost the realm of France!</div>
                              <div class="line">O, think upon the conquest of my father,</div>
                              <div class="line">My tender years, and let us not forego</div>
                              <div class="line">That for a trifle that was bought with blood</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me be umpire in this doubtful strife.</div>
                              <div class="line">I see no reason, if I wear this rose,</div>
                              <p>Putting on a red rose</p>
                              <div class="line">That any one should therefore be suspicious</div>
                              <div class="line">I more incline to Somerset than York:</div>
                              <div class="line">Both are my kinsmen, and I love them both:</div>
                              <div class="line">As well they may upbraid me with my crown,</div>
                              <div class="line">Because, forsooth, the king of Scots is crown'd.</div>
                              <div class="line">But your discretions better can persuade</div>
                              <div class="line">Than I am able to instruct or teach:</div>
                              <div class="line">And therefore, as we hither came in peace,</div>
                              <div class="line">So let us still continue peace and love.</div>
                              <div class="line">Cousin of York, we institute your grace</div>
                              <div class="line">To be our regent in these parts of France:</div>
                              <div class="line">And, good my Lord of Somerset, unite</div>
                              <div class="line">Your troops of horsemen with his bands of foot;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, like true subjects, sons of your progenitors,</div>
                              <div class="line">Go cheerfully together and digest.</div>
                              <div class="line">Your angry choler on your enemies.</div>
                              <div class="line">Ourself, my lord protector and the rest</div>
                              <div class="line">After some respite will return to Calais;</div>
                              <div class="line">From thence to England; where I hope ere long</div>
                              <div class="line">To be presented, by your victories,</div>
                              <div class="line">With Charles, Alencon and that traitorous rout.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Flourish. Exeunt all but YORK, WARWICK, EXETER
and VERNON</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">My Lord of York, I promise you, the king</div>
                              <div class="line">Prettily, methought, did play the orator.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">And so he did; but yet I like it not,</div>
                              <div class="line">In that he wears the badge of Somerset.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Tush, that was but his fancy, blame him not;</div>
                              <div class="line">I dare presume, sweet prince, he thought no harm.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">An if I wist he did,--but let it rest;</div>
                              <div class="line">Other affairs must now be managed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt all but EXETER</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                              <div class="line">Well didst thou, Richard, to suppress thy voice;</div>
                              <div class="line">For, had the passions of thy heart burst out,</div>
                              <div class="line">I fear we should have seen decipher'd there</div>
                              <div class="line">More rancorous spite, more furious raging broils,</div>
                              <div class="line">Than yet can be imagined or supposed.</div>
                              <div class="line">But howsoe'er, no simple man that sees</div>
                              <div class="line">This jarring discord of nobility,</div>
                              <div class="line">This shouldering of each other in the court,</div>
                              <div class="line">This factious bandying of their favourites,</div>
                              <div class="line">But that it doth presage some ill event.</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis much when sceptres are in children's hands;</div>
                              <div class="line">But more when envy breeds unkind division;</div>
                              <div class="line">There comes the rain, there begins confusion.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  Before Bourdeaux.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter TALBOT, with trump and drum</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Go to the gates of Bourdeaux, trumpeter:</div>
                              <div class="line">Summon their general unto the wall.</div>
                              <p>Trumpet sounds. Enter General and others, aloft</p>
                              <div class="line">English John Talbot, captains, calls you forth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Servant in arms to Harry King of England;</div>
                              <div class="line">And thus he would: Open your city gates;</div>
                              <div class="line">Be humble to us; call my sovereign yours,</div>
                              <div class="line">And do him homage as obedient subjects;</div>
                              <div class="line">And I'll withdraw me and my bloody power:</div>
                              <div class="line">But, if you frown upon this proffer'd peace,</div>
                              <div class="line">You tempt the fury of my three attendants,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lean famine, quartering steel, and climbing fire;</div>
                              <div class="line">Who in a moment even with the earth</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall lay your stately and air-braving towers,</div>
                              <div class="line">If you forsake the offer of their love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">General</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou ominous and fearful owl of death,</div>
                              <div class="line">Our nation's terror and their bloody scourge!</div>
                              <div class="line">The period of thy tyranny approacheth.</div>
                              <div class="line">On us thou canst not enter but by death;</div>
                              <div class="line">For, I protest, we are well fortified</div>
                              <div class="line">And strong enough to issue out and fight:</div>
                              <div class="line">If thou retire, the Dauphin, well appointed,</div>
                              <div class="line">Stands with the snares of war to tangle thee:</div>
                              <div class="line">On either hand thee there are squadrons pitch'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">To wall thee from the liberty of flight;</div>
                              <div class="line">And no way canst thou turn thee for redress,</div>
                              <div class="line">But death doth front thee with apparent spoil</div>
                              <div class="line">And pale destruction meets thee in the face.</div>
                              <div class="line">Ten thousand French have ta'en the sacrament</div>
                              <div class="line">To rive their dangerous artillery</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon no Christian soul but English Talbot.</div>
                              <div class="line">Lo, there thou stand'st, a breathing valiant man,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of an invincible unconquer'd spirit!</div>
                              <div class="line">This is the latest glory of thy praise</div>
                              <div class="line">That I, thy enemy, due thee withal;</div>
                              <div class="line">For ere the glass, that now begins to run,</div>
                              <div class="line">Finish the process of his sandy hour,</div>
                              <div class="line">These eyes, that see thee now well coloured,</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall see thee wither'd, bloody, pale and dead.</div>
                              <p>Drum afar off</p>
                              <div class="line">Hark! hark! the Dauphin's drum, a warning bell,</div>
                              <div class="line">Sings heavy music to thy timorous soul;</div>
                              <div class="line">And mine shall ring thy dire departure out.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt General, &c</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">He fables not; I hear the enemy:</div>
                              <div class="line">Out, some light horsemen, and peruse their wings.</div>
                              <div class="line">O, negligent and heedless discipline!</div>
                              <div class="line">How are we park'd and bounded in a pale,</div>
                              <div class="line">A little herd of England's timorous deer,</div>
                              <div class="line">Mazed with a yelping kennel of French curs!</div>
                              <div class="line">If we be English deer, be then in blood;</div>
                              <div class="line">Not rascal-like, to fall down with a pinch,</div>
                              <div class="line">But rather, moody-mad and desperate stags,</div>
                              <div class="line">Turn on the bloody hounds with heads of steel</div>
                              <div class="line">And make the cowards stand aloof at bay:</div>
                              <div class="line">Sell every man his life as dear as mine,</div>
                              <div class="line">And they shall find dear deer of us, my friends.</div>
                              <div class="line">God and Saint George, Talbot and England's right,</div>
                              <div class="line">Prosper our colours in this dangerous fight!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III.  Plains in Gascony.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter a Messenger that meets YORK. Enter YORK
with trumpet and many Soldiers</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Are not the speedy scouts return'd again,</div>
                              <div class="line">That dogg'd the mighty army of the Dauphin?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">They are return'd, my lord, and give it out</div>
                              <div class="line">That he is march'd to Bourdeaux with his power,</div>
                              <div class="line">To fight with Talbot: as he march'd along,</div>
                              <div class="line">By your espials were discovered</div>
                              <div class="line">Two mightier troops than that the Dauphin led,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which join'd with him and made their march for Bourdeaux.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">A plague upon that villain Somerset,</div>
                              <div class="line">That thus delays my promised supply</div>
                              <div class="line">Of horsemen, that were levied for this siege!</div>
                              <div class="line">Renowned Talbot doth expect my aid,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I am lowted by a traitor villain</div>
                              <div class="line">And cannot help the noble chevalier:</div>
                              <div class="line">God comfort him in this necessity!</div>
                              <div class="line">If he miscarry, farewell wars in France.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter Sir William LUCY</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou princely leader of our English strength,</div>
                              <div class="line">Never so needful on the earth of France,</div>
                              <div class="line">Spur to the rescue of the noble Talbot,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who now is girdled with a waist of iron</div>
                              <div class="line">And hemm'd about with grim destruction:</div>
                              <div class="line">To Bourdeaux, warlike duke! to Bourdeaux, York!</div>
                              <div class="line">Else, farewell Talbot, France, and England's honour.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">O God, that Somerset, who in proud heart</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth stop my cornets, were in Talbot's place!</div>
                              <div class="line">So should we save a valiant gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">By forfeiting a traitor and a coward.</div>
                              <div class="line">Mad ire and wrathful fury makes me weep,</div>
                              <div class="line">That thus we die, while remiss traitors sleep.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                              <div class="line">O, send some succor to the distress'd lord!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">He dies, we lose; I break my warlike word;</div>
                              <div class="line">We mourn, France smiles; we lose, they daily get;</div>
                              <div class="line">All 'long of this vile traitor Somerset.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                              <div class="line">Then God take mercy on brave Talbot's soul;</div>
                              <div class="line">And on his son young John, who two hours since</div>
                              <div class="line">I met in travel toward his warlike father!</div>
                              <div class="line">This seven years did not Talbot see his son;</div>
                              <div class="line">And now they meet where both their lives are done.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, what joy shall noble Talbot have</div>
                              <div class="line">To bid his young son welcome to his grave?</div>
                              <div class="line">Away! vexation almost stops my breath,</div>
                              <div class="line">That sunder'd friends greet in the hour of death.</div>
                              <div class="line">Lucy, farewell; no more my fortune can,</div>
                              <div class="line">But curse the cause I cannot aid the man.</div>
                              <div class="line">Maine, Blois, Poictiers, and Tours, are won away,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Long all of Somerset and his delay.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit, with his soldiers</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                              <div class="line">Thus, while the vulture of sedition</div>
                              <div class="line">Feeds in the bosom of such great commanders,</div>
                              <div class="line">Sleeping neglection doth betray to loss</div>
                              <div class="line">The conquest of our scarce cold conqueror,</div>
                              <div class="line">That ever living man of memory,</div>
                              <div class="line">Henry the Fifth: whiles they each other cross,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lives, honours, lands and all hurry to loss.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.5">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>4. SCENE IV.  Other plains in Gascony.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter SOMERSET, with his army; a Captain of
TALBOT's with him</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">It is too late; I cannot send them now:</div>
                              <div class="line">This expedition was by York and Talbot</div>
                              <div class="line">Too rashly plotted: all our general force</div>
                              <div class="line">Might with a sally of the very town</div>
                              <div class="line">Be buckled with: the over-daring Talbot</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath sullied all his gloss of former honour</div>
                              <div class="line">By this unheedful, desperate, wild adventure:</div>
                              <div class="line">York set him on to fight and die in shame,</div>
                              <div class="line">That, Talbot dead, great York might bear the name.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Captain</div>
                              <div class="line">Here is Sir William Lucy, who with me</div>
                              <div class="line">Set from our o'ermatch'd forces forth for aid.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter Sir William LUCY</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">How now, Sir William! whither were you sent?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                              <div class="line">Whither, my lord? from bought and sold Lord Talbot;</div>
                              <div class="line">Who, ring'd about with bold adversity,</div>
                              <div class="line">Cries out for noble York and Somerset,</div>
                              <div class="line">To beat assailing death from his weak legions:</div>
                              <div class="line">And whiles the honourable captain there</div>
                              <div class="line">Drops bloody sweat from his war-wearied limbs,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, in advantage lingering, looks for rescue,</div>
                              <div class="line">You, his false hopes, the trust of England's honour,</div>
                              <div class="line">Keep off aloof with worthless emulation.</div>
                              <div class="line">Let not your private discord keep away</div>
                              <div class="line">The levied succors that should lend him aid,</div>
                              <div class="line">While he, renowned noble gentleman,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yields up his life unto a world of odds:</div>
                              <div class="line">Orleans the Bastard, Charles, Burgundy,</div>
                              <div class="line">Alencon, Reignier, compass him about,</div>
                              <div class="line">And Talbot perisheth by your default.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">York set him on; York should have sent him aid.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                              <div class="line">And York as fast upon your grace exclaims;</div>
                              <div class="line">Swearing that you withhold his levied host,</div>
                              <div class="line">Collected for this expedition.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">York lies; he might have sent and had the horse;</div>
                              <div class="line">I owe him little duty, and less love;</div>
                              <div class="line">And take foul scorn to fawn on him by sending.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                              <div class="line">The fraud of England, not the force of France,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath now entrapp'd the noble-minded Talbot:</div>
                              <div class="line">Never to England shall he bear his life;</div>
                              <div class="line">But dies, betray'd to fortune by your strife.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, go; I will dispatch the horsemen straight:</div>
                              <div class="line">Within six hours they will be at his aid.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                              <div class="line">Too late comes rescue: he is ta'en or slain;</div>
                              <div class="line">For fly he could not, if he would have fled;</div>
                              <div class="line">And fly would Talbot never, though he might.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SOMERSET</div>
                              <div class="line">If he be dead, brave Talbot, then adieu!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                              <div class="line">His fame lives in the world, his shame in you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.6">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>5. SCENE V.  The English camp near Bourdeaux.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter TALBOT and JOHN his son</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">O young John Talbot! I did send for thee</div>
                              <div class="line">To tutor thee in stratagems of war,</div>
                              <div class="line">That Talbot's name might be in thee revived</div>
                              <div class="line">When sapless age and weak unable limbs</div>
                              <div class="line">Should bring thy father to his drooping chair.</div>
                              <div class="line">But, O malignant and ill-boding stars!</div>
                              <div class="line">Now thou art come unto a feast of death,</div>
                              <div class="line">A terrible and unavoided danger:</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore, dear boy, mount on my swiftest horse;</div>
                              <div class="line">And I'll direct thee how thou shalt escape</div>
                              <div class="line">By sudden flight: come, dally not, be gone.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOHN TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Is my name Talbot? and am I your son?</div>
                              <div class="line">And shall I fly? O if you love my mother,</div>
                              <div class="line">Dishonour not her honourable name,</div>
                              <div class="line">To make a bastard and a slave of me!</div>
                              <div class="line">The world will say, he is not Talbot's blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">That basely fled when noble Talbot stood.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Fly, to revenge my death, if I be slain.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOHN TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">He that flies so will ne'er return again.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">If we both stay, we both are sure to die.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOHN TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Then let me stay; and, father, do you fly:</div>
                              <div class="line">Your loss is great, so your regard should be;</div>
                              <div class="line">My worth unknown, no loss is known in me.</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon my death the French can little boast;</div>
                              <div class="line">In yours they will, in you all hopes are lost.</div>
                              <div class="line">Flight cannot stain the honour you have won;</div>
                              <div class="line">But mine it will, that no exploit have done:</div>
