                              <div class="line">You fled for vantage, everyone will swear;</div>
                              <div class="line">But, if I bow, they'll say it was for fear.</div>
                              <div class="line">There is no hope that ever I will stay,</div>
                              <div class="line">If the first hour I shrink and run away.</div>
                              <div class="line">Here on my knee I beg mortality,</div>
                              <div class="line">Rather than life preserved with infamy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall all thy mother's hopes lie in one tomb?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOHN TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, rather than I'll shame my mother's womb.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon my blessing, I command thee go.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOHN TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">To fight I will, but not to fly the foe.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Part of thy father may be saved in thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOHN TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">No part of him but will be shame in me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou never hadst renown, nor canst not lose it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOHN TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, your renowned name: shall flight abuse it?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy father's charge shall clear thee from that stain.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOHN TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">You cannot witness for me, being slain.</div>
                              <div class="line">If death be so apparent, then both fly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">And leave my followers here to fight and die?</div>
                              <div class="line">My age was never tainted with such shame.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOHN TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">And shall my youth be guilty of such blame?</div>
                              <div class="line">No more can I be sever'd from your side,</div>
                              <div class="line">Than can yourself yourself in twain divide:</div>
                              <div class="line">Stay, go, do what you will, the like do I;</div>
                              <div class="line">For live I will not, if my father die.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Then here I take my leave of thee, fair son,</div>
                              <div class="line">Born to eclipse thy life this afternoon.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, side by side together live and die.</div>
                              <div class="line">And soul with soul from France to heaven fly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.7">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>6. SCENE VI.  A field of battle.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Alarum: excursions, wherein JOHN TALBOT is
hemmed about, and TALBOT rescues him</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Saint George and victory! fight, soldiers, fight.</div>
                              <div class="line">The regent hath with Talbot broke his word</div>
                              <div class="line">And left us to the rage of France his sword.</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is John Talbot? Pause, and take thy breath;</div>
                              <div class="line">I gave thee life and rescued thee from death.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOHN TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">O, twice my father, twice am I thy son!</div>
                              <div class="line">The life thou gavest me first was lost and done,</div>
                              <div class="line">Till with thy warlike sword, despite of late,</div>
                              <div class="line">To my determined time thou gavest new date.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">When from the Dauphin's crest thy sword struck fire,</div>
                              <div class="line">It warm'd thy father's heart with proud desire</div>
                              <div class="line">Of bold-faced victory. Then leaden age,</div>
                              <div class="line">Quicken'd with youthful spleen and warlike rage,</div>
                              <div class="line">Beat down Alencon, Orleans, Burgundy,</div>
                              <div class="line">And from the pride of Gallia rescued thee.</div>
                              <div class="line">The ireful bastard Orleans, that drew blood</div>
                              <div class="line">From thee, my boy, and had the maidenhood</div>
                              <div class="line">Of thy first fight, I soon encountered,</div>
                              <div class="line">And interchanging blows I quickly shed</div>
                              <div class="line">Some of his bastard blood; and in disgrace</div>
                              <div class="line">Bespoke him thus; 'Contaminated, base</div>
                              <div class="line">And misbegotten blood I spill of thine,</div>
                              <div class="line">Mean and right poor, for that pure blood of mine</div>
                              <div class="line">Which thou didst force from Talbot, my brave boy:'</div>
                              <div class="line">Here, purposing the Bastard to destroy,</div>
                              <div class="line">Came in strong rescue. Speak, thy father's care,</div>
                              <div class="line">Art thou not weary, John? how dost thou fare?</div>
                              <div class="line">Wilt thou yet leave the battle, boy, and fly,</div>
                              <div class="line">Now thou art seal'd the son of chivalry?</div>
                              <div class="line">Fly, to revenge my death when I am dead:</div>
                              <div class="line">The help of one stands me in little stead.</div>
                              <div class="line">O, too much folly is it, well I wot,</div>
                              <div class="line">To hazard all our lives in one small boat!</div>
                              <div class="line">If I to-day die not with Frenchmen's rage,</div>
                              <div class="line">To-morrow I shall die with mickle age:</div>
                              <div class="line">By me they nothing gain an if I stay;</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis but the shortening of my life one day:</div>
                              <div class="line">In thee thy mother dies, our household's name,</div>
                              <div class="line">My death's revenge, thy youth, and England's fame:</div>
                              <div class="line">All these and more we hazard by thy stay;</div>
                              <div class="line">All these are saved if thou wilt fly away.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOHN TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">The sword of Orleans hath not made me smart;</div>
                              <div class="line">These words of yours draw life-blood from my heart:</div>
                              <div class="line">On that advantage, bought with such a shame,</div>
                              <div class="line">To save a paltry life and slay bright fame,</div>
                              <div class="line">Before young Talbot from old Talbot fly,</div>
                              <div class="line">The coward horse that bears me fail and die!</div>
                              <div class="line">And like me to the peasant boys of France,</div>
                              <div class="line">To be shame's scorn and subject of mischance!</div>
                              <div class="line">Surely, by all the glory you have won,</div>
                              <div class="line">An if I fly, I am not Talbot's son:</div>
                              <div class="line">Then talk no more of flight, it is no boot;</div>
                              <div class="line">If son to Talbot, die at Talbot's foot.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Then follow thou thy desperate sire of Crete,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou Icarus; thy life to me is sweet:</div>
                              <div class="line">If thou wilt fight, fight by thy father's side;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, commendable proved, let's die in pride.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.8">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>7. SCENE VII.  Another part of the field.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Alarum: excursions. Enter TALBOT led by a Servant</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is my other life? mine own is gone;</div>
                              <div class="line">O, where's young Talbot? where is valiant John?</div>
                              <div class="line">Triumphant death, smear'd with captivity,</div>
                              <div class="line">Young Talbot's valour makes me smile at thee:</div>
                              <div class="line">When he perceived me shrink and on my knee,</div>
                              <div class="line">His bloody sword he brandish'd over me,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, like a hungry lion, did commence</div>
                              <div class="line">Rough deeds of rage and stern impatience;</div>
                              <div class="line">But when my angry guardant stood alone,</div>
                              <div class="line">Tendering my ruin and assail'd of none,</div>
                              <div class="line">Dizzy-eyed fury and great rage of heart</div>
                              <div class="line">Suddenly made him from my side to start</div>
                              <div class="line">Into the clustering battle of the French;</div>
                              <div class="line">And in that sea of blood my boy did drench</div>
                              <div class="line">His over-mounting spirit, and there died,</div>
                              <div class="line">My Icarus, my blossom, in his pride.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                              <div class="line">O, my dear lord, lo, where your son is borne!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter Soldiers, with the body of JOHN TALBOT</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TALBOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou antic death, which laugh'st us here to scorn,</div>
                              <div class="line">Anon, from thy insulting tyranny,</div>
                              <div class="line">Coupled in bonds of perpetuity,</div>
                              <div class="line">Two Talbots, winged through the lither sky,</div>
                              <div class="line">In thy despite shall 'scape mortality.</div>
                              <div class="line">O, thou, whose wounds become hard-favour'd death,</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak to thy father ere thou yield thy breath!</div>
                              <div class="line">Brave death by speaking, whether he will or no;</div>
                              <div class="line">Imagine him a Frenchman and thy foe.</div>
                              <div class="line">Poor boy! he smiles, methinks, as who should say,</div>
                              <div class="line">Had death been French, then death had died to-day.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, come and lay him in his father's arms:</div>
                              <div class="line">My spirit can no longer bear these harms.</div>
                              <div class="line">Soldiers, adieu! I have what I would have,</div>
                              <div class="line">Now my old arms are young John Talbot's grave.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Dies</p>
                        <p>Enter CHARLES, ALENCON, BURGUNDY, BASTARD OF
ORLEANS, JOAN LA PUCELLE, and forces</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Had York and Somerset brought rescue in,</div>
                              <div class="line">We should have found a bloody day of this.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD OF ORLEANS</div>
                              <div class="line">How the young whelp of Talbot's, raging-wood,</div>
                              <div class="line">Did flesh his puny sword in Frenchmen's blood!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                              <div class="line">Once I encounter'd him, and thus I said:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Thou maiden youth, be vanquish'd by a maid:'</div>
                              <div class="line">But, with a proud majestical high scorn,</div>
                              <div class="line">He answer'd thus: 'Young Talbot was not born</div>
                              <div class="line">To be the pillage of a giglot wench:'</div>
                              <div class="line">So, rushing in the bowels of the French,</div>
                              <div class="line">He left me proudly, as unworthy fight.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                              <div class="line">Doubtless he would have made a noble knight;</div>
                              <div class="line">See, where he lies inhearsed in the arms</div>
                              <div class="line">Of the most bloody nurser of his harms!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD OF ORLEANS</div>
                              <div class="line">Hew them to pieces, hack their bones asunder</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose life was England's glory, Gallia's wonder.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">O, no, forbear! for that which we have fled</div>
                              <div class="line">During the life, let us not wrong it dead.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter Sir William LUCY, attended; Herald of the
French preceding</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                              <div class="line">Herald, conduct me to the Dauphin's tent,</div>
                              <div class="line">To know who hath obtained the glory of the day.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">On what submissive message art thou sent?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                              <div class="line">Submission, Dauphin! 'tis a mere French word;</div>
                              <div class="line">We English warriors wot not what it means.</div>
                              <div class="line">I come to know what prisoners thou hast ta'en</div>
                              <div class="line">And to survey the bodies of the dead.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">For prisoners ask'st thou? hell our prison is.</div>
                              <div class="line">But tell me whom thou seek'st.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                              <div class="line">But where's the great Alcides of the field,</div>
                              <div class="line">Valiant Lord Talbot, Earl of Shrewsbury,</div>
                              <div class="line">Created, for his rare success in arms,</div>
                              <div class="line">Great Earl of Washford, Waterford and Valence;</div>
                              <div class="line">Lord Talbot of Goodrig and Urchinfield,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lord Strange of Blackmere, Lord Verdun of Alton,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lord Cromwell of Wingfield, Lord Furnival of Sheffield,</div>
                              <div class="line">The thrice-victorious Lord of Falconbridge;</div>
                              <div class="line">Knight of the noble order of Saint George,</div>
                              <div class="line">Worthy Saint Michael and the Golden Fleece;</div>
                              <div class="line">Great marshal to Henry the Sixth</div>
                              <div class="line">Of all his wars within the realm of France?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                              <div class="line">Here is a silly stately style indeed!</div>
                              <div class="line">The Turk, that two and fifty kingdoms hath,</div>
                              <div class="line">Writes not so tedious a style as this.</div>
                              <div class="line">Him that thou magnifiest with all these titles</div>
                              <div class="line">Stinking and fly-blown lies here at our feet.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                              <div class="line">Is Talbot slain, the Frenchmen's only scourge,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your kingdom's terror and black Nemesis?</div>
                              <div class="line">O, were mine eyeballs into bullets turn'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">That I in rage might shoot them at your faces!</div>
                              <div class="line">O, that I could but call these dead to life!</div>
                              <div class="line">It were enough to fright the realm of France:</div>
                              <div class="line">Were but his picture left amongst you here,</div>
                              <div class="line">It would amaze the proudest of you all.</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me their bodies, that I may bear them hence</div>
                              <div class="line">And give them burial as beseems their worth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                              <div class="line">I think this upstart is old Talbot's ghost,</div>
                              <div class="line">He speaks with such a proud commanding spirit.</div>
                              <div class="line">For God's sake let him have 'em; to keep them here,</div>
                              <div class="line">They would but stink, and putrefy the air.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, take their bodies hence.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LUCY</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll bear them hence; but from their ashes shall be rear'd</div>
                              <div class="line">A phoenix that shall make all France afeard.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">So we be rid of them, do with 'em what thou wilt.</div>
                              <div class="line">And now to Paris, in this conquering vein:</div>
                              <div class="line">All will be ours, now bloody Talbot's slain.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.7">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 5. ACT V</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  London. The palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  France. Plains in Anjou.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III.  Before Angiers.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.5">4. SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.6">5. SCENE V.  London. The palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  London. The palace.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Sennet. Enter KING HENRY VI, GLOUCESTER, and EXETER</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Have you perused the letters from the pope,</div>
                              <div class="line">The emperor and the Earl of Armagnac?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I have, my lord: and their intent is this:</div>
                              <div class="line">They humbly sue unto your excellence</div>
                              <div class="line">To have a godly peace concluded of</div>
                              <div class="line">Between the realms of England and of France.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">How doth your grace affect their motion?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, my good lord; and as the only means</div>
                              <div class="line">To stop effusion of our Christian blood</div>
                              <div class="line">And 'stablish quietness on every side.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, marry, uncle; for I always thought</div>
                              <div class="line">It was both impious and unnatural</div>
                              <div class="line">That such immanity and bloody strife</div>
                              <div class="line">Should reign among professors of one faith.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Beside, my lord, the sooner to effect</div>
                              <div class="line">And surer bind this knot of amity,</div>
                              <div class="line">The Earl of Armagnac, near knit to Charles,</div>
                              <div class="line">A man of great authority in France,</div>
                              <div class="line">Proffers his only daughter to your grace</div>
                              <div class="line">In marriage, with a large and sumptuous dowry.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">Marriage, uncle! alas, my years are young!</div>
                              <div class="line">And fitter is my study and my books</div>
                              <div class="line">Than wanton dalliance with a paramour.</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet call the ambassador; and, as you please,</div>
                              <div class="line">So let them have their answers every one:</div>
                              <div class="line">I shall be well content with any choice</div>
                              <div class="line">Tends to God's glory and my country's weal.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER in Cardinal's habit,
a Legate and two Ambassadors</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EXETER</div>
                              <div class="line">What! is my Lord of Winchester install'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">And call'd unto a cardinal's degree?</div>
                              <div class="line">Then I perceive that will be verified</div>
                              <div class="line">Henry the Fifth did sometime prophesy,</div>
                              <div class="line">'If once he come to be a cardinal,</div>
                              <div class="line">He'll make his cap co-equal with the crown.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">My lords ambassadors, your several suits</div>
                              <div class="line">Have been consider'd and debated on.</div>
                              <div class="line">And therefore are we certainly resolved</div>
                              <div class="line">To draw conditions of a friendly peace;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which by my Lord of Winchester we mean</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall be transported presently to France.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">And for the proffer of my lord your master,</div>
                              <div class="line">I have inform'd his highness so at large</div>
                              <div class="line">As liking of the lady's virtuous gifts,</div>
                              <div class="line">Her beauty and the value of her dower,</div>
                              <div class="line">He doth intend she shall be England's queen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VI</div>
                              <div class="line">In argument and proof of which contract,</div>
                              <div class="line">Bear her this jewel, pledge of my affection.</div>
                              <div class="line">And so, my lord protector, see them guarded</div>
                              <div class="line">And safely brought to Dover; where inshipp'd</div>
                              <div class="line">Commit them to the fortune of the sea.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt all but CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER and Legate</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Stay, my lord legate: you shall first receive</div>
                              <div class="line">The sum of money which I promised</div>
                              <div class="line">Should be deliver'd to his holiness</div>
                              <div class="line">For clothing me in these grave ornaments.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Legate</div>
                              <div class="line">I will attend upon your lordship's leisure.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  Now Winchester will not submit, I trow,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or be inferior to the proudest peer.</div>
                              <div class="line">Humphrey of Gloucester, thou shalt well perceive</div>
                              <div class="line">That, neither in birth or for authority,</div>
                              <div class="line">The bishop will be overborne by thee:</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll either make thee stoop and bend thy knee,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or sack this country with a mutiny.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  France. Plains in Anjou.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter CHARLES, BURGUNDY, ALENCON, BASTARD OF
ORLEANS, REIGNIER, JOAN LA PUCELLE, and forces</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">These news, my lord, may cheer our drooping spirits:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis said the stout Parisians do revolt</div>
                              <div class="line">And turn again unto the warlike French.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALENCON</div>
                              <div class="line">Then march to Paris, royal Charles of France,</div>
                              <div class="line">And keep not back your powers in dalliance.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace be amongst them, if they turn to us;</div>
                              <div class="line">Else, ruin combat with their palaces!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter Scout</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Scout</div>
                              <div class="line">Success unto our valiant general,</div>
                              <div class="line">And happiness to his accomplices!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">What tidings send our scouts? I prithee, speak.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Scout</div>
                              <div class="line">The English army, that divided was</div>
                              <div class="line">Into two parties, is now conjoined in one,</div>
                              <div class="line">And means to give you battle presently.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Somewhat too sudden, sirs, the warning is;</div>
                              <div class="line">But we will presently provide for them.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BURGUNDY</div>
                              <div class="line">I trust the ghost of Talbot is not there:</div>
                              <div class="line">Now he is gone, my lord, you need not fear.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                              <div class="line">Of all base passions, fear is most accursed.</div>
                              <div class="line">Command the conquest, Charles, it shall be thine,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let Henry fret and all the world repine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHARLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Then on, my lords; and France be fortunate!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III.  Before Angiers.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Alarum. Excursions. Enter JOAN LA PUCELLE</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                              <div class="line">The regent conquers, and the Frenchmen fly.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now help, ye charming spells and periapts;</div>
                              <div class="line">And ye choice spirits that admonish me</div>
                              <div class="line">And give me signs of future accidents.</div>
                              <p>Thunder</p>
                              <div class="line">You speedy helpers, that are substitutes</div>
                              <div class="line">Under the lordly monarch of the north,</div>
                              <div class="line">Appear and aid me in this enterprise.</div>
                              <p>Enter Fiends</p>
                              <div class="line">This speedy and quick appearance argues proof</div>
                              <div class="line">Of your accustom'd diligence to me.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, ye familiar spirits, that are cull'd</div>
                              <div class="line">Out of the powerful regions under earth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Help me this once, that France may get the field.</div>
                              <p>They walk, and speak not</p>
                              <div class="line">O, hold me not with silence over-long!</div>
                              <div class="line">Where I was wont to feed you with my blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll lop a member off and give it you</div>
                              <div class="line">In earnest of further benefit,</div>
                              <div class="line">So you do condescend to help me now.</div>
                              <p>They hang their heads</p>
                              <div class="line">No hope to have redress? My body shall</div>
                              <div class="line">Pay recompense, if you will grant my suit.</div>
                              <p>They shake their heads</p>
                              <div class="line">Cannot my body nor blood-sacrifice</div>
                              <div class="line">Entreat you to your wonted furtherance?</div>
                              <div class="line">Then take my soul, my body, soul and all,</div>
                              <div class="line">Before that England give the French the foil.</div>
                              <p>They depart</p>
                              <div class="line">See, they forsake me! Now the time is come</div>
                              <div class="line">That France must vail her lofty-plumed crest</div>
                              <div class="line">And let her head fall into England's lap.</div>
                              <div class="line">My ancient incantations are too weak,</div>
                              <div class="line">And hell too strong for me to buckle with:</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, France, thy glory droopeth to the dust.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <p>Excursions. Re-enter JOAN LA PUCELLE fighting hand
to hand with YORK JOAN LA PUCELLE is taken. The
French fly</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Damsel of France, I think I have you fast:</div>
                              <div class="line">Unchain your spirits now with spelling charms</div>
                              <div class="line">And try if they can gain your liberty.</div>
                              <div class="line">A goodly prize, fit for the devil's grace!</div>
                              <div class="line">See, how the ugly wench doth bend her brows,</div>
                              <div class="line">As if with Circe she would change my shape!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                              <div class="line">Changed to a worser shape thou canst not be.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">O, Charles the Dauphin is a proper man;</div>
                              <div class="line">No shape but his can please your dainty eye.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                              <div class="line">A plaguing mischief light on Charles and thee!</div>
                              <div class="line">And may ye both be suddenly surprised</div>
                              <div class="line">By bloody hands, in sleeping on your beds!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Fell banning hag, enchantress, hold thy tongue!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JOAN LA PUCELLE</div>
                              <div class="line">I prithee, give me leave to curse awhile.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Curse, miscreant, when thou comest to the stake.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                        <p>Alarum. Enter SUFFOLK with MARGARET in his hand</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Be what thou wilt, thou art my prisoner.</div>
                              <p>Gazes on her</p>
                              <div class="line">O fairest beauty, do not fear nor fly!</div>
                              <div class="line">For I will touch thee but with reverent hands;</div>
                              <div class="line">I kiss these fingers for eternal peace,</div>
                              <div class="line">And lay them gently on thy tender side.</div>
                              <div class="line">Who art thou? say, that I may honour thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Margaret my name, and daughter to a king,</div>
                              <div class="line">The King of Naples, whosoe'er thou art.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">An earl I am, and Suffolk am I call'd.</div>
                              <div class="line">Be not offended, nature's miracle,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou art allotted to be ta'en by me:</div>
                              <div class="line">So doth the swan her downy cygnets save,</div>
                              <div class="line">Keeping them prisoner underneath her wings.</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet, if this servile usage once offend.</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, and be free again, as Suffolk's friend.</div>
                              <p>She is going</p>
                              <div class="line">O, stay! I have no power to let her pass;</div>
                              <div class="line">My hand would free her, but my heart says no</div>
                              <div class="line">As plays the sun upon the glassy streams,</div>
                              <div class="line">Twinkling another counterfeited beam,</div>
                              <div class="line">So seems this gorgeous beauty to mine eyes.</div>
                              <div class="line">Fain would I woo her, yet I dare not speak:</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll call for pen and ink, and write my mind.</div>
                              <div class="line">Fie, de la Pole! disable not thyself;</div>
                              <div class="line">Hast not a tongue? is she not here?</div>
                              <div class="line">Wilt thou be daunted at a woman's sight?</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, beauty's princely majesty is such,</div>
                              <div class="line">Confounds the tongue and makes the senses rough.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Say, Earl of Suffolk--if thy name be so--</div>
                              <div class="line">What ransom must I pay before I pass?</div>
                              <div class="line">For I perceive I am thy prisoner.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">How canst thou tell she will deny thy suit,</div>
                              <div class="line">Before thou make a trial of her love?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Why speak'st thou not? what ransom must I pay?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">She's beautiful, and therefore to be woo'd;</div>
                              <div class="line">She is a woman, therefore to be won.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Wilt thou accept of ransom? yea, or no.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Fond man, remember that thou hast a wife;</div>
                              <div class="line">Then how can Margaret be thy paramour?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">I were best to leave him, for he will not hear.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">There all is marr'd; there lies a cooling card.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">He talks at random; sure, the man is mad.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet a dispensation may be had.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet I would that you would answer me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll win this Lady Margaret. For whom?</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, for my king: tush, that's a wooden thing!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">He talks of wood: it is some carpenter.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet so my fancy may be satisfied,</div>
                              <div class="line">And peace established between these realms</div>
                              <div class="line">But there remains a scruple in that too;</div>
                              <div class="line">For though her father be the King of Naples,</div>
                              <div class="line">Duke of Anjou and Maine, yet is he poor,</div>
                              <div class="line">And our nobility will scorn the match.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Hear ye, captain, are you not at leisure?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">It shall be so, disdain they ne'er so much.</div>
                              <div class="line">Henry is youthful and will quickly yield.</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, I have a secret to reveal.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">What though I be enthrall'd? he seems a knight,</div>
                              <div class="line">And will not any way dishonour me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Lady, vouchsafe to listen what I say.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Perhaps I shall be rescued by the French;</div>
                              <div class="line">And then I need not crave his courtesy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet madam, give me a hearing in a cause--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Tush, women have been captivate ere now.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Lady, wherefore talk you so?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">I cry you mercy, 'tis but Quid for Quo.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Say, gentle princess, would you not suppose</div>
                              <div class="line">Your bondage happy, to be made a queen?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">To be a queen in bondage is more vile</div>
                              <div class="line">Than is a slave in base servility;</div>
                              <div class="line">For princes should be free.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">And so shall you,</div>
                              <div class="line">If happy England's royal king be free.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, what concerns his freedom unto me?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll undertake to make thee Henry's queen,</div>
                              <div class="line">To put a golden sceptre in thy hand</div>
                              <div class="line">And set a precious crown upon thy head,</div>
                              <div class="line">If thou wilt condescend to be my--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">What?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">His love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">I am unworthy to be Henry's wife.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">No, gentle madam; I unworthy am</div>
                              <div class="line">To woo so fair a dame to be his wife,</div>
                              <div class="line">And have no portion in the choice myself.</div>
                              <div class="line">How say you, madam, are ye so content?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">An if my father please, I am content.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Then call our captains and our colours forth.</div>
                              <div class="line">And, madam, at your father's castle walls</div>
                              <div class="line">We'll crave a parley, to confer with him.</div>
                              <p>A parley sounded. Enter REIGNIER on the walls</p>
                              <div class="line">See, Reignier, see, thy daughter prisoner!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                              <div class="line">To whom?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">To me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                              <div class="line">Suffolk, what remedy?</div>
                              <div class="line">I am a soldier, and unapt to weep,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or to exclaim on fortune's fickleness.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, there is remedy enough, my lord:</div>
                              <div class="line">Consent, and for thy honour give consent,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy daughter shall be wedded to my king;</div>
                              <div class="line">Whom I with pain have woo'd and won thereto;</div>
                              <div class="line">And this her easy-held imprisonment</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath gained thy daughter princely liberty.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                              <div class="line">Speaks Suffolk as he thinks?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Fair Margaret knows</div>
                              <div class="line">That Suffolk doth not flatter, face, or feign.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon thy princely warrant, I descend</div>
                              <div class="line">To give thee answer of thy just demand.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit from the walls</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">And here I will expect thy coming.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Trumpets sound. Enter REIGNIER, below</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                              <div class="line">Welcome, brave earl, into our territories:</div>
                              <div class="line">Command in Anjou what your honour pleases.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Thanks, Reignier, happy for so sweet a child,</div>
                              <div class="line">Fit to be made companion with a king:</div>
                              <div class="line">What answer makes your grace unto my suit?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                              <div class="line">Since thou dost deign to woo her little worth</div>
                              <div class="line">To be the princely bride of such a lord;</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon condition I may quietly</div>
                              <div class="line">Enjoy mine own, the country Maine and Anjou,</div>
                              <div class="line">Free from oppression or the stroke of war,</div>
                              <div class="line">My daughter shall be Henry's, if he please.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">That is her ransom; I deliver her;</div>
                              <div class="line">And those two counties I will undertake</div>
                              <div class="line">Your grace shall well and quietly enjoy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                              <div class="line">And I again, in Henry's royal name,</div>
                              <div class="line">As deputy unto that gracious king,</div>
                              <div class="line">Give thee her hand, for sign of plighted faith.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Reignier of France, I give thee kingly thanks,</div>
                              <div class="line">Because this is in traffic of a king.</div>
                              <p>Aside</p>
                              <div class="line">And yet, methinks, I could be well content</div>
                              <div class="line">To be mine own attorney in this case.</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll over then to England with this news,</div>
                              <div class="line">And make this marriage to be solemnized.</div>
                              <div class="line">So farewell, Reignier: set this diamond safe</div>
                              <div class="line">In golden palaces, as it becomes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">REIGNIER</div>
                              <div class="line">I do embrace thee, as I would embrace</div>
                              <div class="line">The Christian prince, King Henry, were he here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Farewell, my lord: good wishes, praise and prayers</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall Suffolk ever have of Margaret.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Going</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Farewell, sweet madam: but hark you, Margaret;</div>
                              <div class="line">No princely commendations to my king?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Such commendations as becomes a maid,</div>
                              <div class="line">A virgin and his servant, say to him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Words sweetly placed and modestly directed.</div>
                              <div class="line">But madam, I must trouble you again;</div>
                              <div class="line">No loving token to his majesty?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, my good lord, a pure unspotted heart,</div>
                              <div class="line">Never yet taint with love, I send the king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">And this withal.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Kisses her</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">That for thyself: I will not so presume</div>
                              <div class="line">To send such peevish tokens to a king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt REIGNIER and MARGARET</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">O, wert thou for myself! But, Suffolk, stay;</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou mayst not wander in that labyrinth;</div>
                              <div class="line">There Minotaurs and ugly treasons lurk.</div>
                              <div class="line">Solicit Henry with her wondrous praise:</div>
                              <div class="line">Bethink thee on her virtues that surmount,</div>
                              <div class="line">And natural graces that extinguish art;</div>
                              <div class="line">Repeat their semblance often on the seas,</div>
                              <div class="line">That, when thou comest to kneel at Henry's feet,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou mayst bereave him of his wits with wonder.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.5">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>4. SCENE IV.  Camp of the YORK in Anjou.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
